We are growing fast and searching for top Systems Engineering talent.We seeking to employ Senior Software Engineers to join our growing team. Ideally you will be degree qualified in an appropriate IT discipline and have at least 6 years professional experience using tools such as React, Node JS, and Dev Ops skills in an AWS environment using Kafka and Splunk.We are a fast paced consulting business and service customers typically in the banking and finance sector. We work hard to deliver for our customers requirements, however, we also have fun along the way with meetups, social evets and have a focus on continuing your technical and broader capability development, along the way.Your duties and responsibilities will include participating in Agile sessions to elicit User Requirements, Systems Design, Programming, Unit and Systems Testing to produce high quality applications.We are always on the lookout for self motivated and capable Software Engineers, Senior Data Engineers and Dev Ops practitioners to join our team and deliver high quality work.We value initiative and the ability to lead from example where our team can support each other along the way.We offer very attractive salaries and conditions including, careers leave, maternity leave and paid further education opportunities.If this sounds of interest to you and you'd like to explore these exciting opportunities please send us your CV. for a confidential conversation.Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Fixed term, SubcontractContract length: 12 monthsSalary: From $94,278.63 per yearBenefits:Employee mentoring programProfessional development assistanceVisa sponsorshipWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplementary Pay:Annual bonusAbility to commute/relocate:Sydney NSW: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) We are growing fast and searching for top Systems Engineering talent.We seeking to employ Senior Software Engineers to join our growing team. #LI-CB1

The Team:

Our sales team works with a best-of-breed product that solves real problems for our customers. Sellers follow a well-defined methodology that helps them identify the customer's unique needs and clearly convey the value of the Datadog product. Whether you're looking to learn from the best or be the best, the Datadog sales team is dedicated to furthering personal development and team success.


The Opportunity:

Over the last six years our product has exploded in the market with year over year revenue growth. Today thousands of customers love and trust Datadog. We're scaling our Customer Success team to proactively drive adoption across our existing customer base through on-boarding, up-selling and cross selling. You'll advocate for the customer internally and focus on a positive customer experience. Check out some of our customer stories here.


You Will:

Partner with sales team to ensure smooth transition and on-boarding experience

Run the full sales cycle for any opportunity for any existing customer account

Proactively build relationships with customers to achieve loyalty

Identify growth opportunities and bring them to close

Act as advisor to customers to ensure they're leveraging the solution effectively

Monitor and identify usage trends to uncover renewal risks and support greater adoption rates

Collaborate cross-functionally with internal Datadog teams (support, product, finance, and legal)

You Are:

Customer-minded, always trying to provide the most value possible

Passionate about building long term and lasting relationships

Excited by working in an ever-evolving and fluid solution focused environment

Driven by the ability to make a visible impact with your work

A strong communicator with excellent attention to detail

Experienced in independently negotiating contract terms and overcoming pricing objections for up-sell/cross sell activities

Bonus Points:

Have prior Customer Success and/or Sales experience

Have experience dealing with DevOps stakeholders in the past

Bold on the phones, and creative in your emails

Experienced in the SaaS/cloud industry

Familiar with Salesforce, Tableau and other industry specific programs

Why You Should Apply:

Continuous career development and pathing opportunities

Sales training in MEDDIC and Command of the Message

Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space

Best in breed onboarding

Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally

New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan

Generous and competitive benefits

Friendly and inclusive workplace culture

Healthy work/life balance with discretionary unlimited paid time off

About Datadog:

Datadog is the monitoring and security platform for cloud applications. Our SaaS product is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries to enable digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers' entire technology stack, allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally. Given the resilience of cloud technologies and importance placed today in digital operations and agility, Datadog continues to innovate and is well positioned for the long term.

Equal Opportunity at Datadog:

Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.


Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog's Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice. #LI-CB1

What is the focus of the role?
Our Service and Operations unit encompasses management, systems, and workflow of the field workforce arm of Telstra. This large unit manages a portfolio of service and product contracts, including construction programs, installation and maintenance, and the despatch of field Technicians across Australia.
As the Systems Specialist, you will provide specialist analysis, design, development and deployment in specific systems, having due regard for how this technology inter-works with other technologies, to deliver products and infrastructure to defined service level standards.
Key responsibilities include:
Translate customer (internal, external or regulatory) needs and requirements, using technical principles into realisable products, services, or systems in a timely, quality and cost-effective way to ensure operational capability to deliver customer service
Assess capability of vendor solutions and offerings to meet business requirements and manage vendor technology delivery
Make system investment and business asset recommendations and assessments based on extensive knowledge of new and emerging technologies
Ensure system solutions are integrated with Telstra’s activation, assurance and billing processes, and meet operational requirements
Govern all changes to the system product(s) which includes reviewing and providing endorsement of any changes, ensuring that changes are in line with the product purpose and vision
To be successful in this role, you’ll have:
High knowledge of Field Service Management systems or equivalent essential
High Web Developer using C#, Javascript essential
High experience developing API and microservices essential
Moderate Artificial Intelligence experience using Python, R preferred
Moderate experience with Robotic Process Automation using BluePrism and PowerAutomate
Moderate Database and SQL preferably Microsoft, Oracle, Postgres
System Testing & Deployment experience
ITIL Fundamental, Agile / Dev Ops Certifications and Jira experience highly desirable
Strengths continual development
Demonstrated capability of leading in a virtual team environment
Android Developer desirable
If this opportunity sounds like a perfect fit for you, we'd encourage you to apply!
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce in all its forms. We encourage applicants from diverse gender, cultural and linguistic backgrounds and applicants who may be living with a disability. We also offer flexibility in all our roles, to ensure everyone can participate.
To learn more about how we support our people, including accessibility adjustments we can provide you through the recruitment process, visit tel.st/thrive.
-
Recruitment Start Date – 12/08/2022
Recruitment End Date – 09/09/2022

Melbourne, Australia
 2903029
Job Description
What is the role about?
Every weekend across Australia, dozens of sporting events are broadcast. Each and every one requires multiple data links to be created and torn down a few hours later. This is a process ripe for automation and that is precisely what we are doing.
Naturally, such a task requires an experienced person to design, orchestrate and integrate complex systems.
Sound like you?
What are we looking for?
An excellent opportunity has become available for a highly motivated and passionate Senior Software Engineer to join the Media Software team (Broadband & Media). This role is suited to a candidate who has a strong desire to desig, develop and integrate high quality software solutions that support automation, orchestration, and Order to Activate (O2A) process improvements across domestic and international media services.
The successful candidate should have prior experience with:
Establishing software/network design patterns that integrate with third party applications (API integrations)
Liaising with internal and external stakeholders to enable connectivity and integration requirements
Significant experience in Java & JavaScript programming languages (additional skills in Node.js would be advantageous)
Have prior experience working in an agile team and being a team player
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer!
As a Senior Software Engineer, you thrive on understanding and translating customer needs into new products and capability. You apply deep technical expertise and experience in software application layer solutions, to develop and deliver scalable design blueprints across the end-to-end software development life cycle. Your continuous learning and improvement mindset, collaboration and influencing skills are critical to success in this role.
Key Responsibilities
As a Senior Software Engineer, you apply deep experience and technical know-how in the Software Engineering domain to:
Design, build and maintain multiple complex software application technologies and their interaction with Telstra processes and systems
Develop innovative software that maintains data/ network security management, and leverage set processes to reduce the time between commission and production
Authentically engage with and influence a multi-stakeholder landscape to translate customer needs into leading-edge software application products, services or systems that meet Telstra’s time, cost and quality standards
Collaborate with team members and key stakeholders, seeking support, direction and buy-in to gather deep insights about the challenges and opportunities of our software application technologies and platforms
Significantly contribute to continuous improvement initiatives of our systems and processes, to help define ‘best practice’ corporate testing standards and drive improved outcomes (e.g. productivity, customer experience and/or profitability)
Lead initiatives or components of initiatives in line with the strategic direction of your team/mission, that have a significant degree of impact to the function or cross-functionally
Take ownership of your own actions and decisions to drive positive outcomes within your team/mission, and provide guidance to more junior engineers in order to support their development and contribution to team/mission outcomes
About you
To be successful in the role, you'll bring skills and experience in:
Essential
Establishing software/network design patterns that integrate with third party applications (API integrations)
Have prior experience working in an agile team and being a team player
Experience writing technical software/network design documentation
API Development & Integration
Continuous improvement
Growth/Learning mindset
Applying relevant agile practices
Dev ops Practices
Highly Desirable
Liaising with internal and external stakeholders to enable connectivity and integration requirements.
Experience with CI/CD and developing test mocks and harnesses for testing discrete microservices
Front/Back-end development
Experience with AWS cloud management
Cloud networking experience
If this opportunity sounds like a perfect fit for you, we'd encourage you to apply!
___________________________
If you only meet some of the requirements for this role, that's okay!!! We value a diverse range of backgrounds & ideas and believe this is fundamental for our future success. So, if you have the curiosity to learn and the willingness to teach what you know, we'd love to hear from you.
Bonus points if you have:Problem-solving attitudeCollaborative team spirit
We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of their age, cultural background, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, or anything else.
Benefits @ WiproFlexible/remote working culture – location is not a limitation of success at Wipro.Global Travel & Relocation opportunities – COVID permitting.Paid Parental Leave.Excellent Remuneration Package.Quarterly bonus/variable pay.Quarterly Career Progression Reviews – we do not limit our employees to the usual once-per-year reviews!Novated Lease & Salary Sacrifice.Reduced Corporate Healthcare Rates.Fringe, Concession + Membership & Subscription Tax Benefits.Financial Advisory & Banking Benefits.Free Ongoing training and development to help you reach your full potential.Collaborative team - positive and empathetic people who love to laugh either through social
. Distancing in the office or virtually from home!Team building, fun activities, and social events – COVID permitting.
Join us in many countries, and see full career opportunities here.
About Us:
We are Wipro (NYSE: WIT), a rapidly expanding and leading global Information Technology,
Consulting and Business Process Services company with over 225,000 employees worldwide, servicing clients in 175+ cities and 69 countries across 6 continents. For more information, please visit www.wipro.com
With over 5,500 employees in projects across Australia/New Zealand, we are committed to
increasing localization and diversity. We serve over 200 customers across diverse industry segments, with at least a third listed in the ASX100. We started our journey in Australia 20 years ago and this has been a pioneer of new age, disruptive and transformative innovations. We believe in the power of diversity in the workforce, and we encourage applications from people of all
diverse backgrounds, with a focus including, but not limited to Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islanders, Women in Technology, Sex/Gender diversity, disability, racial & cultural diversity, sexual orientation + others.

Job Description
What is the role about?
Every weekend across Australia, dozens of sporting events are broadcast. Each and every one requires multiple data links to be created and torn down a few hours later. This is a process ripe for automation and that is precisely what we are doing.
Naturally, such a task requires an experienced person to design, orchestrate and integrate complex systems.
Sound like you?
What are we looking for?
An excellent opportunity has become available for a highly motivated and passionate Senior Software Engineer to join the Media Software team (Broadband & Media). This role is suited to a candidate who has a strong desire to desig, develop and integrate high quality software solutions that support automation, orchestration, and Order to Activate (O2A) process improvements across domestic and international media services.
The successful candidate should have prior experience with:
Establishing software/network design patterns that integrate with third party applications (API integrations)
Liaising with internal and external stakeholders to enable connectivity and integration requirements
Significant experience in Java & JavaScript programming languages (additional skills in Node.js would be advantageous)
Have prior experience working in an agile team and being a team player
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer!
As a Senior Software Engineer, you thrive on understanding and translating customer needs into new products and capability. You apply deep technical expertise and experience in software application layer solutions, to develop and deliver scalable design blueprints across the end-to-end software development life cycle. Your continuous learning and improvement mindset, collaboration and influencing skills are critical to success in this role.
Key Responsibilities
As a Senior Software Engineer, you apply deep experience and technical know-how in the Software Engineering domain to:
Design, build and maintain multiple complex software application technologies and their interaction with Telstra processes and systems
Develop innovative software that maintains data/ network security management, and leverage set processes to reduce the time between commission and production
Authentically engage with and influence a multi-stakeholder landscape to translate customer needs into leading-edge software application products, services or systems that meet Telstra’s time, cost and quality standards
Collaborate with team members and key stakeholders, seeking support, direction and buy-in to gather deep insights about the challenges and opportunities of our software application technologies and platforms
Significantly contribute to continuous improvement initiatives of our systems and processes, to help define ‘best practice’ corporate testing standards and drive improved outcomes (e.g. productivity, customer experience and/or profitability)
Lead initiatives or components of initiatives in line with the strategic direction of your team/mission, that have a significant degree of impact to the function or cross-functionally
Take ownership of your own actions and decisions to drive positive outcomes within your team/mission, and provide guidance to more junior engineers in order to support their development and contribution to team/mission outcomes
About you
To be successful in the role, you'll bring skills and experience in:
Essential
Establishing software/network design patterns that integrate with third party applications (API integrations)
Have prior experience working in an agile team and being a team player
Experience writing technical software/network design documentation
API Development & Integration
Continuous improvement
Growth/Learning mindset
Applying relevant agile practices
Dev ops Practices
Highly Desirable
Liaising with internal and external stakeholders to enable connectivity and integration requirements.
Experience with CI/CD and developing test mocks and harnesses for testing discrete microservices
Front/Back-end development
Experience with AWS cloud management
Cloud networking experience
If this opportunity sounds like a perfect fit for you, we'd encourage you to apply!
___________________________
If you only meet some of the requirements for this role, that's okay!!! We value a diverse range of backgrounds & ideas and believe this is fundamental for our future success. So, if you have the curiosity to learn and the willingness to teach what you know, we'd love to hear from you.
Bonus points if you have:Problem-solving attitudeCollaborative team spirit
We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of their age, cultural background, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, or anything else.
Benefits @ WiproFlexible/remote working culture – location is not a limitation of success at Wipro.Global Travel & Relocation opportunities – COVID permitting.Paid Parental Leave.Excellent Remuneration Package.Quarterly bonus/variable pay.Quarterly Career Progression Reviews – we do not limit our employees to the usual once-per-year reviews!Novated Lease & Salary Sacrifice.Reduced Corporate Healthcare Rates.Fringe, Concession + Membership & Subscription Tax Benefits.Financial Advisory & Banking Benefits.Free Ongoing training and development to help you reach your full potential.Collaborative team - positive and empathetic people who love to laugh either through social
. Distancing in the office or virtually from home!Team building, fun activities, and social events – COVID permitting.
Join us in many countries, and see full career opportunities here.

PMO consultancy, which works closely with a number of private and government clients, has a newly created role for a Test Analyst opened. This role has come about due to new initiatives from their client base over the next few years.

The Testing Analysts will primarily conduct tests for all configuration changes for the platform’s solutions. The Testing analyst will design, develop, and administer a series of tests and evaluations that identify any potential issues with platform configuration before its general release to their client base.

Some duties many include:

Analysing users stories and/use cases/requirements for validity and feasibility
Collaborate closely with Development Teams, Solutions Architect and Client Teams
Design, develop and execute all levels of testing of all configurations changes in Development and SIT Environments
Design and develop test automation where possible
Detect, raise and track software defects and inconsistencies to closure
Provide timely solutions for any defects identified
Provide Testing support and documentation in Azure Dev Ops
Design, develop and review appropriate metrics needed to evaluate test performance and platform quality by developing relevant dashboards and reports. Actively drive consulting firm in increasing the Testing Maturity


Ideally you will have some of the following:

Tertiary Qualifications in IT is preferred.
You must be an Australian citizen and will possess or be willing to go through the process to obtain and maintain a (Baseline, NV1) personnel security clearance.
At least 2-4 years’ experience in testing position
Able to research and write up a project related brief
Automated testing (desirable)
Azure DevOps, JIRA or similar tools
Strong attention to detail.
Ability to see the big picture.
Planning and organizational skills.
Proficiency in document and report writing.
Ability to work in a team.
Awareness of Software Development Life Cycle.
Logical and critical thinking skills.
Proficiency with Agile Development software.


If you’d like to hear more, please apply for a confidential chat. job_title: Dev Ops Lead in a Metaverse Project
listing_jobDesc:
The company is looking for Dev Ops Lead who is liable for automating all the manual tasks for developing and deploying code and data to implement continuous deployment and continuous integration frameworks. You will also be held responsible for maintaining the high availability of production and non-production work environment.

Responsibilities

Research, Design, and Develop cloud infrastructure, continuous integrity/deployment process for blockchain projects such as defi / NFT with highly reliable, available, and scalable web-scale distributed systems.

Participate in deciding your team’s roadmap in collaboration with Management and Product teams

Collaborate effectively with product managers towards building the right features.

Estimate and manage deliveries of features in a predictable manner.

Continuously contribute to improving our tech ecosystem, libraries, frameworks, and services.

Collaborate, mentor, and guide team members as needed.

Requirements

Must have: 3 plus years of DevOps experience

Strong experience with any cloud platform – AWSAbility to do deep problem solving and build elegant, maintainable solutions to complex problems.

Ability to build complete CI workflows in any CI provider (Github Action, AWS CodeBuild...)Strong knowledge of maintaining and tuning SQL/NoSQL databases, messaging systems

Strong knowledge of containerization and orchestration technologies as Infrastructure-as-Code systems such as Terraform, Chef, Puppet, Ansible, etc.

Hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Grafana

Familiarity with ChatOps/DevSecOps/GitOps is a big advantage.

Basic knowledge in popular public & enterprise blockchains, cryptocurrency, smart contracts (Solidity).

Hands-on experience in any backend languages: Java, Go, etc...

Knowledge of computer science, system design, computer networking, cybersecurity.

To hear more about this role you can :

1. email - neil@cryptorecruit.com

Cryptorecruit are the worlds leading specialist recruiter for the blockchain/Cryptocurrency industry. We recruit positions from CEO,CTO, Project Manager, Solidity developer, frontend and Backend Blockchain developers to marketing/sales and customer service roles. Please browse our website and at www.cryptorecruit.com to search all our job vacancies. The company is looking for Dev Ops Lead who is liable for automating all the manual tasks for developing and deploying code and data to implement continuous deployment and continuous integration frameworks. You will also be held responsible for maintaining the high availability of production and non-production work environment.

Responsibilities

Role Description
Working on-site with our clients as part of a delivery team, a Verint Technical Consultant’s role is to analyse, interpret and develop a solution to challenging customer requirements using the Verint Engagement Management platform. You will be exposed to the entire SDLC while being responsible for implementing custom business processes. As a professional developer, you will assist with software quality processes and mentoring of junior business process developers.
Key Performance Area: Business Process Development
Develop Verint Engagement Management Business and Workflow Processes
Challenge Requirements through appropriate channels
Utilise appropriate integration mechanisms (REST Web services, Message queues, SOAP) to interface with external systems
Implement custom user interfaces using core web technologies (HTML, CSS, javascript)
Suggest creative methods of combining our solutions with the customer’s environment / web applications using modern integration opportunities (APIs, Web Hooks etc)
Support the delivery project
Report progress to Project Manager/Team Leader
Provide estimates of new functionality to the Project Manager
Be aware of project business aims as well as implementation requirements
Provide input to and review project Impact Assessment and Change Control collateral
Ensure adherence to design
Align to Technical System Specification
Adhere to Technical Best Practice defined by Technical Architect
Ensure code/processes meet project non-functional requirements for performance, throughput, robustness, scalability etc.
Secondary Performance Areas
Support the Testing and quality processes
Participate in the code review process
Complete unit testing and code reviews on modules prior to becoming release candidates
Work with/support customer test teams
Communication of status of defect fixes, issues and concerns to the Test team
Co-ordinating the release of new software into the testing environments including release notes
Perform integration testing
The ideal candidate is someone who:
3+ years in software development
Strong experience with web technologies
Knowledge and experience of Dev ops practices
Development experience with integration technologies
An interest in cloud platforms
Experience designing tables/queries for relational databases
Knowledge of software design patterns
Experience in working with agile and waterfall software development methodologies
Right to work in Australia
Desired Experience
Working as a consultant with current and prospective external clients
Experience with reporting engines such as Jasper
Configuring java application containers Role Description

About FiveStones

About FiveStones:
FiveStones, a Numiracle Group company, is a Google Marketing Platform ad technology provider which also provides a number of services across digital maturity consulting, outsourced operations, and training & enablement. Used to support direct marketers and agencies, these combined services enable the full power of an organisation's ad technology platforms.
FiveStones has been a certified Google Marketing Platform (GMP) Sales Partner in Asia since 2009 providing licenses and expertise around most platforms such as Campaign Manager 360, Display & Video 360, Search Ads 360, and Google Analytics 360.
FiveStones is headquartered in Hong Kong and Sydney with other offices across the Asia Pacific.


About the role:


We are looking for leading digital marketing specialists from agency or client backgrounds who have what it takes to take their career to the next level in the Google Marketing Platform. FiveStones is hiring for a Customer Success Manager with specialties in Search, Programmatic, or Analytics in Sydney. The role is to manage customer relationships including evolving platform usage, consulting in marketing maturity, and owning project management and delivery where necessary. the outcomes are customer success in GMP and overseeing contributions from Digital Analysts and Service Ops including technical support.
Duties and Responsibilities:

Duties and Responsibilities

Product Enablement and Knowledge Management

Leverage existing Digital Marketing knowledge and expertise, particularly in Paid Search, to enhance FiveStones customers' usage of the GMP and maximise the return of their investment in the Google Marketing Platform, namely Search Ads 360.
Manage the customer’s onboarding for the Google Marketing Platform technologies by managing the Customer intake documentation, executing the system setups, distribution of the welcome pack, product training and on-going education of new and existing customers.
Effectively enable customers on the Google Marketing Platform technologies by accurately scoping the customer’s requirements and providing best practices as well as recommendations relevant to their business.
Acquire knowledge (basic, intermediate and advanced) and maintain certification for all relevant Google Marketing Platform products.
Collaborate with Marketing and Knowledge to contribute to the preparation of relevant content and/or documentation for but not limited to product updates, roadmaps, best practices, internal and external knowledge base, maturity frameworks.
Manage the launch, delivery & optimizations of paid search campaigns where applicable.


Account and Relationship Management

Remain to be the first point of contact for communication and engagement including support requests from allocated customers to continuously strengthen rapport and relationship.
Escalate and collaborate with other departments such as Solutions and Back Office, including external parties such as Google, to ensure the highest level of resolution is achieved while actively managing the customers’ expectations.
Proactively engage with customers to maintain a high degree of accountability of customer satisfaction and visibility of the Customer’s state of business whilst actively working with the customers to secure their maturity and improved adoption rate on the Google Marketing Platform technologies. This includes but not limited to periodic catch up with the customer (in-person, telephone or video conference), monitoring of the customers’ GMP usage and billable activities, visibility of all support ticket submissions.
Identify and manage new revenue opportunities from existing customers to cross sell other FiveStones products and services. Collaborate with the Business and Solutions team to ensure effectiveness of the engagement.
Proactively obtain valuable feedback from customers and communicate accordingly to your manager, team members and/or management to continuously help improve FiveStones’ brand and services in the market.
Where applicable and appropriate, attend various industry events or workshops for additional learning and networking opportunities.
Proactively attend and participate in periodic company/team meetings to provide and obtain health check updates on customers, state of business, escalation updates, opportunity discoveries, and executions.


Presales / Post Sales / Consulting

Support and collaborate with the Business team and the Solutions team to manage and validate sales proposals, scope of work and customer requirements, pricing, planning of projects being pitched and/or signed off by the customers.
Manage all signed-off projects by maintaining the appropriate documentation, communications and execution of the projects from start to finish to ensure the highest quality of service delivery.

Provide advisory and consultative role to internal and external customers regarding the Google Marketing Platform.
Effectively understand complex technical information and accurately translate, communicate and present them in a digestible format.

FiveStones Advocacy

Advocate and contribute to maintaining the FiveStones brand, culture, and core values at all times.
Continuous self-development to maintain, solidify and improve industry knowledge, personal brand and thought leadership.
Nurture internal relationships to preserve and improve collaborative and supportive mindset.
Proactively contribute to the betterment of FiveStones by participating in additional activities and responsibilities where applicable and required.

Education and Experience


Prerequisites:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Systems, or Information Systems Management, IT or Industry Certification is desirable.
A minimum of 3-5 years experience using and managing campaigns in any or all of the Google Marketing Platform technologies preferably or other Paid Search tools such as Google Ads or Microsoft Advertising, or a minimum of 3+ years’ continuous experience working in a Customer-facing environment providing implementation, troubleshooting, consulting and support for any or all of the Google Marketing Platform technologies or other Paid Search tools such as Google Ads or Microsoft Advertising
Proven understanding or experience in digital marketing including Google Ads.
Solid knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and/or Google Suite (Sheets, Docs, Slides).
Experience in account management or sales.


Highly Regarded / Preferred:

Practical experience in media buying/sales, campaign management, ad operations or dev/tech operations.
Experience in project management, consulting, and/or presales.
Experience and/or proven strong understanding of tag management, SEO, web management.
Experience in delivering/hosting classroom-style training.
Experience in technical writing.
Experience in customer service/support or technical support environment.
High competency level in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, URL encoding, and structures.
Familiarity with SQL queries.


Abilities and Attributes:

nd Attributes

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
Excellent presentation skills.
Experience and advocate of exceptional customer service.
Strong problem-solving skills and root cause analysis.
Strong numerical skills and analytical mindset.
Outstanding “people person” personality.
Effective at multitasking and prioritisation.
Sense of urgency & work ethics. About FiveStones

The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2020 combined revenues of EUR 15.8 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com.

Let's talk about the team:

Capgemini Financial Services is a Global Strategic Business Unit that provides information technology and consultancy services to the Banking, Capital Markets and Insurance industries. Capgemini FS brings you leading insights & deep industry experience to drive the future of Financial Services. Our customers count on us for the very latest in innovative service offerings & next generation global delivery.

 Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:

Experience in handling Insurance Projects and Budgeting
Expertise in managing Risk and Issues in Insurance
Proficient with Biz-Flow process studio and Biz-Flow webmaker
Developing competency in a back-end Object Oriented Programming Language, preferably Java and J2EE

Let's talk about your capability and experience:

Let's talk about what's in it for you!

Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits. We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from. Capgemini constantly aims for excellence in its operations and the employee experience it provides. In line with our Purpose, Flexible Working aims to improve the overall people experience by providing an optimal work-life balance, more autonomy and freedom in when, where and how we work.

As "Architects of Positive Futures", Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:

Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation, which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age. To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we celebrate or recognise special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali, Bastille Day, Pride, IDAHOBIT, IWD and International day of people with Disabilities. Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini, OutFront, Indigenous, Parents and Carers and Sustainability Community of Practice support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.

Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution. We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.

Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious "A list" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. As well as focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models, Capgemini recently announced its commitment to becoming a netzero busines by 2030.

Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 9 years in a row, ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business. Embedded in our DNA, our seven values - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life, visit www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/ and listen to some of our employee's stories.

#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. Heritage is on the lookout for Software Developers with expertise in any of the following areas across our teams in IT: Android (Kotlin), C#/.Net, iOS (Swift), Java, Sitecore or UniVerse.

About the team:

The 2022 roadmap for Information Technology at Heritage is looking action-packed – from a potential merger to core banking migration and Cloud implementation… and much more! Big plans need amazing people to make them happen, and that’s why we are on the lookout for Software Developers across our teams in IT, with expertise in any of the following areas:
Android (Kotlin)
C#/.Net
iOS Development (Swift)
Java
Sitecore
UniVerse
Most of our Developers sit within the IT Operations and Development team: the integration of both Ops and Dev in the same unit is a rare configuration that allows team members the opportunity to participate in end-to-end solution delivery, and to enjoy a breadth of career development prospects that can be hard to come by in many organisations.

About the role:

You’ll create and enhance software solutions which develop new capabilities for the Bank and allow seamless integration with third-party products.
Gather and document requirements to ensure an appropriate solution can be developed to meet the business need
Undertake complex, high-risk software development in accordance with Software Development Lifecycle and Application Security expectations, using appropriate design and integration patterns to deliver secure, stable and maintainable software
Create automated unit test and integration test cases to provide regression testing of the code / solution
Create test plans and execute manual testing to ensure quality and integrity of software as required
Support software running in production to ensure continuity of service to customers and colleague
Maintain up-to-date knowledge on current technologies and trends in the programming language(s) in which you specialise
You will also participate in knowledge-sharing and continuous improvement activities to ensure ongoing functionality, quality and security of systems, business and coding practices, including (but not limited to) design and documentation of APIs, applications and solutions, and peer review of code for other developers.

About you:

You’re a proficient, autonomous programmer and analytical thinker who loves tackling problems with innovative solutions. For ideas and inspiration, you keep abreast of the latest technologies and trends within your area of expertise. You are a ‘lifelong learner’ who enjoys sharing knowledge with your colleagues in order to optimise the overall capability of the team.

You have excellent written and spoken communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to confidently interact with different stakeholders and break down the jargon: explaining what you’re doing in terms that are understandable and relatable to a wide range of audiences.

Required:
Appropriate tertiary qualification(s) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering or other relevant field(s)
Strong understanding and significant professional experience in C#, Java, Kotlin, Sitecore, Swift or UniVerse development
Understanding of microservice development and architecture patterns
Understanding of integration patterns and object-oriented design patterns, programming principles and techniques
Experience working in container-based environments, such as Docker or Kubernetes
Desirable:
Banking and financial services industry experience would be highly regarded
Exposure to Red Hat middleware and platform services, such as 3scale, Fuse and OpenShift
Experience in the use of IBM Case Manager, IBM Case Foundation and IBM FileNet Content Manager
If this opportunity sounds appealing but you don’t match every single one of our requirements, we’d still love to hear from you and find out what unique blend of skills, knowledge and attributes you can bring to the team!

About us:

As one of Australia’s largest member-owned banks, Heritage is proudly committed to our mutual bank status, customer service ethos and strong record of supporting the communities in which we operate. Since our inception in 1875, our People First ethos and core values of Courage, Integrity, Passion and Respect define the way we do business, both with our members and with our Heritage colleagues.

We’re the proud winners of multiple awards, both for our intuitive banking products and services and as a great place to work – having been awarded ABA Employer of Choice for the eleventh year running in 2021. We have also been recognised in the Workplace Giving Excellence Awards 2021 for the ‘Our Shout’ charity partner donation program.

We have been voted Money Magazine's Customer-Owned Money Minder of the Year 2021. In 2020 and 2019 we were named #1 Bank in Australia by Forbes Magazine, as well as Australia’s Most Authentic Bank by JD Power in 2020 and 2019.

None of this would be possible without our wonderful people, and in return we offer our employees an extensive range of financial and lifestyle benefits – including (but not limited to) paid parental leave and special leave provisions, flexibility and hybrid working arrangements, and neat perks such as discounts on banking products and a selection of retail and hospitality partners through Our People Rewards.

Location:

Heritage embraces flexible ways of working for the successful candidate. Our developers can be based in either our Toowoomba head office, Brisbane office or working remotely across SE QLD, with work from home options available.

Occasional travel to Toowoomba may be required in order to adequately perform the role and according to business requirements.

We require all candidates to be able to provide evidence of appropriate working rights in Australia (such as citizenship or visa grant.) However, if you are currently on a temporary visa and seeking employer sponsorship, feel free to reach out to explore your options further.

How to apply:

At Heritage Bank, we are building an inclusive and diverse workforce that better reflects the communities we serve. If you have any special requirements or would like to recommend adjustments to the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

If you like what you have read and we sound like a good fit, we’d love to hear from you – click on the apply button now, and a member of our Talent Acquisition team will be in touch to discuss any potential openings.

Our Talent Acquisition team and hiring managers request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies. Heritage Bank is not liable for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
Job Expires

03/09/2022 Heritage is on the lookout for Software Developers with expertise in any of the following areas across our teams in IT: Android (Kotlin), C#/.Net, iOS (Swift), Java, Sitecore or UniVerse.

About the team:

The 2022 roadmap for Information Technology at Heritage is looking action-packed – from a potential merger to core banking migration and Cloud implementation… and much more! Big plans need amazing people to make them happen, and that’s why we are on the lookout for Software Developers across our teams in IT, with expertise in any of the following areas:
Android (Kotlin)
C#/.Net
iOS Development (Swift)
Java
Sitecore
UniVerse
Most of our Developers sit within the IT Operations and Development team: the integration of both Ops and Dev in the same unit is a rare configuration that allows team members the opportunity to participate in end-to-end solution delivery, and to enjoy a breadth of career development prospects that can be hard to come by in many organisations.

About the role:

You’ll create and enhance software solutions which develop new capabilities for the Bank and allow seamless integration with third-party products.
Gather and document requirements to ensure an appropriate solution can be developed to meet the business need
Undertake complex, high-risk software development in accordance with Software Development Lifecycle and Application Security expectations, using appropriate design and integration patterns to deliver secure, stable and maintainable software
Create automated unit test and integration test cases to provide regression testing of the code / solution
Create test plans and execute manual testing to ensure quality and integrity of software as required
Support software running in production to ensure continuity of service to customers and colleague
Maintain up-to-date knowledge on current technologies and trends in the programming language(s) in which you specialise
You will also participate in knowledge-sharing and continuous improvement activities to ensure ongoing functionality, quality and security of systems, business and coding practices, including (but not limited to) design and documentation of APIs, applications and solutions, and peer review of code for other developers.

About you:

You’re a proficient, autonomous programmer and analytical thinker who loves tackling problems with innovative solutions. For ideas and inspiration, you keep abreast of the latest technologies and trends within your area of expertise. You are a ‘lifelong learner’ who enjoys sharing knowledge with your colleagues in order to optimise the overall capability of the team.

You have excellent written and spoken communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to confidently interact with different stakeholders and break down the jargon: explaining what you’re doing in terms that are understandable and relatable to a wide range of audiences.

Required:
Appropriate tertiary qualification(s) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering or other relevant field(s)
Strong understanding and significant professional experience in C#, Java, Kotlin, Sitecore, Swift or UniVerse development
Understanding of microservice development and architecture patterns
Understanding of integration patterns and object-oriented design patterns, programming principles and techniques
Experience working in container-based environments, such as Docker or Kubernetes
Desirable:
Banking and financial services industry experience would be highly regarded
Exposure to Red Hat middleware and platform services, such as 3scale, Fuse and OpenShift
Experience in the use of IBM Case Manager, IBM Case Foundation and IBM FileNet Content Manager
If this opportunity sounds appealing but you don’t match every single one of our requirements, we’d still love to hear from you and find out what unique blend of skills, knowledge and attributes you can bring to the team!

About us:

As one of Australia’s largest member-owned banks, Heritage is proudly committed to our mutual bank status, customer service ethos and strong record of supporting the communities in which we operate. Since our inception in 1875, our People First ethos and core values of Courage, Integrity, Passion and Respect define the way we do business, both with our members and with our Heritage colleagues.

We’re the proud winners of multiple awards, both for our intuitive banking products and services and as a great place to work – having been awarded ABA Employer of Choice for the eleventh year running in 2021. We have also been recognised in the Workplace Giving Excellence Awards 2021 for the ‘Our Shout’ charity partner donation program.

We have been voted Money Magazine's Customer-Owned Money Minder of the Year 2021. In 2020 and 2019 we were named #1 Bank in Australia by Forbes Magazine, as well as Australia’s Most Authentic Bank by JD Power in 2020 and 2019.

None of this would be possible without our wonderful people, and in return we offer our employees an extensive range of financial and lifestyle benefits – including (but not limited to) paid parental leave and special leave provisions, flexibility and hybrid working arrangements, and neat perks such as discounts on banking products and a selection of retail and hospitality partners through Our People Rewards.

ROLE: Azure Dev-Ops Engineers
LOCATION: Canberra ACT and Hybrid model possible
OPEN TO: Holder of Baseline Clearance

We are seeking Azure Dev-Ops Engineer to provide diverse administrative and IT-related engineering tasks.
Offering Flexible working arrangements and well as on-site options this a versatile and dynamic role.

Duties

include. but not limited to the following summary of work across a range of activities:
Contribute to and review solution designs
Support the creation of pipelines within Azure DevOps and resource deployment and configuration in the Department's Azure Subscriptions
Support projects on Azure VWANing implementations and trouble shooting
Develop code via a process of continuous engagement. (Agile)
Develop automation processes within Azure.


Essential criteria for this role are:

Demonstrated Experience with the development of Infrastructure as code (PowerShell/Terraform/Other) and the use of Git and Git repositories for code management
Networking background – strong working knowledge of Cloud-based and on-premises networking services, including Azure VWANing, Directory Services, Windows Server Administration, Azure resource deployment, and configuration
Understanding of the Federal Gov IT security environment (ACSC Essential 8, etc.)
Ability to effectively work as part of a product or multi-disciplinary team.


Desirable Skills Criteria
Azure Networking and Terraform experience.
Good vendor engagement skills. ROLE: Azure Dev-Ops Engineers

Location: North Shore, New South Wales

Job Type: Contract

Specialisation: Government

Salary: $850-930 day rate

Reference: CR/011513_1659612351

The Opportunity
Join a dynamic and collaborative team for a 12 month plus contract opportunity within the Transport sector.
We are seeking an experienced BA with broad experience in infrastructure/applications/integration and business process re-engineering.
Required Skills and Experience
Business Analyst in Infrastructure or Integration Projects (min of 5 years)
Experience in Application Development & Business Process Re-engineering Projects (min of 5 yrs)
Experience in managing small projects, under the direction of a senior project manager
Experience working (influencing & negotiating) with a diverse set of stakeholders (of varying seniority) including: development teams, Dev Ops teams, testing teams, infrastructure teams, service partners and business representatives
Experienced in both Agile and Waterfall methodologies (e.g. Business analysis plan, business requirements, functional requirements, requirements traceability matrix; Agile ceremonies, disciplines and procedures)
IT Process Re-engineering Experience - "As Is" and "To Be"; assess and redesign to eliminate efficiencies and/or improve controls and/or improve efficiency/effectiveness
If you have the above mentioned skills and experience then please apply! (S52) Location: North Shore, New South Wales

Experience designing, building, deploying, operating, scaling and evolving distributed systems and high-volume transaction applications in a 24/7 dev ops environment.
4+ years of industry experience in software development with Java, Python, C#, TypeScript, or other similar/object-oriented language.
Experience with software development methodologies like Kanban, SCRUM, or Scrumban; ability to communicate and interpret requirements documented via user stories or technical specs.
Experience with full stack development teams owning APIs, UIs, and data stores.
Strong, object-oriented design and coding skills.
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, related field or equivalent work experience.

Job summary
Amazon’s Information Security is looking for a Software Development Engineer who is passionate about building scaled software supporting the high-tempo needs of security operations at Amazon.
We are tasked with building software supporting the high-tempo needs of security teams at Amazon. We provide software solutions in the threat intelligence, detection, monitoring, hunting, and response, forensics, and malware domains. 
If you enjoy shipping software in a fast-paced environment and collaborating on new approaches to building and serving both our Customer’s and Amazon’s security, come join us!
Key job responsibilities
We are looking for full-stack developers who are prepared to take on both front-end and back-end development.
About the team
We are happy to consider providing visa support/ sponsorship. 
We are open to hiring candidates in Sydney, Brisbane and Melbourne. We embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion.
It isn’t about which hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We offer flexibility and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases.
Knowledge of a scripting languages.
Understanding of DevOps and operational support of software in production; build tools and CI/CD.
Experience with Amazon Web Services tech stack is a plus. Working knowledge of core AWS products [S3, Lambda, Dynamo, ELBs, Route53 etc.].
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to partner with engineers, program managers, and customers.
Ability to think outside of the box, innovating and driving product vision for the space, focusing on goals and needs of end customers.
Ability to deal with a high degree of ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly and big, finding solutions on your feet.
Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field or equivalent work experience.
Acknowledgement of country:
In the spirit of reconciliation Amazon acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.

IDE statement:
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected attributes. Experience with software development methodologies like Kanban, SCRUM, or Scrumban; ability to communicate and interpret requirements documented via user stories or technical specs.
Experience with full stack development teams owning APIs, UIs, and data stores.

Understanding of DevOps and operational support of software in production; build tools and CI/CD.
Experience with Amazon Web Services tech stack is a plus. Working knowledge of core AWS products [S3, Lambda, Dynamo, ELBs, Route53 etc.].
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to partner with engineers, program managers, and customers.
Ability to think outside of the box, innovating and driving product vision for the space, focusing on goals and needs of end customers.
Ability to deal with a high degree of ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly and big, finding solutions on your feet.
Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field or equivalent work experience.
Acknowledgement of country:
In the spirit of reconciliation Amazon acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.

#LI-NS1

About Datadog:

Datadog is the world-class monitoring and security platform for cloud applications. We're dedicated to creating, developing, and supporting our product and customers, allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally. Built by engineers, for engineers, our SaaS product is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries to enable digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers' entire technology stack. Given the resilience of cloud technologies and importance placed today in digital operations and agility, Datadog continues to innovate and is well positioned for the long term.


The Team:

We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The technical solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through demos, presentations, technical evaluations, and ongoing support. Technical solutions is a growing global team that collaborates constantly to share knowledge and continuously advance our technical skill set.


The Opportunity:

Join a diverse team of traditional and non-traditional backgrounds, working together to solve hard problems the right way. You'll be joining a team and company immersed in a startup-like environment where you will be challenged, but also will immediately witness your contributions to Datadog.


You Will:

Respond to client requests on our fast paced team while continuing to educate our clients on the use of the platform
Reproduce issues and dive into the 400+ integrations that Datadog works with
Build out documentation and knowledge based articles for a variety of technology
Drive product conversations based on needs and problems learned during client interactions


You Are:

Self-motivated, detail-attentive, and have a desire for continuous learning
A critical thinker who defaults to a client-centric approach
A tinkerer with some programming experience and a basic knowledge of Linux
A master at one thing: tell us all about it
Able to work a rotating schedule that requires weekend availability


Bonus Points:

CS or Engineering majors
Active contribution to open-source projects (code, bug reports, etc.) and the Engineering Community (Meetups, etc.)
You want to start your own company someday


Why You Should Apply:

Generous and competitive global benefits
New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan
Continuous career development and pathing opportunities
Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space
Best in breed onboarding
Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally
Friendly and inclusive workplace culture

Equal Opportunity at Datadog:

Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.


Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog's Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice. #LI-NS1

Title: Test Analyst - Print & Create
Location:
Bentleigh East, Victoria, AU
About us

At Officeworks we make bigger things happen. Our customers, our team, and our community are our heart and soul. And if our brilliant people have taught us anything, it is that we can do all kinds of incredible things, each and every day.

Fast paced. Innovative. Inspiring. With more than 8000 team members and a national footprint of more than 168 retail stores Australia wide – we’re focused on delivering a wide range, low price and great service. We’re about inspiring new ideas and thinking outside the box. We’re about kicking goals, having a laugh and pushing each other. We are about being rewarded and supported. We’re about teaching a customer something new and supporting the community. We’re about making a difference.

About the role

We are excited to announce a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Test Analyst to join our Print & Create Technology team. This exciting role will ensure product quality and customer experience by verifying the intended scope is executed in the right way and at all appropriate junctures of the implementation of a solution.

As a Test Analyst with Officeworks, you have full autonomy and accountability of the quality of what you’re delivering- you are your own Test Manager! In addition, you will Test and Release using world leading practices and tools in Continuous Integration and Delivery, Automation and Agile testing approaches.

As a Test Analyst, you will be responsible for specifying, developing and writing test plans, test scripts and producing test cases. You will carry out regression testing using automated and manual test software applications in order to test the behaviour, functionality and integrity of the Officeworks website.
About you

This role will see you working with Print & Create Technology in a Dev Ops environment. This would be the perfect opportunity for a candidate with a strong manual testing background to develop their skillset and gain more experience in the automated testing space.
You will be someone who is creative and loves to challenge the status quo, you have an inquisitive side with an interest in customer experience to drive great results. You'll also be an exceptional communicator who thrives working as part of a close knit team in a fast paced and dynamic environment.

Additionally, you will have:
1-2 years of experience in Software Testing or similar role would be desirable.You love and have a deep understanding of QA.You understand the uses and methods of testing.Can demonstrate an understanding of web technologies and associated products.Understanding of the online environment and how eCommerce platforms work.Needs a very inquisitive side with an interest in customer experience to drive great results.Understands and perhaps have built and executed automated test suites.Experience with mobile applications and location-based services.Understands agile and the core principles associated.Fearless - not afraid to suggest or back big ideas however disruptive they may beSome knowledge in testing skills (design test plan and test strategy, writing test cases, executing test cases, opening bugs, verifying bugs)Critical thinker and problem-solving skillsTeam playerGood time-management skillsGreat interpersonal and communication skillsAttention to detail & interest in continuing to learn in the software development space.

Our culture

It’s all in a day’s work when you’re part of the Officeworks community – where you’re not defined by who you are, but what you can do. We celebrate our teams’ uniqueness by offering the below to the Officeworks family:
An inclusive, diverse, and supportive environment.
Flexible working arrangements to best support your individual needs.
A key focus on wellbeing and safety.
Generous discounts at Officeworks, Bunnings, Kmart, Target and Catch.
Ongoing training and development opportunities to progress your career.
Industry leading Growing Families policy and access to Circle In portal for Working Families.
At Officeworks, we operate best when our team represents the communities we serve. We proudly commit to providing a safe and supportive work environment for everyone. We actively encourage applications from all candidates, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people with disabilities.
Officeworks is a ‘Circle Back Initiative’ employer – we commit to respond to every applicant. Title: Test Analyst - Print & Create

Overview
The Environment Coordinator will coordinate the usage and management of various system and application environments used within the Link Group IT. This will include Dev Test, Dev Ops, Pre Production and Production. You will also maintain the current utilisation and provide support to the Systems Administration team to help improve the availability and stability of the environments. This includes usage management, issue management, state of diagnosis, resolution, root cause analysis of issues and help document problem workarounds with the help of dashboards. You will also provide support for scheduled release upgrades and deployments. You will also ensure service requests are appropriately actioned according to service levels and performance targets. You will provide technical support to core business application environments to ensure 24x7 availability for critical projects where required.
You must have previous experience in coordinating the support of large complex application environments in financial services industry. Experience supporting multiple Application Servers like JBoss, WebShpere and Weblogic, RDBMS including Oracle and SQL Server and Web Servers is essential.

Key Accountabilities and Main Responsibilities
Liaise with the appropriate stakeholders across the Link Group to coordinate the usage and management of various system and application environments
Maintain the current utilisation and provide support to the Systems Administration
Maintain dashboards related to environment usage management, issue management, state of diagnosis, resolution, root cause analysis of issues and problems.
Ensure IT Systems stability through suitable monitoring and capacity management reporting
Provide IT support to business users through systems problem solving and maintenance when required
Provide support to the System Administrators to implement and administer Enterprise Application servers, Databases and associated system environment solutions
Provide technical support to core business application environments to ensure 24x7 availability of critical projects where required.
Organise and attend meetings related to environment management
Work with business users and IT colleagues to ensure timely resolutions are provided to identified issues
Completion of regular tasks to support team SLAs
Manage code release and deployment across multiple platforms,
Develop and Maintain Documentation related to Standard Operations Procedures
Contribute to improve efficiency of IT Operations process and procedure
Provide system and environment related KPIs as required
Ensure that established procedures and standards are adhered to
Assist to scope system change requirements
Provide effective support and minimise downtime to the business by liaising with developers, back end support, database administrators and vendors
Collaborate with other team members to improve the overall performance delivered to customers
Participate in after hours and weekend support as and when required.
Experience & Personal Attributes
Prior experience in coordinating the support of large complex application environments in financial
services industry
Ability to organize and chair meeting with IT stakeholders is essential.
Experience of building and maintaining multiple application environment status dashboards.
Background in financial services and securities industry such as Registry, Broking, Exchange, Superannuation or Trading.
Ability to handle multiple/concurrent projects planning
High level of problem solving skills to handle complex software and interface support issues
Negotiation skills in regards to managing expectations
Sound knowledge of MS Office Products
Excellent documentation skills
Effective oral and written communications skills
Willingness to accept responsibility and be accountable for service provided
Ability to work on call after hours and weekend in a rostered 24x7 environment as and when required.
Analytical and Systematic approach to work
Ability to work effectively in a team
Pleasant and helpful personality
Tertiary qualification in Computer Science
Background in financial services and securities industry such as Registry, Broking, Exchange, Superannuation or Trading
Experience in Supporting multiple Application Servers including JBoss, Websphere, Weblogic
Experience in supporting applications on J2EE, Java, JSP, Apache and Tomcat
Knowledge of RDBMS and SQL
Link Group is a leading fund administration and share registry specialist. We are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. Since our inception, Link Group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. Our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics.
Our continued investment in our proprietary technology platforms allows us to automate wealth management workflows, manage large consumer and member bases, and provide insights through predictive analytics.
By focussing on product and service innovation, our Technology division has evolved to become an innovative provider of solutions, identifying and anticipating the needs of clients across Link Group.
Link Group is building a dynamic, client focused, caring and inclusive culture that is built on the foundations of an entrepreneurial spirit, effective risk management, empathy and trust, and underpinned by its core values.
We are an inclusive employer whose people work collaboratively. We encourage, support and value the various talents and perspectives of our people and promote a flexible and blended work environment where our people can thrive and their wellbeing is supported. We know that diversity drives better client outcomes, continuous improvement, and growth. Be part of the Link Group journey and together we will achieve our full potential.
We treat all individuals fairly and equitably and do not discriminate on the basis of diverse characteristics including, but not limited to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity, cultural background, physical abilities/disabilities, religious or political belief, marital or family status or carers responsibilities.
Candidates must have the relevant work rights to be considered for an opportunity at Link Group. Successful applicants will be required to complete background screening prior to commencement of employment. Overview

This will include Dev Test, Dev Ops, Pre Production and Production. You will also maintain the current utilisation and provide support to the Systems Administration team to help improve the availability and stability of the environments. This includes usage management, issue management, state of diagnosis, resolution, root cause analysis of issues and help document problem workarounds with the help of dashboards. You will also provide support for scheduled release upgrades and deployments. You will also ensure service requests are appropriately actioned according to service levels and performance targets. You will provide technical support to core business application environments to ensure 24x7 availability for critical projects where required.
You must have previous experience in coordinating the support of large complex application environments in financial services industry. Experience supporting multiple Application Servers like JBoss, WebShpere and Weblogic, RDBMS including Oracle and SQL Server and Web Servers is essential.

Key Accountabilities and Main Responsibilities
Liaise with the appropriate stakeholders across the Link Group to coordinate the usage and management of various system and application environments

Provide technical support to core business application environments to ensure 24x7 availability of critical projects where required.

Contribute to improve efficiency of IT Operations process and procedure
Provide system and environment related KPIs as required
Ensure that established procedures and standards are adhered to
Assist to scope system change requirements
Provide effective support and minimise downtime to the business by liaising with developers, back end support, database administrators and vendors
Collaborate with other team members to improve the overall performance delivered to customers
Participate in after hours and weekend support as and when required.

Link Group is a leading fund administration and share registry specialist. We are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. Since our inception, Link Group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. Our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics.
Our continued investment in our proprietary technology platforms allows us to automate wealth management workflows, manage large consumer and member bases, and provide insights through predictive analytics.
By focussing on product and service innovation, our Technology division has evolved to become an innovative provider of solutions, identifying and anticipating the needs of clients across Link Group.
Link Group is building a dynamic, client focused, caring and inclusive culture that is built on the foundations of an entrepreneurial spirit, effective risk management, empathy and trust, and underpinned by its core values.
We are an inclusive employer whose people work collaboratively. We encourage, support and value the various talents and perspectives of our people and promote a flexible and blended work environment where our people can thrive and their wellbeing is supported. We know that diversity drives better client outcomes, continuous improvement, and growth. Be part of the Link Group journey and together we will achieve our full potential.
We treat all individuals fairly and equitably and do not discriminate on the basis of diverse characteristics including, but not limited to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity, cultural background, physical abilities/disabilities, religious or political belief, marital or family status or carers responsibilities.
