We're REA
An Australian start-up success story we're quietly proud of.
From a garage in Melbourne to the global stage is an achievement we're humbled by. Our idea to put pictures of houses on the internet has blossomed since 1995, and we now have businesses across Australia, India and North America.
Our purpose is to change the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help on every step - whether that's buying, selling, renting or renovating.
Some of our brands include realestate.com.au, realcommercial.com.au, Flatmates.com.au, Proptrack.com, Smartline.com.au and Mortgage Choice.
We’re proud to have been named one of Australia’s Best Workplaces for 2021. This recognition is a great proof point of our unique and special culture. A culture that is driven by our people, our values, and our commitment to making a difference in the community.
What we’re doing
With us, you’ll experience Impact. This role sits within Consumer Membership & Property. The Stack Stars squad has end-to-end responsibility for the Personalisation Stack as well as onboarding teams from across REA on their Personalisation journey. The goal of Personalisation is to deliver features to the realestate.com.au website & mobile experience that engage users beyond the traditional property purchase and sale events REA is so well known for.

You will be working collaboratively with our product and technical team members to help deliver an event driven architecture that supports REA’s personalisation stack. The Senior Developer supports the team in the following ways:
Designing, implementing new or uplifting existing data pipelines and APIs using Scala, as well as data platform technology such as Kafka, Apache Flink, BigQuery and Airflow.
Maintaining and supporting production systems and users in different capacities (custodianship, business hours pager, help channel requests).
Onboarding the rest of the business on our Martech Stack (Braze, Tealium CDP - Customer Data Platform). Collaborating on final design solution and performance test.
Championing quality software delivery from inception and design to build and deployment, in collaboration with our Lead Developer and Technical Lead.
Learning – we are constantly learning together, mentoring each other and striving to do things better.
Proactively contribute to the continuous improvement of products, technology, process and team development
Working with product managers to understand business priorities and communicate technical options, report on progress and express ideas.
Sharing responsibility for all operational aspects of the software that we build, in support of our “you build it; you run it” philosophy where dev-ops is a part of everyday life.
Who we’re looking for
Approximately 5+ years of experience working in software development.
Strong programming skills. We build new systems mainly in Scala, but also own systems in other languages such as Typescript , Java, Ruby and Python, so you should be an expert in one of those and have some familiarity with or willingness to learn others.
Experience in building data pipelines. Working with streaming data frameworks, such as Kafka and Apache Flink is a bonus.
Experience with modern software development techniques such as test-driven development, microservice architecture, functional programming, and continuous delivery.
Exposure to dev-ops and cloud engineering tools and techniques is a plus, particularly AWS, GCP, containers, infrastructure-as-code and BuildKite
Proven experience as a senior team member influencing architectural and delivery outcomes.
Proven operational experience resolving critical incidents in cloud production environments.
Excellent communication skills and experience coaching other team members.
Work productively in a fast paced and agile environment
Able to lead and deliver slices of work.
But we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. It’s our connection, acceptance and genuine care for each other that makes REA a great place to work. That means you also need to be:
Savvy minded and have curiosity to think a little left of field / outside the box
A strong and creative communicator
Friendly, approachable and have good relationship management skills
An avid contributor to our inclusive culture - we celebrate different perspectives and all play an active role in creating a sense of belonging
The REA experience
The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.
We offer:
A flexible working environment, meaning we strike the balance of what you need and what works for the business (and yes, our leaders fully understand the benefits of working flexibly)
A hybrid approach to the future of work - https://rea.to/hybrid-working
Generous and flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers
Summer Fridays – time back to focus on your wellness every Friday afternoon from December through to March
Support for your mental and physical health and wellbeing via our ‘You Matter’ Program
Because We Care program which includes volunteer leave and community grants, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community
Hack Days for you to bring so you can bring your big ideas to life in a supportive learning environment
An additional day of leave just for your birthday
Oh, and by the way:
At REA we value diversity and inclusion in all forms. Gender, religion, ethnicity, LBTGIQ+, neurodiversity and so much more. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you've got the must-haves, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.
If you like the sound of us, then we think you should apply today. We're proud to be Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant. About Us:

Infosys is a global leader in consulting, technology, outsourcing and next-generation services. We enable clients, in more than 50 countries, to stay a step ahead of emerging business trends and outperform the competition. We help them transform and thrive in a changing world by co-creating breakthrough solutions that combine strategic insights and execution excellence.


Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY), with US$ 8.7 billion in annual revenues and 187,000+ employees, is helping enterprises renew themselves while also creating new avenues to generate value.
Role:

Skill:
Experience in Test Automation tools like Selenium & Testing
Hands on experience in building Automation frameworks
Working experience in DevOps ecosystem, preferably open source
Hands on experience on macros, Java and SQL
Experience working in agile, lean, DevOps & cross functional teams
Expertise in use of JIRA and Confluence
Experience in test automation planning, framework development, scripting, execution and reporting
Preferred to have exposure to Java stack applications with Insurance domain background

Location in Australia:
Melbourne & Sydney -Australia
Short Description:
Roles and Responsibilities:
Minimum of 7 years in the Testing domain with previous experience of at least 5 yrs on test automation
Excellent understanding of the Software Testing Life Cycle
Experience in reviewing requirements and design documents and determine scope of testing;
Self-motivated, able to work off own initiative or as part of a team when required.
Experience of test planning and estimating, conducting Impact Assessments and identifying testing risks;
Ability to take ownership of issues, and progress escalations to resolution;
Good experience in Agile and Dev-Ops process and framework.
Excellent communications and interpersonal skills;
Develop Test automation plan
Develop test automation framework & scripts for new or changed systems/services in agile delivery environments
Integrate test automation tool with DevOps tool sets
Execute test scripts and report test results
Identify and report defects, working experience with JIRA,
Strong experience and skills in software test management with demonstrated experience in a diverse and complex applications environment.
Proven experience in performing System and System Integration Testing activities, including both the functional and non-functional testing aspects
Experience in performing Risk Based Test Assessment and execution
Experience in Daily Test Execution / Status report to stakeholders
Experience in Defect management
Experience in creating Test Completion Reports.

Essential –
Test automation across technology mixtures
Worked in DevOps

Preferred –
Insurance domain experience

Additional skills:

Infosys is an equal opportunity employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of gender or other attribute covered by equal opportunity legislation.

Please note in order to protect the interest of all parties involved in the recruitment process, Infosys does not accept any unsolicited resumes from third party vendors. In the absence of a signed agreement any submission will be deemed as non-binding and Infosys explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire the submitted profile. All recruitment activity must be coordinated through the Talent Acquisition department.

Hands on experience on macros, Java and SQL
Experience working in agile, lean, DevOps & cross functional teams
Expertise in use of JIRA and Confluence
Experience in test automation planning, framework development, scripting, execution and reporting
Preferred to have exposure to Java stack applications with Insurance domain background

Location in Australia:
Melbourne & Sydney -Australia
Short Description:
Roles and Responsibilities:
Minimum of 7 years in the Testing domain with previous experience of at least 5 yrs on test automation
Excellent understanding of the Software Testing Life Cycle
Experience in reviewing requirements and design documents and determine scope of testing;
Self-motivated, able to work off own initiative or as part of a team when required.
Experience of test planning and estimating, conducting Impact Assessments and identifying testing risks;
Ability to take ownership of issues, and progress escalations to resolution;
Good experience in Agile and Dev-Ops process and framework.
Excellent communications and interpersonal skills;
Develop Test automation plan
Develop test automation framework & scripts for new or changed systems/services in agile delivery environments
Integrate test automation tool with DevOps tool sets
Execute test scripts and report test results
Identify and report defects, working experience with JIRA,
Strong experience and skills in software test management with demonstrated experience in a diverse and complex applications environment.
Proven experience in performing System and System Integration Testing activities, including both the functional and non-functional testing aspects
Experience in performing Risk Based Test Assessment and execution
Experience in Daily Test Execution / Status report to stakeholders
Experience in Defect management
Experience in creating Test Completion Reports.

Essential –
Test automation across technology mixtures
Worked in DevOps

Preferred –
Insurance domain experience

Own the strategy, performance and functionality of our website
Collaborative and innovative team environment
Australia's best reward and recognition program


The opportunity.

You will be joining a high performing team who are passionate about the brand and work they deliver.
This is an opportunity to work with a company that puts its people first, and own the Employsure website in terms of performance. Your day to day will include enhancement of website features, ensuring that code changes are deployed successfully, and troubleshooting functional or performance issues.

You will be a forward-thinking natural problem solver who enjoys sharing knowledge with their colleagues. You have a passion for digital technology and the focus on the smaller details will be paramount, which in return will ensure your success in this role.

Key accountabilities.
Own the deployment process from Dev to Prod
Identify and resolve any bugs
Website and plugin code maintenance and upgrades
Support with any HTML/CSS/JS on content updates
Ensure content and features are created and launched effectively on production website
Build landing page templates that increase user experience and lead generation performance
Work with our external Dev Ops team
Be the expert for any website features and upcoming technologies to consider
Be a key stakeholder for a number of the upcoming website projects
The right person will have:
2 years’ experience in a Web Developer role, ideally covering WordPress and static websites
Experience in JavaScript, WordPress, HTML, CSS, PHP, Twig
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A problem-solving mind set and the ability to work on projects autonomously
 What you get in return
Clear career pathways: relevant quality, productivity and service measurements and resulting remuneration milestones
An additional 5 annual leave days after 2 years of service, plus one extra day for every anniversary year above 5 years (10 extra days in total max)
An active social committee dedicated to organising company & state-wide events & celebrations
Many additional benefits after 2 years of service including paid parental leave, further education allowance, volunteer leave & financial support to name a few
Yearly milestone celebrations
Did we mention free, daily breakfast, office amenities and a bi-weekly tea trolley!
Why join Employsure?


Our vision is to Build Better businesses starting with our own. Employsure is committed to nurturing a diverse and inclusive culture of opportunity. We encourage applications from people of culturally diverse backgrounds, people who identify as LGBTQI+, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait islander origin, and people with disabilities.

The opportunities are endless, with personal and professional growth being one of our top priorities. In addition, we offer our employees remarkable benefits. If you are looking for a role that can match your ambitions, we want to hear from you.

With a global track record of over 30 years of success, this is your chance to join an industry leader who prides itself on expertise and innovation at an exciting time in the Australian and New Zealand market.

Become a part of our exciting journey. Apply now Own the strategy, performance and functionality of our website

job_title: Business Systems Analyst - Support Services Global Support Centre
listing_jobDesc:
BENEFITS
We are committed to personal and professional development, which is supported by an ever growing and expanding structure. We believe our people deserve the best space to their best work and to support this we provide:
 50% team member discount for all of our 7 brands.
 ‍ A world class office with a state-of-the-art Wellness Centre featuring spa therapists, holistic health experts and free fitness classes (think reformer Pilates classes, personal training sessions, yoga studio, spin room and run club!)
 A brand-new childcare centre onsite – incredible facilities, indoor and outdoor play areas, subsidised cost, and your kids are right next door!
 ️ The Beckley, our in-house café with chef prepared healthy meals, coffee and snacks. You can also grab a nutritious take home meal, taking the stress out of dinner time.
 Flexible working – enabling you to find the right working rhythm to be at your best.
 Competitive salary packaging – ensuring we are constantly benchmarking to industry.
 On-site concierge, let us help you get your life sorted with dry cleaning, car wash and more.
 An Employee Assistance Program for you and your family.
 Returning from maternity leave (or primary carer parental leave)? Work part-time and get paid full-time for 2 months, all part of supporting you during your transition back to work.
 Team mingle celebrations, speaker’s series, surprise and delight moments – the magic happens when we get together.
 Do you have a dog? Bring them into the office. We love them!
OUR CULTURE
Here at the Cotton On Group our people are at the heart of everything we do. We are surrounded by great minds that inspire us, every single day. We are a close knit bunch who encourage and support each other to achieve big things.
On top of this, we know our future success depends on making responsible decisions. Through our Cotton On Foundation, the philanthropic arm of the Cotton On Group, we truly believe we can create meaningful change – and that this is the right thing to do. Our people are our #1 Cotton On Foundation ambassadors and have the opportunity to make a real difference to the lives of thousands of people.
ABOUT US
To ‘Cotton On’ to something means to understand or discover the potential of a great idea. As a Group, we’ve always believed in big ideas matched with a fierce will to bring them to life. In 25 years, the Cotton On Group has grown to become Australia’s largest value fashion group, with seven brands in 17 countries across the world, driven by a team of over 20,000 passionate people, and growing.
We make the most of today and always look to tomorrow for new and exciting opportunities. We get involved, roll up our sleeves and make things happen. Join our team in our shared belief that we can make a difference to the lives of everyone we touch – from our backyard to the world.
ABOUT THE ROLE
We have an opportunity for an experienced I.T professional, to join our Group as a Business Systems Analyst with a focus on our Retail & Merchandising systems. You will be responsible for undertaking various forms of analysis related to the delivery of technology for our Retail & Merchandising projects to ensure smooth system updates and changes. You will work with the development teams to deliver system changes that assist in providing the right technology solutions for the business and our customers. In addition to this, you will be required to undertake various levels of application testing to ensure software and changes released into the business are functioning efficiently and meeting expectations, by working closely with relevant end users coordinating and completing User Acceptance Testing. If you are someone who is passionate about providing technology based solutions that assist people to perform at their best, then apply now.
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Relevant degree / qualification in I.T
Previous experience delivering technology projects and undertaking analysis, requirements gathering or system design
Ability to manage project resources, business stakeholders and third party suppliers
Experience of Retail Directions RMS/SMS is an advantage, as is SQL Server & Dev Ops
Demonstrable strategic thinking, analytical and problem solving skills

Experience of Retail Directions RMS/SMS is an advantage, as is SQL Server & Dev Ops
Demonstrable strategic thinking, analytical and problem solving skills   Show more

We're REA
An Australian start-up success story we're quietly proud of.
From a garage in Melbourne to the global stage is an achievement we're humbled by. Our idea to put pictures of houses on the internet has blossomed since 1995, and we now have businesses across Australia, Asia, India and North America.
Our purpose is to change the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help on every step - whether that's buying, selling, renting or renovating.
Some of our brands include realestate.com.au, realcommercial.com.au, spacely.com.au, Flatmates.com.au, Proptrack.com and Mortgage Choice.
We’re proud to have been named one of Australia’s Best Workplaces for 2021. This recognition is a great proof point of our unique and special culture. A culture that is driven by our people, our values, and our commitment to making a difference in the community.
What we’re doing
With us, you’ll experience impact. You’ll be part of our Core Property Data tribe, within our PropTrack business. Its mission is to leverage REA's unique datasets to generate insights about the property market and power various property-centric products that caters to a wide variety of customer segments. We are doing this by building a property data pipeline that adopts event-sourcing architecture patterns and technologies such as Kafka, Flink and Airflow.
As a Senior Quality Analyst, you will assume responsibility for overall quality strategy and coach and mentor your team for quality outcomes. You will be responsible for working with cross-functional squads to ensure stability, availability, and reliability of data pipelines and APIs through the planning and execution of appropriate testing.
This role has an additional, specific focus on data. You will collaborate with Lead QA to evolve our data quality framework and strategy to support our property data pipelines and support its execution within teams.
You will serve as the quality champion of the team and will help implement agile software delivery practices such as automated testing and continuous integration. You will coach and support an entire squad of developers, business analysts and product managers with testing best practices to ensure quality is built in and inherent to team delivery. While no two days are ever the same, you’ll be doing:
Drive team to define and implement quality strategy for new data pipelines and APIs using data platforms such as Kafka, Flink, BigQuery, and Airflow/Breeze.
Supporting a robust platform for the business by building monitoring and observability, resiliency, and scalability into all our tools and systems.
Identify, track, and remediate data quality issues.
Work with team to analyse and produce data coverage and quality statistics across internal and external data sets to provide a high level of awareness across multiple teams.
Champion quality software delivery from inception and design to build and deployment in collaboration with team and stakeholders.
Working with product managers to understand business priorities and communicate technical options, report on progress and come up with quality metrics.
Coaching and sharing knowledge with the squads on agile test practices and advocating for shared quality responsibility.
Supporting the tribe in training needs around onboarding new members, testing tools or practices
Contributing to the Quality Analysis community of practice for REA Group.
Liaising with Product Owners, Tech Leads and Delivery Leads to ensure quality strategy and plans meet their requirements.
Who we’re looking for
Expert problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated skills in, API and data testing.
Experience working with continuous integration practices and tools.
Demonstrated skills in defining and implementing testing strategies for multiple teams.
Advanced coaching & facilitation skills to help drive successful outcomes.
Must be able to identify, analyse and address problems to resolve data/API issues.
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with Technical and Non-Technical business owners.
Ability to manage the competing demands of multiple projects in a timely manner.
Exposure to dev-ops tools and techniques, particularly AWS, CloudFormation, and Docker is a plus.
Experience in building data pipelines and working with streaming data frameworks, such as Kafka and Flink is a bonus.
A mix of and data test automation and contract / service / API test automation experience is a plus.
A track record of delivering software to high quality standards, deploying and supporting the software that you deliver right through to production (past AWS or GCP experience a bonus).
But we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. It’s our connection, acceptance and genuine care for each other that makes REA a great place to work. That means you also need to be:
Savvy minded and have curiosity to think a little left of field / outside the box
A strong and creative communicator
Friendly, approachable and have good relationship management skills
An avid contributor to our inclusive culture - we celebrate different perspectives and all play an active role in creating a sense of belonging
The REA experience
The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.
We offer:
A flexible working environment, meaning we strike the balance of what you need and what works for the business (and yes, our leaders fully understand the benefits of working flexibly)
A hybrid approach to work - Check out our guide to hybrid working https://rea.to/hybrid-working
Generous and flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers
Summer Fridays – time back to focus on your wellness every Friday afternoon from December through to March
Support for your mental and physical health and wellbeing via our ‘You Matter’ Program
Because We Care program which includes volunteer leave and community grants, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community
Hack Days for you to bring so you can bring your big ideas to life in a supportive learning environment
An additional day of leave just for your birthday
Oh, and by the way:
At REA we value diversity and inclusion in all forms. Gender, religion, ethnicity, LBTGIQ+, neurodiversity and so much more. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you've got the must-haves, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit. We're REA
An Australian start-up success story we're quietly proud of.

Summer Fridays – time back to focus on your wellness every Friday afternoon from December through to March
Support for your mental and physical health and wellbeing via our ‘You Matter’ Program
Because We Care program which includes volunteer leave and community grants, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community
Hack Days for you to bring so you can bring your big ideas to life in a supportive learning environment
An additional day of leave just for your birthday
Oh, and by the way:
At REA we value diversity and inclusion in all forms. Gender, religion, ethnicity, LBTGIQ+, neurodiversity and so much more. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you've got the must-haves, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit. We're REA
An Australian start-up success story we're quietly proud of.
From a garage in Melbourne to the global stage is an achievement we're humbled by. Our idea to put pictures of houses on the internet has blossomed since 1995, and we now have businesses across Australia, Asia, India and North America.
Our purpose is to change the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help on every step - whether that's buying, selling, renting or renovating.
Some of our brands include realestate.com.au, realcommercial.com.au, spacely.com.au, Flatmates.com.au, Proptrack.com and Mortgage Choice.
We’re proud to have been named one of Australia’s Best Workplaces for 2021. This recognition is a great proof point of our unique and special culture. A culture that is driven by our people, our values, and our commitment to making a difference in the community.
What we’re doing
With us, you’ll experience impact. You’ll be part of our Core Property Data tribe, within our PropTrack business. Its mission is to leverage REA's unique datasets to generate insights about the property market and power various property-centric products that caters to a wide variety of customer segments. We are doing this by building a property data pipeline that adopts event-sourcing architecture patterns and technologies such as Kafka, Flink and Airflow.
As a Senior Quality Analyst, you will assume responsibility for overall quality strategy and coach and mentor your team for quality outcomes. You will be responsible for working with cross-functional squads to ensure stability, availability, and reliability of data pipelines and APIs through the planning and execution of appropriate testing.
This role has an additional, specific focus on data. You will collaborate with Lead QA to evolve our data quality framework and strategy to support our property data pipelines and support its execution within teams.
You will serve as the quality champion of the team and will help implement agile software delivery practices such as automated testing and continuous integration. You will coach and support an entire squad of developers, business analysts and product managers with testing best practices to ensure quality is built in and inherent to team delivery. While no two days are ever the same, you’ll be doing:
Drive team to define and implement quality strategy for new data pipelines and APIs using data platforms such as Kafka, Flink, BigQuery, and Airflow/Breeze.
Supporting a robust platform for the business by building monitoring and observability, resiliency, and scalability into all our tools and systems.
Identify, track, and remediate data quality issues.
Work with team to analyse and produce data coverage and quality statistics across internal and external data sets to provide a high level of awareness across multiple teams.
Champion quality software delivery from inception and design to build and deployment in collaboration with team and stakeholders.
Working with product managers to understand business priorities and communicate technical options, report on progress and come up with quality metrics.
Coaching and sharing knowledge with the squads on agile test practices and advocating for shared quality responsibility.
Supporting the tribe in training needs around onboarding new members, testing tools or practices
Contributing to the Quality Analysis community of practice for REA Group.
Liaising with Product Owners, Tech Leads and Delivery Leads to ensure quality strategy and plans meet their requirements.
Who we’re looking for
Expert problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated skills in, API and data testing.
Experience working with continuous integration practices and tools.
Demonstrated skills in defining and implementing testing strategies for multiple teams.
Advanced coaching & facilitation skills to help drive successful outcomes.
Must be able to identify, analyse and address problems to resolve data/API issues.
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with Technical and Non-Technical business owners.
Ability to manage the competing demands of multiple projects in a timely manner.
Exposure to dev-ops tools and techniques, particularly AWS, CloudFormation, and Docker is a plus.
Experience in building data pipelines and working with streaming data frameworks, such as Kafka and Flink is a bonus.
A mix of and data test automation and contract / service / API test automation experience is a plus.
A track record of delivering software to high quality standards, deploying and supporting the software that you deliver right through to production (past AWS or GCP experience a bonus).
But we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. It’s our connection, acceptance and genuine care for each other that makes REA a great place to work. That means you also need to be:
Savvy minded and have curiosity to think a little left of field / outside the box
A strong and creative communicator
Friendly, approachable and have good relationship management skills
An avid contributor to our inclusive culture - we celebrate different perspectives and all play an active role in creating a sense of belonging
The REA experience
The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.
We offer:
A flexible working environment, meaning we strike the balance of what you need and what works for the business (and yes, our leaders fully understand the benefits of working flexibly)
A hybrid approach to work - Check out our guide to hybrid working https://rea.to/hybrid-working
Generous and flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers
Summer Fridays – time back to focus on your wellness every Friday afternoon from December through to March
Support for your mental and physical health and wellbeing via our ‘You Matter’ Program
Because We Care program which includes volunteer leave and community grants, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community
Hack Days for you to bring so you can bring your big ideas to life in a supportive learning environment
An additional day of leave just for your birthday

Aiven is a hypergrowth Platform-as-a-Service company offering the best in open-source and data technologies on multiple cloud platforms.

Headquartered in Helsinki with hubs in Berlin, Boston, Paris, Sydney, Singapore, Tokyo and Toronto, Aiven provides managed open-source data technologies, such as PostgreSQL, Apache Kafka and M3, on all major clouds.

In 2022, we raised Series D funding of $210M to fuel our global expansion, the comprehensiveness of our platform and to focus on new programs in sustainability and diversity in tech.

Open source is at our core. We compensate our employees who contribute to open source outside of their daily work with Aiven and we have set up an Open Source Program Office (OSPO), to actively focus on giving back to the open-source community.

Our Mission and Values

Aiven's mission is to enable customers to drive business results from open source, transforming their businesses. We love to operate our favorite tools at scale and empower our customers, in over 60 countries, to do great work.

We live our values of courage, openness and ownership every day, and continually strive to ensure that every Aivener is empowered to contribute creatively and meaningfully, in a work environment where they have the tools to succeed and the comfort and support to be themselves.
About the role

This role is all about empowering and enabling developers everywhere to take advantage of the best open source database technologies, especially on the Aiven platform. You will be creating documentation, blog content and video content to make sure that customers and colleagues alike have the information they need to succeed. You will create examples and demos so that other engineers can quickly pick up the skills too.

You will be preparing and delivering content for industry events, meetups, and our own webinars. Travel is optional in this role; we encourage you to travel if you'd like to, or to contribute in other ways that suit your lifestyle/talents if not. You will also bring your knowledge to our other channels, updating our docs, publishing blog posts, and creating video content for the visual learners in the community.

Your role needs you to engage with both internal and external communities. We expect you to collaborate on content, open source and open standards projects, and to find other opportunities to inform and educate developers.

Requirements:

You have hands-on experience with cloud platforms, and/or database technologies. You might be a data analyst, or be coming to us from anywhere on the Dev/Ops spectrum.
You have some experience creating content for a technical audience, such as a blog post or a meetup talk.
You're already a GitHub user, and you're comfortable with one or more programming languages (Python, Go and Java are ideal, but we're open-minded).
You are either already a DevRel professional, or you are excited about helping more people be successful with the best open source technologies around.
You are proactive, well organized, and enjoy collaborating with others as a reviewer, listener, creator and cheerleader.
Proficient in spoken and written English.

Benefits:

An agile working environment with short decision paths
Compensation for open-source contributions made in your free time
Flexible working hours, including remote work
Choose the devices and tools that make you work the best
Participation in employee stock option plan
Office snacks, soft drinks, treats and fruits

Please note that benefits and perks may slightly differ depending on location.

You will be part of a highly-skilled, tight-knit team, making your contribution essential to what is becoming a great success story. If you are interested, please send us your application! Start your career with The Salvation Army today!
We are looking for compassionate people who share our mission and values, if you have the passion and drive to commit yourself to a challenging and rewarding role; we invite you to review our current vacancies.
ABOUT US
The Salvation Army is one of Australia’s largest and most-loved charities, helping thousands of Australians every year find hope in the midst of all kinds of personal hardship. The Salvation Army offers the opportunity to use your professional skills and expertise to make a real difference in the lives of people who need help most.
ABOUT THE ROLE
Are you looking to work for an organisation which is Australia’s one of the largest and most-loved charities? Are you looking to be a part of a close knit, vibrant, progressive, and supportive team?
We have an exceptional 2 year (max term) full time opportunity for a Business Intelligence Specialist to join our Internal Audit, Risk and Compliance team in Blackburn.
Reporting to the Executive Manager Data Officer, you will lead the development and implementation of enterprise Business Intelligence and partner with a broad spectrum of stakeholders to support the delivery of innovative and optimised performance reporting.
The key focus of the role is:
Develop regular Power BI visualisations and adhoc queries for executive level stakeholders
Translate business needs into analytics/reporting requirements and provide business context to data technicians and system administrators
Assist with uplifting departmental reporting by conducting business requirement gathering sessions with business analysts to define business problems and analytical requirements, and translate into technical requirements
Maintain the Data Governance Framework for the organisation and develop proof of concept BI models and prototypes to prove solution feasibility
Promote best practice by engaging, coaching and mentoring business analysts and individuals in accessing, interpreting and understanding data trends (forecasting and predictions)
ABOUT YOU
The successful candidate will ideally have;
A degree in a relevant discipline (i.e., Business or IT-related)
Data, Analytics & Insights, Business Intelligence work history
5+ years demonstrated experience in developing dashboards and visualisation solutions using tools such as Power BI
SQL Server skills including SQL objects development, performance tuning, data analysis and integration
Deep knowledge and experience with Power BI / Azure to maximise value from the technology stack
Experience with working in an Agile/ Dev-Ops environment will be beneficial to the team as improved practices/ways of working need to be implemented
Strong Business engagement, leadership, analytical and problem-solving skills
WHY WORK FOR US
In return we offer our employees real and meaningful benefits such as;
NFP salary packaging ($15,900 tax free) plus meals and entertainment benefits;
Flexible working conditions;
Paid parental leave;
Financial, retail and lifestyle discounts and benefits;
An inclusive culture of dedicated, passionate and professional team members;
Positively supporting and impacting the lives of others through your career contribution.
Opportunity for career development;
Employee Assistance Program - Independent confidential counselling service;
HOW TO APPLY
We are looking for compassionate people who share our mission and values, if you have the passion and drive to commit yourself to a challenging and rewarding role; we invite you to apply via the link and submit a current CV and a cover letter which details your alignment with the essential requirements of the role.
The Salvation Army is an Equal Opportunity Employer who provides an inclusive work environment and embraces the diverse talent of its people. We value people of all cultures, languages, capacities, sexual orientations, gender identities and/or expressions. We are committed to achieving a diverse workforce and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal people and Torres Strait Islander people.
The Salvation Army is a child safe organisation and is committed to protecting children and young people from harm. All child facing roles will require the successful completion of a Working with Children Check. Applicants for all roles require a mandatory National Police Check.
We are committed to providing a safe environment for our people. Please note that The Salvation Army has a mandatory vaccination procedure.
We value Integrity, Compassion, Respect, Diversity, and Collaboration Number of Positions Available:

The Salvation Army offers the opportunity to use your professional skills and expertise to make a real difference in the lives of people who need help most.
ABOUT THE ROLE
Are you looking to work for an organisation which is Australia’s one of the largest and most-loved charities? Are you looking to be a part of a close knit, vibrant, progressive, and supportive team?
We have an exceptional 2 year (max term) full time opportunity for a Business Intelligence Specialist to join our Internal Audit, Risk and Compliance team in Blackburn.
Reporting to the Executive Manager Data Officer, you will lead the development and implementation of enterprise Business Intelligence and partner with a broad spectrum of stakeholders to support the delivery of innovative and optimised performance reporting.
The key focus of the role is:
Develop regular Power BI visualisations and adhoc queries for executive level stakeholders
Translate business needs into analytics/reporting requirements and provide business context to data technicians and system administrators
Assist with uplifting departmental reporting by conducting business requirement gathering sessions with business analysts to define business problems and analytical requirements, and translate into technical requirements
Maintain the Data Governance Framework for the organisation and develop proof of concept BI models and prototypes to prove solution feasibility
Promote best practice by engaging, coaching and mentoring business analysts and individuals in accessing, interpreting and understanding data trends (forecasting and predictions)
ABOUT YOU
The successful candidate will ideally have;
A degree in a relevant discipline (i.e., Business or IT-related)
Data, Analytics & Insights, Business Intelligence work history
5+ years demonstrated experience in developing dashboards and visualisation solutions using tools such as Power BI
SQL Server skills including SQL objects development, performance tuning, data analysis and integration
Deep knowledge and experience with Power BI / Azure to maximise value from the technology stack
Experience with working in an Agile/ Dev-Ops environment will be beneficial to the team as improved practices/ways of working need to be implemented
Strong Business engagement, leadership, analytical and problem-solving skills
WHY WORK FOR US
In return we offer our employees real and meaningful benefits such as;
NFP salary packaging ($15,900 tax free) plus meals and entertainment benefits;
Flexible working conditions;
Paid parental leave;
Financial, retail and lifestyle discounts and benefits;
An inclusive culture of dedicated, passionate and professional team members;
Positively supporting and impacting the lives of others through your career contribution.
Opportunity for career development;

About RedEye!
We provide the first fully cloud-based and purpose-built engineering data management solution for asset owners and their service providers globally.
We work with critical infrastructure organisations across industries such as water, energy, mining, infrastructure, healthcare, government (national parks and wildlife), and defence to improve the safety and productivity of their critical assets, in real time.
What began as an ambitious start-up in Brisbane in 2012 as a way for engineers to manage their engineering information has today evolved into a recognised leader in assets data management delivery, helping our clients manage over $250bn of assets. This is our RedEye story...so far.
Headquartered in Brisbane, we currently have a team of 89 across ANZ, the Philippines and North America.
We are a customer focused organisation, with a commitment to growth and continuous improvement. We are proud of the values we live by every day that shape the success of our team and the experience of our customers:
“I've got your back”
“I get sh*t done”
“We're making a difference”
About the Opportunity
As RedEye's Data Engineer, you will be responsible for migrating, processing, and transforming large amounts of data / files into the RedEye database as part of implementation projects. To be successful in this role, you will need to build a deep understanding of how RedEye's clients provide Engineering and asset data and have strong attention to detail with programming skills (Python, SQL, algorithms and data structures) and advanced Excel. Advanced written and verbal communication skills, providing client reporting and requirements elicitation.
Responsibilities
Data Migration:
Review Client Engineering Drafting Standards and other required artefacts and attendance at Client Engineering Data Migration requirements sessions
Perform data analysis (files and meta data) and creation of documentation of findings (ensure these are in suitable business format for client consumption)
Creation of Client Data Migration plan informing and specification of migration method
Preparation of data for migration including managing any data improvement (e.g., binary duplicates)
Preparation of Migration Manifest, matching files to metadata, assigning workflows and groups to artefacts and reviewing with client
Execute the data migration in RedEye DMS or appropriate system, validate migration
Perform revision consolidation analysis of engineering data and creation of Revision Consolidation Manifest
Complete post migration activities including automated and manual QA review and error analysis
Documentation of migration procedures and their continual development
Documentation of migration scripts and their continual development
Work with Dev/Ops teams to define tools and rules to improve the data migration and management process
Scope and assist to implement data improvement related opportunities with the Customer Operations and Account Management teams
Business Analysis & Technical Configuration:
Support the definition and documentation of business logic such as workflow mapping, and success criteria that supports the solution design
Support the translation of customer requirements into requirements definitions & input into solution design to achieve customer outcomes
Executing upon technical configuration tasks for RedEyeDMS products or environment based on client requirements
Engage with Project Manager and Technical Analyst to clarify solution requirements, answer queries and support UAT for solution development
About You:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Systems or related technical discipline
Post graduate Data Science qualifications highly regarded
Advanced knowledge of BI Power & Python
Working experience of SQL, PowerShell, algorithms and data structures and advanced Excel
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite, Teams, SharePoint and experience with Agile productivity tools (i.e., JIRA, Confluence etc) understands what impact variable data quality has on product performance and user experience
Ability to distinguish and communicate the difference between user error and actual system defects and document same
Ability to write clean, well-documented and reusable code and scripts in accordance with secure coding guidelines
Understanding of Agile project management methodology, approaches, tools, and phases of program/project lifecycles
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills enabling you to navigate customer processes and providing technical expertise related to the RedEye products
Excellent attention to detail
Why RedEye?
On top of being a leader in the delivery of assets data management, with a diverse team of talented and supportive professionals we also offer:
A chance to work on impactful greenfield projects, creating critical learning solutions that drive internal capabilities within our teams, and create awesome experiences for our customers
A genuine opportunity to take advantage of flexible working arrangements so you can be at your best both at work and in your personal time (work from home flexibility is the norm here)
A promise to not hold you back with red tape and excessive procedures that are counterproductive (strong emphasis on “I get sh*t done” here)
A commitment to your health and wellbeing, with discounted gym memberships and 2 annual RedEye Recharge Days, so you can take the time you need, just for yourself

Perform data analysis (files and meta data) and creation of documentation of findings (ensure these are in suitable business format for client consumption)
Creation of Client Data Migration plan informing and specification of migration method
Preparation of data for migration including managing any data improvement (e.g., binary duplicates)
Preparation of Migration Manifest, matching files to metadata, assigning workflows and groups to artefacts and reviewing with client
Execute the data migration in RedEye DMS or appropriate system, validate migration
Perform revision consolidation analysis of engineering data and creation of Revision Consolidation Manifest
Complete post migration activities including automated and manual QA review and error analysis
Documentation of migration procedures and their continual development
Documentation of migration scripts and their continual development
Work with Dev/Ops teams to define tools and rules to improve the data migration and management process
Scope and assist to implement data improvement related opportunities with the Customer Operations and Account Management teams
Business Analysis & Technical Configuration:
Support the definition and documentation of business logic such as workflow mapping, and success criteria that supports the solution design
Support the translation of customer requirements into requirements definitions & input into solution design to achieve customer outcomes
Executing upon technical configuration tasks for RedEyeDMS products or environment based on client requirements
Engage with Project Manager and Technical Analyst to clarify solution requirements, answer queries and support UAT for solution development
About You:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Systems or related technical discipline
Post graduate Data Science qualifications highly regarded
Advanced knowledge of BI Power & Python
Working experience of SQL, PowerShell, algorithms and data structures and advanced Excel
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite, Teams, SharePoint and experience with Agile productivity tools (i.e., JIRA, Confluence etc) understands what impact variable data quality has on product performance and user experience
Ability to distinguish and communicate the difference between user error and actual system defects and document same
Ability to write clean, well-documented and reusable code and scripts in accordance with secure coding guidelines
Understanding of Agile project management methodology, approaches, tools, and phases of program/project lifecycles
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills enabling you to navigate customer processes and providing technical expertise related to the RedEye products
Excellent attention to detail
Why RedEye?
On top of being a leader in the delivery of assets data management, with a diverse team of talented and supportive professionals we also offer:
A chance to work on impactful greenfield projects, creating critical learning solutions that drive internal capabilities within our teams, and create awesome experiences for our customers
A genuine opportunity to take advantage of flexible working arrangements so you can be at your best both at work and in your personal time (work from home flexibility is the norm here)
A promise to not hold you back with red tape and excessive procedures that are counterproductive (strong emphasis on “I get sh*t done” here)
A commitment to your health and wellbeing, with discounted gym memberships and 2 annual RedEye Recharge Days, so you can take the time you need, just for yourself
Help us empower organisations that empower the world - Apply Now About RedEye!
We provide the first fully cloud-based and purpose-built engineering data management solution for asset owners and their service providers globally.
We work with critical infrastructure organisations across industries such as water, energy, mining, infrastructure, healthcare, government (national parks and wildlife), and defence to improve the safety and productivity of their critical assets, in real time.
What began as an ambitious start-up in Brisbane in 2012 as a way for engineers to manage their engineering information has today evolved into a recognised leader in assets data management delivery, helping our clients manage over $250bn of assets. This is our RedEye story...so far.
Headquartered in Brisbane, we currently have a team of 89 across ANZ, the Philippines and North America.
We are a customer focused organisation, with a commitment to growth and continuous improvement. We are proud of the values we live by every day that shape the success of our team and the experience of our customers:
“I've got your back”
“I get sh*t done”
“We're making a difference”
About the Opportunity
As RedEye's Data Engineer, you will be responsible for migrating, processing, and transforming large amounts of data / files into the RedEye database as part of implementation projects. To be successful in this role, you will need to build a deep understanding of how RedEye's clients provide Engineering and asset data and have strong attention to detail with programming skills (Python, SQL, algorithms and data structures) and advanced Excel. Advanced written and verbal communication skills, providing client reporting and requirements elicitation.
Responsibilities
Data Migration:
Review Client Engineering Drafting Standards and other required artefacts and attendance at Client Engineering Data Migration requirements sessions
Perform data analysis (files and meta data) and creation of documentation of findings (ensure these are in suitable business format for client consumption)

Documentation of migration procedures and their continual development
Documentation of migration scripts and their continual development
Work with Dev/Ops teams to define tools and rules to improve the data migration and management process
Scope and assist to implement data improvement related opportunities with the Customer Operations and Account Management teams

Support the definition and documentation of business logic such as workflow mapping, and success criteria that supports the solution design
Support the translation of customer requirements into requirements definitions & input into solution design to achieve customer outcomes
Executing upon technical configuration tasks for RedEyeDMS products or environment based on client requirements
Engage with Project Manager and Technical Analyst to clarify solution requirements, answer queries and support UAT for solution development
About You:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Systems or related technical discipline
Post graduate Data Science qualifications highly regarded
Advanced knowledge of BI Power & Python
Working experience of SQL, PowerShell, algorithms and data structures and advanced Excel
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite, Teams, SharePoint and experience with Agile productivity tools (i.e., JIRA, Confluence etc) understands what impact variable data quality has on product performance and user experience
Ability to distinguish and communicate the difference between user error and actual system defects and document same
Ability to write clean, well-documented and reusable code and scripts in accordance with secure coding guidelines
Understanding of Agile project management methodology, approaches, tools, and phases of program/project lifecycles
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills enabling you to navigate customer processes and providing technical expertise related to the RedEye products
Excellent attention to detail
Why RedEye?
On top of being a leader in the delivery of assets data management, with a diverse team of talented and supportive professionals we also offer:
A chance to work on impactful greenfield projects, creating critical learning solutions that drive internal capabilities within our teams, and create awesome experiences for our customers
A genuine opportunity to take advantage of flexible working arrangements so you can be at your best both at work and in your personal time (work from home flexibility is the norm here)
A promise to not hold you back with red tape and excessive procedures that are counterproductive (strong emphasis on “I get sh*t done” here)
A commitment to your health and wellbeing, with discounted gym memberships and 2 annual RedEye Recharge Days, so you can take the time you need, just for yourself
Help us empower organisations that empower the world - Apply Now Show more

Company Description
The Dev/Sec/Ops Engineer will develop and own the Dev/Sec/Ops practices for MedHealth’s Practice Management platform. The Dev/Sec/Op’s Engineer will be focusing on building automated platforms/environments, enable the shift to daily releases through CI/CD practices, prepare systems for movement to cloud and subsequent operating model.
The role does not require a 100% CyberSecurity Expert, rather it would suit an all-rounder who is customer oriented. The person must have a strong engineering and coding background with extensive experience in migrations, solutions design and application and network support with skills and a passion for CyberSecurity.

Job Description

Responsible for the automation of repetitive tasks required to maintain a secure and up-to-date operational environment.
Be an enabler for developers, software and operational engineers, working closely with various teams to build and integrate modern tools, best practices and techniques into our environment.
Contribute to the securing of infrastructure so that the data and operations of the organisation are protected from harm, both malicious and inadvertent.
Promote and drive the adoption of enterprise-wide DevSecOps standards, guidelines and best practices.
Support the product development team by being the bridge between software development, testing and operations teams, prioritise build activities and ensure that DevSecOps tools are effective and automate release and test plans.
Working with scripting languages such as powershell, chocolatey and exposure to cloud related technologies.Maintain and improve our information security management system and ensure continued compliance with ISO27001, NIST and Government Standards.
Ensure that MedHealth cybersecurity standards and tools are integrated into the build and development process.
Create optimal CI/CD environments and methodologies for the assigned product vertical teams
Enable the drive to implement daily release cycles.
Provide and share a broad knowledge of technologies and architectures and function as a DevSecOps mentor within the Technology teams
Maintain an in-depth understanding of technologies and stay abreast of current industry trends and emerging technologies.Maintaining high quality secure code and infrastructure, identifying and remediating security vulnerabilities
Assist with monitoring the ongoing performance of the tools and ensure outages are resolved in a timely manner
Ensure training and on-boarding materials are regularly maintained.
Embrace a culture of continuous improvement, by establishing a sustainable framework of continuous integration, quality assurance monitoring and testing
Enable a consistent integration environment that sustains high productivity levels and emphasises defect prevention.
Function as an effective, positive team member
Maintain active knowledge of work health and safety practices and procedures
Adhere to all policy and procedures
Carry out other reasonable duties as required

Qualifications

Tertiary Qualifications in relevant field or extensive experience.
Demonstrated experience working within a similar role
Experience within Health, government and Employment services highly regarded

Behaviors aligned with MedHealth’s core values.
Demonstrated ability to influence across teams to achieve organisational goals
Effective problem solving with the ability to provide effective solutions within established frameworks and resources.
Sound commercial acumen plus outcome focused.
Ability to work with a high attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to work effectively within a team environment to achieve organisational and team goals.
Additional Information
You are welcome here.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, proudly welcoming people with disability including mental health conditions, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds, people from the LGBTQI community, veterans, carers and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians to our team. When you join MedHealth, we want you to bring your whole self to work – and we value your unique contribution. Company Description

job_title: PHP Developer - Payments Technology Company Job in Sydney
listing_jobDesc:
Responsibilities

About the business
Mint helps companies of all sizes transact in more rewarding ways — whenever, wherever and however customers want to pay. We believe every transaction a business makes should add value for both the business and the customer.
Founded in Australia, and with over 15 years' experience in FinTech, over 20,000 active users and over A$3B in transactions processed to date, Mint has developed a proprietary and innovative payment solution that is fast, transparent, cost-effective, and secure.
Due to our enhanced payment capabilities and product streams, we are looking for a Senior Java Developer to join our technology team based in Sydney.
Job Purpose
A truly unique opportunity exists to work on a highly sophisticated and successful system that is well positioned to become a world leader in payment technology. We require a PHP Developer to become a part of our Australian-based payments company. Reporting to the Head of Engineering, you will be a key member of the Technology team.
Currently working in a remote working from home environment with potential to go into office periodically as needed.
What will you be doing?
Coding solutions with a product mindset as part of a highly skilled team
Solving complex problems
Ensuring coding standards are adhered to and coding with security in mind
Approving code submitted by other team members as part of the review process
Working with our clients to solve their problems and business needs
Coding back end solutions will be the focus but if work on the front end and honing your UI skills is important to you we can also make that happen.
Performing unit testing on your own work and being part of the QA process for your peers
There is the opportunity to learn AWS Dev Ops skills or hone those skills if you already have them.
To be successful you will need:
Technical skills - essential:
3+ years in object oriented PHP & JavaScript development experience
Experience with API integrations to 3rd party systems
Experience working in an Agile workplace and associated frameworks
Experience with bug/issue management software such as Jira
Strong experience with versioning software such as BitBucket
Strong QA / UAT ethics is mandatory
Experience performing peer reviews of code for deployments
Technical skills - highly regarded:
Understanding of eCommerce and online payments industry advantageous
Development experience with Java and related technologies frameworks highly regarded
Knowledge of frameworks such as Vue, JQuery
Knowledge with automation tools such as Bamboo or Ansible is highly regarded
Experience with release CI/CD processes
Experience working in an AWS or Cloud environment highly regarded
Demonstration of knowledge of application security - (PCI-DSS)
Non-technical skills:
Strong attention to detail
Able to work well both as part of a team & autonomously
Proactive, self starter and a strong work ethic
Strong ability to liaise with 3rd party vendors following issues right through to completion
Strong analytical skills and proactive attitude to problem solving
Ability to think long term and develop long term development plans and solutions
Strong written and verbal communication skills
We offer a fantastic work environment and culture with a focus on career development, team building and social activities. Our employees work on the latest technologies, across multiple platforms and we have a strong culture of engineering excellence. We are a friendly professional team and believe in delivering great solutions.
Mint is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity.
Candidates must have the right to work in Australia.
Due to a high volume of applicants, only those shortlisted will be contacted.
Benefits Responsibilities

Due to a high volume of applicants, only those shortlisted will be contacted. About the business
Mint helps companies of all sizes transact in more rewarding ways — whenever, wherever and however customers want to pay. We believe every transaction a business makes should add value for both the business and the customer.
Founded in Australia, and with over 15 years' experience in FinTech, over 20,000 active users and over A$3B in transactions processed to date, Mint has developed a proprietary and innovative payment solution that is fast, transparent, cost-effective, and secure.
Due to our enhanced payment capabilities and product streams, we are looking for a Senior Java Developer to join our technology team based in Sydney.
Job Purpose
A truly unique opportunity exists to work on a highly sophisticated and successful system that is well positioned to become a world leader in payment technology. We require a PHP Developer to become a part of our Australian-based payments company. Reporting to the Head of Engineering, you will be a key member of the Technology team.
Currently working in a remote working from home environment with potential to go into office periodically as needed.
What will you be doing?
Coding solutions with a product mindset as part of a highly skilled team
Solving complex problems
Ensuring coding standards are adhered to and coding with security in mind
Approving code submitted by other team members as part of the review process
Working with our clients to solve their problems and business needs
Coding back end solutions will be the focus but if work on the front end and honing your UI skills is important to you we can also make that happen.
Performing unit testing on your own work and being part of the QA process for your peers
There is the opportunity to learn AWS Dev Ops skills or hone those skills if you already have them.
To be successful you will need:
Technical skills - essential:
3+ years in object oriented PHP & JavaScript development experience
Experience with API integrations to 3rd party systems
Experience working in an Agile workplace and associated frameworks
Experience with bug/issue management software such as Jira
Strong experience with versioning software such as BitBucket
Strong QA / UAT ethics is mandatory
Experience performing peer reviews of code for deployments
Technical skills - highly regarded:
Understanding of eCommerce and online payments industry advantageous
Development experience with Java and related technologies frameworks highly regarded
Knowledge of frameworks such as Vue, JQuery
Knowledge with automation tools such as Bamboo or Ansible is highly regarded
Experience with release CI/CD processes
Experience working in an AWS or Cloud environment highly regarded
Demonstration of knowledge of application security - (PCI-DSS)
Non-technical skills:
Strong attention to detail
Able to work well both as part of a team & autonomously
Proactive, self starter and a strong work ethic
Strong ability to liaise with 3rd party vendors following issues right through to completion
Strong analytical skills and proactive attitude to problem solving
Ability to think long term and develop long term development plans and solutions
Strong written and verbal communication skills
We offer a fantastic work environment and culture with a focus on career development, team building and social activities. Our employees work on the latest technologies, across multiple platforms and we have a strong culture of engineering excellence. We are a friendly professional team and believe in delivering great solutions.

Location:
Williams Landing, AU
Category: Information Technology
Work Type: Permanent Full Time
Who are We?

At Target, we’ve always been here to help families live better. But right now, we can see that what ‘better’ means is changing. Better means making choices that can change the world. Better is about a life that’s lived, not with more things, but with things that mean more. A life where quality is always valued over quantity. Where beauty is born from style and substance in equal measure. A better way of life, that’s within easy reach of all. That’s why everything from the products we make to the experience we create, is crafted with intention and a single purpose…To inspire families to live better.


What will you do?

If you’re a highly technical, hard-working Service Delivery Analyst with excellent communication skills and retail exposure or experience, who’s looking for a hands-on new role, working together with a skilled and experienced team within the Kmart/Target group? This is the role for you!
As our new Service Delivery Analyst, you will be the escalation point for P1 & P2 coordination and the key communication with our stakeholders. You will ensure the effectiveness of Target technology services both online and in store, this role will suit a reliable problem solver with a keen sense of innovation and who thrives in team environments.


What are we looking for?
Responding to minor and major incident reports across the Kmart Group 24/7
Delegating and managing the right technical resources and third parties to minimize interruptions throughout the organization
Managing service delivery via ITL principles while ensuring SLA systems are met
Communicating with internal and external stakeholders
Solving complex problems with your experience/exposure in incident management
Lead meetings on post incident reviews to identify root causes and problem solve plans for mitigation
Demonstrate a safe working environment, leading by example and identifying and reporting safety concerns confidently
Assist to guide and motivate the team for continuous improvement in engineering, with a focus on Agile, dev ops and lean principles and practices

To be successful in this role you’ll have:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, this role will have you engaging with and informing stakeholders at all levels of incident reports (P1 High Vis P2)
Have a customer centric and team player mindset
Experience in ITL principles and cross-functional /matrixed operations
Strong Agile knowledge and experience
Knowledge or exposure in the retail sector, store operations and eCommerce highly regarded
Tertiary qualification desirable but not essential
This role will see you working on a 24/7 roaster providing out of hours and on call support
Don’t think you tick all the boxes? Apply now and we will be in touch!

What will you get?

Target Has Some Great Benefits, Including
Great career opportunities across the Wesfarmers Group
Team Member discounts across Target, Kmart, Bunnings, Officeworks, and Catch Membership.
Access to Employee Assistance Program
Convenient location next to freeway and train station, with onsite parking and a café!
Novated leasing options
Paid parental leave scheme
Flexible work arrangements

Target values diversity and we pride ourselves on representing the diverse and multicultural communities of which we are a part.
As part of our recruitment process, we will be conducting Pre-Employment Checks with our successful candidates – this will include a police check. Talent Acquisition will provide further updates to candidates as they progress through our recruitment process.
Candidates interested in this position should apply directly to this advertisement as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.
We don’t just look for people based on their skills and experience, our people work together and champion the Target values and behaviours. We are a business where our values and people matter, and we need like-minded people to join us!

We don’t just look for people based on their skills and experience, our people work together and champion the Target values and behaviours. We are a business where our values and people matter, and we need like-minded people to join us!
Target values diversity and we pride ourselves on representing the diverse and multicultural communities of which we are a part.
 Who are We?

At Target, we’ve always been here to help families live better. But right now, we can see that what ‘better’ means is changing. Better means making choices that can change the world. Better is about a life that’s lived, not with more things, but with things that mean more. A life where quality is always valued over quantity. Where beauty is born from style and substance in equal measure. A better way of life, that’s within easy reach of all. That’s why everything from the products we make to the experience we create, is crafted with intention and a single purpose…To inspire families to live better.


What will you do?

If you’re a highly technical, hard-working Service Delivery Analyst with excellent communication skills and retail exposure or experience, who’s looking for a hands-on new role, working together with a skilled and experienced team within the Kmart/Target group? This is the role for you!
As our new Service Delivery Analyst, you will be the escalation point for P1 & P2 coordination and the key communication with our stakeholders. You will ensure the effectiveness of Target technology services both online and in store, this role will suit a reliable problem solver with a keen sense of innovation and who thrives in team environments.


What are we looking for?
Responding to minor and major incident reports across the Kmart Group 24/7
Delegating and managing the right technical resources and third parties to minimize interruptions throughout the organization
Managing service delivery via ITL principles while ensuring SLA systems are met
Communicating with internal and external stakeholders
Solving complex problems with your experience/exposure in incident management
Lead meetings on post incident reviews to identify root causes and problem solve plans for mitigation
Demonstrate a safe working environment, leading by example and identifying and reporting safety concerns confidently
Assist to guide and motivate the team for continuous improvement in engineering, with a focus on Agile, dev ops and lean principles and practices

To be successful in this role you’ll have:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, this role will have you engaging with and informing stakeholders at all levels of incident reports (P1 High Vis P2)
Have a customer centric and team player mindset
Experience in ITL principles and cross-functional /matrixed operations
Strong Agile knowledge and experience
Knowledge or exposure in the retail sector, store operations and eCommerce highly regarded
Tertiary qualification desirable but not essential
This role will see you working on a 24/7 roaster providing out of hours and on call support
Don’t think you tick all the boxes? Apply now and we will be in touch!

What will you get?

Great career opportunities across the Wesfarmers Group
Team Member discounts across Target, Kmart, Bunnings, Officeworks, and Catch Membership.
Access to Employee Assistance Program
Convenient location next to freeway and train station, with onsite parking and a café!
Novated leasing options
Paid parental leave scheme
Flexible work arrangements
