At GenesisCare we want to hear from people who are as passionate as we are about innovation and working together to drive better life outcomes for patients around the world.
Do you want to work on products that improve the world we live in? If you join GenesisCare’s Digital Solutions team you can not only work on a modern tech stack, but you also get to work on a suite of products that is helping improve the standard of care that cancer patients receive, and you get to join a dynamic, fun team of genuinely good humans.
About the position:
We are searching for a mid level software engineer with full stack or front end experience, to join one of our three teams building modern Single Page Apps for Doctors, Nurses and Patients.
Our front-end is built using React with Hooks, apollo with graphQL, the backend is build using the Python Django framework. We maintain code quality with Jest + Enzyme for unit testing, Cypress for automation testing and Eslint to follow TypeScript standards
About you:
You will be someone who can think outside the box, challenges the status quo, has high energy levels and is someone that wants to work in a dynamic, fun, fast paced environment.
With a passion for building web applications that users love, you are looking for an environment where you can learn and grow in a fun, supportive team.
You are either a full stack engineer with experience of SPA’s or a front end engineer where your framework of choice is React.
Skills and Experience for success:
4+ years experience working in software development in particular web applications
3+ years of Python (Django) or React
Experience with GraphQL frameworks such as Apollo or Relay is a bonus
Experience with build tools such as Docker
Demonstrated experience creating and maintaining automation tests like cypress, jest or pyunit
About Us:
The Digital Solutions team at GenesisCare has a vision to deliver evidence-based care around the world using a common platform to improve patient experience and life outcomes. We do this by building products for Patients, Doctors, Nurses & Radiation Therapists. Our products are built to provide intelligent automated workflows to drive consistency across the treatment journey, we leverage Machine Learning to improve decision support for staff, ultimately with the goal of improving patient’s lives.
Technologies we use:
Front-end: Webpack, TypeScript, React, Apollo, GraphQL, SCSS, Styled Components, Jest, Cypress
Backend: Python Django, Graphene, Redis, Redis Streams, Celery, Fast API etc.
Hosting/Ops: AWS, Docker, Terraform, DataDog, Cloud Watch, Sentry, Elastic Cache, Redash
How we work:
Teams: Each product engineering team consists of 3-5 engineers, a PO and either a BA or a Designer and Clinical Subject Matter expert. Teams are cross-functional, self-organised and most use a flavour of Scrum with a 2-week sprint.
Guilds: Guilds are a place to share knowledge and experiences across tech, product and clinical areas. We have a weekly tech guild/tech reading club and a quarterly clinical guild where we hear from Doctors, Nurses and Patients that use our applications.
Test focused: We like to test the code we build, and we have a continuous integration infrastructure in place that runs our tests on every push.
DevOps mindset: We are cloud first, and everything outside local dev is hosted in AWS. Each team is responsible for deployments and monitoring of their own services. All work is managed through GitHub and Jira.
Privacy and data security: we take our patients’ right to privacy seriously, and are continuously enhancing our practices to achieve this, while supporting our products’ deployments in multiple regions, including the EU and US.
Remote First: We have distributed teams across the UK, USA and Australia. We have a remote first principle and have evolved our team ways of working during the last few years of remote work. Note, if you are Sydney based, our team in Sydney do get together once a week at our head office for some good old-fashioned face to face time.

Just imagine your future with us…
Aurecon is committed to creating an inclusive culture that embraces diversity, equity and inclusion – and we provide our people with flexible working opportunities.
We believe diverse teams enable us to solve our clients' and society's most complex problems in unconventional and distinctive ways. We offer flexible working as it enables all our employees to balance work and life in way that works for them.
Aurecon is an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality, as awarded by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (Australia), and are a founding member of The Diversity Agenda in New Zealand. We also have a Reconciliation Action Plan and hold Silver Employer status in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI+ inclusion. Across our company, inclusive leadership is role modelled from the top and is an expectation of all.
Our flexible way of working includes our flexible start and finish times, working from home, part time and job share options. Aurecon also offers 14 weeks paid parental leave, three weeks paid partner leave, and other health services and benefits.
If this is how you would like to work, you’d be a good fit, we’d love to hear from you. We welcome people of all identities from all background and with diverse accessibility needs. We’re curious about your career path and how we can support you to be your best.
The Role
The core purpose of the IT Digital Solution Architect is to design and develop fit for purpose digital solutions for Aurecon’s IT applications and IT systems. This may include the implementation of simple applications as well as the customisation of standard software products.
Here are the key things you will do to ‘bring ideas to life’.
Own the end to end responsibility for the development and delivery of the technical design and resulting solution, covering aspects from the relevant Business, Data, Application, Technology and Security domains and working with the various project stakeholders to achieve this.
Consider transitional requirements and address any gaps present between the project artefacts and the Operational acceptance criteria
Manage project stakeholder expectations throughout the delivery lifecycle of the project
Produce high level, detailed level design documents and other technical deliverables for a solution
Ensure that solutions compliment technologies defined on strategic roadmaps and that solutions align with design and architecture principles
Identify and address any potential gaps in the transitional and target architecture
What we are looking for
Tertiary qualification in Information Systems, Computer Science or related discipline
Experience in IT infrastructure design, system integration and platform migrations, specifically Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Service Fabric and Microsoft Office 365.
ITIL qualification highly desirable
Experience in developing with distributed teams, work spread across geographies and time zones
Progressive software design and development experience, specifically with Azure Dev Ops, App Service and Cosmos DB.
Experience in analysing, isolating and interpreting business needs and designing appropriate technical solutions
We value the difference each team member brings, and we look for people who have had a broad range of experiences and a growth and learning mindset.
About us
We’ve re-imagined engineering.
Aurecon is an international engineering, design, and advisory company, but not as you know it!
Drawing on our deep pool of expertise, we co-create innovative solutions with our clients to some of the world’s most complex challenges.
We listen deeply and intently, which helps us see opportunities, possibilities and potential others can’t. Think engineering. Think again.
Want to know more?
You can learn more about what it’s like to work at Aurecon by visiting the careers section of our website.
If you are intrigued or excited by what you have read, then we want to hear from you. Apply now! Just imagine your future with us…
Aurecon is committed to creating an inclusive culture that embraces diversity, equity and inclusion – and we provide our people with flexible working opportunities.
We believe diverse teams enable us to solve our clients' and society's most complex problems in unconventional and distinctive ways. We offer flexible working as it enables all our employees to balance work and life in way that works for them.
Aurecon is an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality, as awarded by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (Australia), and are a founding member of The Diversity Agenda in New Zealand. We also have a Reconciliation Action Plan and hold Silver Employer status in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI+ inclusion. Across our company, inclusive leadership is role modelled from the top and is an expectation of all.
Our flexible way of working includes our flexible start and finish times, working from home, part time and job share options. Aurecon also offers 14 weeks paid parental leave, three weeks paid partner leave, and other health services and benefits.
If this is how you would like to work, you’d be a good fit, we’d love to hear from you. We welcome people of all identities from all background and with diverse accessibility needs. We’re curious about your career path and how we can support you to be your best.
The Role
The core purpose of the IT Digital Solution Architect is to design and develop fit for purpose digital solutions for Aurecon’s IT applications and IT systems. This may include the implementation of simple applications as well as the customisation of standard software products.
Here are the key things you will do to ‘bring ideas to life’.
Own the end to end responsibility for the development and delivery of the technical design and resulting solution, covering aspects from the relevant Business, Data, Application, Technology and Security domains and working with the various project stakeholders to achieve this.
Consider transitional requirements and address any gaps present between the project artefacts and the Operational acceptance criteria
Manage project stakeholder expectations throughout the delivery lifecycle of the project
Produce high level, detailed level design documents and other technical deliverables for a solution
Ensure that solutions compliment technologies defined on strategic roadmaps and that solutions align with design and architecture principles
Identify and address any potential gaps in the transitional and target architecture
What we are looking for
Tertiary qualification in Information Systems, Computer Science or related discipline
Experience in IT infrastructure design, system integration and platform migrations, specifically Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Service Fabric and Microsoft Office 365.
ITIL qualification highly desirable
Experience in developing with distributed teams, work spread across geographies and time zones
Progressive software design and development experience, specifically with Azure Dev Ops, App Service and Cosmos DB.
Experience in analysing, isolating and interpreting business needs and designing appropriate technical solutions
We value the difference each team member brings, and we look for people who have had a broad range of experiences and a growth and learning mindset.
About us
We’ve re-imagined engineering.
Aurecon is an international engineering, design, and advisory company, but not as you know it!
Drawing on our deep pool of expertise, we co-create innovative solutions with our clients to some of the world’s most complex challenges.
We listen deeply and intently, which helps us see opportunities, possibilities and potential others can’t. Think engineering. Think again.
Want to know more?
You can learn more about what it’s like to work at Aurecon by visiting the careers section of our website.

Nova Systems Geospatial is a multidisciplinary team of Software Developers, Designers, DevOps Specialists and Geospatial Consultants with a proven track record of building and supplying innovative, high value enterprise spatially enabled software and data solutions. The Geospatial team leads the development of software and geospatial solutions and the provision of geospatial products at Nova Systems. Our services are a significant part of Nova’s broad range of professional services across Defence, Essential Services, Land Management, Government, Utilities, Energy and Resources.

We are flexible in the way we work, and receptive to improving process and ways of bringing new ideas to life through innovation. We challenge convention when it is in the interest of our customers and actively seek employees that think the same way. Our success is built on collaboration, so you can expect to work closely with your colleagues and customers in our mission to build and deliver high value solutions.

We pride ourselves on transparency, compassion for our people and building a safe, fun, and inclusive environment where everyone has the freedom to be their full self. Just to seal the deal, you'll get heaps of flexibility on how you work and be part of a culture where you can contribute and succeed.

About the role:

As a Software Engineer in our Geospatial Solutions team, you will have the opportunity to lead the design and development of a variety of exciting software projects, including web and geospatial applications, backend data processing and analytics frameworks, cloud dev-ops platforms, and mobile applications. You can expect to engage with a range of clients across a number of industry sectors including emergency services, land management and defence.

Please note: Some of the projects and clients we work on require an AGSVA Security Clearance, if this is required, we will discuss with you during your application process. You must be an Australian Citizen to achieve this type of clearance.
What will you be involved in:
Code development for UIs, API’s, back-end components, and data ETL processes for solutions deployed to web, desktop, and cloud environments
Supporting technical requirements elaboration and creation of user stories and acceptance criteria
Developing automated unit and integration tests
Working under Agile (scrum) development and release processes in a team environment
Contributing to the preparation of technical documentation and software architecture documents
Engaging with clients and stakeholders to demonstrate work in progress and receive feedback
Supporting technical pre-sales activities, estimation of services work and technical input into business development and bid activities
Sharing knowledge and mentoring junior staff to develop and improve the Nova Systems software development capability
Contribute to initiatives to standardize our software development approach
What we would like from you:
Strong software development and coding skills using modern languages (e.g. Javascript, .NET), frameworks (e.g. AngularJS) and database technologies (RDBMS, NoSQL)
Experience in the practical application of the Agile development methodology through requirements analysis, backlog management, sprint planning, testing, and release
Experience using scripting languages (such as Python) to customise applications and automate processes
Working knowledge of the deployment of custom software solutions to cloud infrastructure
Strong interpersonal skills (proactive, consultative, and professional approach)
Able to analyse and understand complex processes and information workflows
Comfortable using configuration management tools and testing frameworks
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment and customer facing role
Desirable requirements:
Experience with commercial or Open-Source geospatial platforms such as ESRI, FME, Mapbox, Geoserver, Leaflet, or Google
Knowledge of devops and contemporary cloud automation processes and tools (such as serverless, CI/CI pipelines, infrastructure as code)
Certification in relevant standards and software, such as the Scrum process and AWS/Azure accreditation
Typical experience:
A bachelor’s degree in software engineering, information technology, computer science (or equivalent)
4-8 years hands-on experience in a software development consulting environment or internal software development team
Broad general ICT experience across software development, infrastructure, and cloud technologies
Nova’s Value Proposition; Beyond the pay cheque:
In addition to salary, you are supported with:
Flexible working conditions to suit individual needs and dress for your day
Commitment to Professional and Personal Development (up to $5000 per year)
Reward & Recognition Program offering exclusive discounts from hundreds of major retailers, helping you to save on groceries, petrol, holidays and more!
Additional Leave entitlements include Reserve Leave, Loyalty Leave, Parental Leave and Purchased Leave
Wellbeing Hub with access to health and fitness content
Employee Assistance Program for employees and family members
Access to Defence Health and Travel Insurance
Novated Leasing and Salary Sacrifice
Nova Employee Share Offer
An inclusive and supportive culture
A range of other great benefits, just ask us!
To apply, please click on the "apply now" button and submit your resume using the "upload resume" function in PDF Format (only).

Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please call Lily in Nova Talent Acquisition Team on: (08) 8252 7100

Why Kyndryl
Kyndryl was spun-off of IBM IT infrastructure services in 2021. Our global base of customers includes 75 of the Fortune 100 companies. With 88,449 skilled professionals operating from over 100 countries, we are committed to the success of our customers, collaborating with them, and helping them to realise their ambitions.

We help our customers design, manage, and modernise the technology systems they depend on every day. Kyndryl is the ‘hearts and lungs’ because we support mission critical infrastructure.

Kyndryl has operations in 63 countries; 450 data centres around the world are under our management. We have the majority of mainframe capacity, generating and running 9 million automated actions per month for our customers.
Your Role and Responsibilities
Mission
As an Enterprise Security Architect in Kyndryl’s Security and Resiliency practice you will be client facing trusted technical advisor. You will be responsible for translating the client’s business requirements to define the structures of solutions and architectures, including systems, applications, and process components.
Role Purpose
The Architect understands client needs, works in levels of abstraction, applies industry knowledge, and leverages appropriate business elements and information technology to address those needs. This includes working with client personnel and executives to identify functional and non-functional requirements and subsequently working with and leading others in the identification, justification, and design of the client's solution.
Outcomes
You will be responsible for a wide range of architectural activities from requirements analysis through systems, application and/or process design specification. At the Senior level or higher, the position requires significant knowledge across multiple platforms, processes, or architectures, as well as broad knowledge of new technologies, and will include directing the architectural efforts of less experienced architects.
You will bring strong technical expertise to help drive these projects to success.
Key Stakeholder Relationships
External
This specialty helps client IT and business executives understand key Cloud and Infrastructure security issues, risks, exposures, and vulnerabilities. They develop the architecture and detailed technical designs for Infrastructure & Endpoint using commercially available and open source products, as well as defined standards and policies with Kyndryl Methods, Reference Architectures and Technical Work Products to provide assessments and solutions, including Mobility Solutions, which will help their clients achieve their business and security objectives.
Internal
You will work with a variety of internal staff including:
pre-sales teams for solution validation and network architecture expertise.
Account, program and project managers to ensure your solutions are deliverable in both a timely and costly manner.
subject matter experts to achieve client objectives and ensure the client deliverables created align with the architecture and design, and
operations teams to ensure your solutions are supportable and functioning.
Key Accountabilities
Create repeatable architectures, solutions, and documentation to be used at scale in developing and evolving enterprise technologies.
Work with engineering teams to define detailed solutioning methodologies as well as providing expertise and guidance.
Interface with customers on all technical including lab trials, testing and deployments.
Work with cross functional teams (network, cloud, software, compute) to ensure integration and requirements meet customer acceptance criteria and external compliance requirements.
Propose new, creative solutions for complex, system-wide problems.
Explore novel approaches to system integration between new and existing security technologies
Communication
Develops intentional, devoted relationships and connections with influential people including C-level contacts. Builds strategic networks for the organisation’s benefit using higher order political savvy and astuteness.
Growth Mindset
Stimulates innovation by having a curious mindset, asking questions to understand and examine assumptions. Takes calculated risks, and experiments. Actively disrupts their own, and the organisation and industry’s thinking and practice. Removes organisational and industry barriers to innovation
Leadership
Leads in an empathetic, humble manner balancing fierce strategic resolve with genuine openness to new ideas and different perspectives. Reflects and cares for how organisational-level decisions affect others and their future. Aligns effort and works with the leadership group to drive the future ambitions of Kyndryl.
Drives results
Drives and stretches business performance to exceed expectations. Pushes to meet or beat commercial goals, and personally improves performance so the organisation and its strategic partners can create improved results.
Deep technology/ domain expertise
A recognised leader in the IT services field, and the public face of Kyndryl Cloud Services. Shares and contributes to thought leadership that advances the industry.
Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Subject matter expertise in Application Security, Data & Privacy Security, Cloud Security, or Cryptography is highly regarded.
Microsoft Azure Solutions Architect & Security Certified (AZ-303 / AZ-304 & AZ-500 or equivalent)
Expertise in both low level and high-level design within a B&F or Enterprise environment.
Knowledge of Enterprise Architecture disciplines and frameworks including TOGAF, SABSA and Risk Management.
Experience taking ownership of Stakeholder and Partner Management, promoting Enterprise Security across the organisation.
Proven negotiation capabilities by engaging, informing, and influencing key stakeholders and business partners.
Experience reviewing new and existing projects for information security compliance by developing, documenting, and communicating adherence to architecture policies & standards.
Proven capabilities in recommending improvement opportunities within portfolio to drive continuous security improvement and ensure Westpac remains innovative and up to date with market leading technologies and industry trends.
Proven SIEM solution skills.
Preferred Technical and Professional Experience

Preference for Architect Profession certification (e.g., TOGAF)
Preference for Federal Clearance
Familiarity with Dev-Ops, Dev-Sec-Ops, Dev-Net-Ops.
Understanding of information technology platforms (desktop, midrange, mainframe, and applications)
Understand and apply knowledge of architectural frameworks and engagement models
CISSP, GSEC, CISM, or CISA preferred.
Required Education
Bachelor's Degree
Preferred Education
Bachelor's Degree

Kyndryl is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. Kyndryl is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

About Datadog:
Datadog is a best-in-class SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth, profitability, and stock market appreciation. Built by engineers, for engineers, our monitoring and security platform is used by organisations of all sizes across a wide range of industries to enable digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers' entire technology stack. We're dedicated to creating, developing, and supporting our product and customers, allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops, and Security teams globally. Come join the team for an exciting opportunity to learn from top-level leaders and colleagues and grow alongside the company as we rapidly expand.


The Team:
Our sales team works with a best-of-breed product that solves real problems for our customers. Sellers follow a well-defined methodology that helps them identify the customer's unique needs and clearly convey the value of the Datadog product. Whether you're looking to learn from the best or be the best, the Datadog sales team is dedicated to furthering personal development and team success.


The Opportunity:
We are searching for an experienced Enterprise Sales Executive to join our growing team in Melbourne that has a real passion for technology and can deliver on bold revenue targets. As we continue to break into bigger deals, and formalise our support for the larger enterprise segment, this division within Datadog will blaze the path for the organisation's growth. This is a lucrative opportunity to penetrate new accounts within a rich territory, as well as nurture others underway with their move to the cloud.


You Will:

Prospect into some of the largest organisations in Victoria while running an efficient sales process
Manage and grow an existing portfolio of strategic Datadog customers
Maintain, build and own specific relationship maps for your territory including existing relationships and aspirational contacts
Develop a deep comprehension of customer's business priorities and attach our solution value accordingly
Negotiate favourable pricing and business terms with large commercial enterprises by selling value and ROI
Handle existing customer expectations while expanding reach and depth into assigned territory
Demonstrate resourcefulness when faced with challenges that defy easy solution
Have intuitive sense of necessary steps to close business and gain customer validation
Identify robust set of business drivers behind all opportunities
Ensure high forecasting accuracy and consistency

You Are:

Someone with 5+ years experience in complex solution selling (mix of field selling within mid-market and enterprise)

Driven and have met/exceeded direct sales goals of 1M+ and operated with an average deal size of $100k+ (ARR)

Able to demonstrate methodology to prospect and build pipeline independently

Experienced in working for an innovative tech company (SaaS, IT infrastructure or similar preferred)

Experienced in selling into large fortune 1000 companies with the ability to win new logos

Highly ambitious and career growth focused with a long term view

Bonus Points:*

Familiarity with Command of the Message and MEDDICC sales disciplines

President's Club, top rep, top percentile performer, consistent YoY overachievement

Consistent deal sizes of $500k+

Why You Should Apply:

Friendly, diverse and inclusive workplace culture
President's Club for top performers

Continuous Sales training and career growth

New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan

Generous and competitive global benefits

Equal Opportunity at Datadog:

Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.


Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog's Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice. #LI-CB1

Our client is looking for a DevOps Engineer to assist in implementing the best DevOps strategy and the CI/CD within the organization.
Responsibilities:

Latest tech / agile environment (Scrum)
Junior role | Opportunity to develop and grow your skills
Norwest location | Access to flexible working arrangements

About Us?
Inchcape Australasia employs over 1,200 team members across Australia and New Zealand. As part of a global company, our purpose is to bring mobility to the world’s communities - for today, for tomorrow and for the better. Across Australia and New Zealand, we have a diverse portfolio spanning distribution, where we hold the custodianship for some of the worlds most recognised brands; fulfilment, where we are the market leader in integrated, omni-channel automotive fulfilment solutions; retail, where we deliver an exceptional experience at every stage of the customer journey and financial services, where we deliver the right financial services solution to our distribution brand networks, retail businesses and customers.
Our diverse and rich history inspires us to adopt a longer-term perspective contributing to a more sustainable and responsible automotive industry while generating a positive impact for our customers and community.

What is the opportunity?
We are looking for an eager Full Stack Developer to join our team and help us build and continuously improve our Subaru Australia web assets. You will be responsible for bringing a “best-in-class” customer experience for our well known and growing brand.
Reporting directly to the Customer Journey Manager and working closely with the CX & Digital and wider Marketing teams, you will support the design and implementation of our Subaru applications, tools and practices. You will thrive in an environment where you can continuously challenge yourself and look for opportunities to improve.

Additional responsibilities will include:

Design and code the back end and front-end components of the application.
Monitor the quality and performance of the application.
Help build/improve the dev-ops pipeline.
Propose and implement new tools, best practices and methodologies.
Conduct code reviews.
Write Unit and Integration tests for the front and back end.
Help configure and manage the cloud environments.
Use of Jira and Confluence to keep work status and technical documentation updated.

About you:

Software development experience (ideally 12 months or more commercial experience) in .Net.
Front end development experience (React preferred).
Sound knowledge of JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 and a CSS pre-compiler (e.g. SASS / LESS).
Experience with version control tools like Git.
Experience working in an Agile environment.
Ability to diagnose and solve application performance problems
CMS experience (Umbraco or similar) is preferred but not essential
Experience with cloud environments preferred but not essential (AWS or Azure).

Why should you make the move to Inchcape?

Global career opportunities and progression as a member of a global company, Inchcape.
Flexible work framework
Additional days off - extra 3 days of paid Family Leave every 3 years, plus 1 day each year of paid Volunteer Leave.
Corporate Health Plan through Bupa which includes discounts on pet/car/home and contents insurance, and complimentary access to the Bupa Life Skills Program (series of online, interactive sessions).
Access to our employee benefits program including company car rental program, discounts on vehicle purchases and services, free annual flu vaccination and an employee wellbeing program.

At Inchcape, we believe the true power of diversity cannot be realised without an inclusive culture and that talent is equally distributed across society. Inchcape is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace where the power of our differences can be embraced and everyone feels they can belong, be themselves and succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, Inchcape actively encourages applicants from all identities, backgrounds, and experiences, helping ensure our workforce is representative of the global communities we operate in.

If you think you have what it takes, but don’t necessarily meet every single requirement, we encourage you to apply so we can have a conversation to see if you could be a great fit. If you have individual adjustments required to participate in the recruitment process, please notify us in your application or contact inchcaperecruitment@inchcape.com.au.
If you this sounds like the role and company for you, we warmly invite you to apply today and take advantage of this great opportunity to be part of a leading global automotive company!

Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted. We take this opportunity to thank you for your interest in working with us.

Working at Atlassian
Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.
With a sufficient timezone overlap with the team, we’re able to hire eligible candidates for this role from any location in Australia and New Zealand. If this sparks your interest, apply today and chat with our friendly Recruitment team further.
Are you a maker who you loves helping others do their best work? Get on board as a Senior Developer on Atlassian's Jira team!
Jira is one of the most popular and powerful development tools for software teams in the world! It is also Atlassian's largest product, with hundreds of engineers working on our cloud offering across the globe.

You’ll work as part of a small, high-energy team delivering incredible, creative improvements for our engineering teams. You will be working on world class dev-ops tools, creating shared components and services while guiding the teams with conventions and techniques. You will collaborate with other developers - your customers - to make tools and systems that are a delight to use and multiply the potential of those around you. You'll also use your analytical skills to make sure we're solving the right problems.
More about you?Experience designing and building a production-level web application, including:Great experience across the board with a strong depth of knowledge in JavaDeep architectural understanding of web applicationsGreat creative and innovative problem-solving skillsInitiative and the ability to work independently and in a teamInterest to learn more about new technologies (such as languages and frameworks)
If you've got some of these skills, even better:
Experience with monitoring techniques and tools.Experience with continuous delivery for production environment.Experience with agile software development methodologies like Kanban or Scrum
Our perks & benefits
To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more.
About Atlassian
The world’s best teams work better together with Atlassian. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team.
We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
To learn more about our culture and hiring process, explore our Candidate Resource Hub. Working at Atlassian

We Believe in Better!
We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people’s lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.
At Unisys, we believe in better! Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.
Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients’ successes while giving back to communities and making this world a safer and more secure place to live and work. Our success is a direct result of the work of our people who live and breathe our Core Beliefs . Simply put, we believe in better lives. Join us!
Learn more about Unisys and our key solution offerings: Unisys , Stealth™ , CloudForte® , InteliServe™

What success looks like in this role
You will provide support, design and develop enhancements to an existing .NET production application and SQL Server maintenance. You will be actively working with the client as well as Unisys architects to help design the solutions for the client.
Key responsibilities & outcomes:
Analyse requirements to design and create application solutions
Apply key .NET concepts and techniques in the design and construction of solutions
Delivery of security/access requirements in an application
Performance tuning and system maintenance
#LI-RL1
You will be successful in this role if you have:
Minimum 3 years .NET C# applications
MSDN certified preferred
Proven solution design experience
Microsoft .NET, including Windows Application development.
Windows Desktop development ( Win Form, WPF)
Entity Framework knowledge
Advanced MS Office / Office 365 integration skills
Service Oriented Architecture and Client server architecture knowledge
Visual Studio
C#
Advanced SQL Server Development
Microsoft Reporting Services development
Experience working in an Agile environment desirable
Experience with Dev Ops tools sets and processes desirable.

About Datadog:

Datadog is the world-class monitoring and security platform for cloud applications. We're dedicated to creating, developing, and supporting our product and customers, allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally. Built by engineers, for engineers, our SaaS product is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries to enable digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers' entire technology stack. Given the resilience of cloud technologies and importance placed today in digital operations and agility, Datadog continues to innovate and is well positioned for the long term.


The team:
Our sales team works with a best-of-breed product that solves real problems for our customers. Sellers follow a well-defined methodology that helps them identify the customer's unique needs and clearly communicate the value of the Datadog product. Whether you're looking to learn from the best or be the best, the Datadog sales team is dedicated to furthering personal development and team success.


The Opportunity:
Datadog is the monitoring and analytics platform for developers, IT teams and business users in the cloud age. We're scaling our Inside Sales team in Sydney to help IT and Technology leaders recognize Datadog's impact in their digital transformation and migration to the cloud. This is an opportunity to bring a proven product, loved by thousands of customers, to a multi-billion dollar market.


You will:

Focus 100% on net new logo acquisition
Manage the full sales cycle
Run and partner with Sales Engineers on demos
Use tools such as Sales Navigator and ZoomInfo
Strategically prospect into CTOs, Engineering/IT Leaders, & technical end users


You Are:

Focused on hunting and closing net new logos
A top performer with a history of success
Bold on the phones, and creative in your emails
Able to strategically map out and break into accounts
Motivated, curious, hungry, and driven as a sales person


Bonus Points:

Passionate about tech and the cloud space
Experience with SaaS/Cloud and Salesforce
Why You Should Apply:

Continuous career development and pathing opportunities
Sales training in MEDDIC and Command of the Message
Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space
Best in breed onboarding
Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally
New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan
Generous and competitive benefits
Friendly and inclusive workplace culture

Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog's Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice. #LI-SG3

NTT DATA is heavily investing globally in providing state of the art analytical solutions to its clients. Our capability has been focused locally, regionally in APAC and globally by forming strategic partnerships including Microsoft Azure, SAP Analytics, Snowflake, Matillion and many more, leveraging the strength of our cloud and network assets via the NTT group of companies.

The Senior Data Engineer (Azure) will focus specifically on developing solutions leveraging cloud-based data platforms and associated technologies (folloing the NTT DATA MDP architecture – Modern Data Platform). The Senior Data Engineer for MDP is expected to develop the required competency to lead and deliver successful outcomes in projects, develop pre-sales materials, engage in pre-sales activities, identify value propositions for customers, input into practices for strategic development in specific area(s) of expertise, and to maintain knowledge and educate the branch/sales/practices as required. They will work with the MDP Solution Manager to identify additional skills required within the practice and assist in developing required training curriculums.
The purpose of this position is to contribute to the overall analytics performance by supporting sales, through extensive collaboration, knowledge sharing and ensuring overall understanding for their area of expertise.

Key Responsibilities

Analyses current business practices, processes, and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics Services.
Provide technical leadership and thought leadership as a senior member of the Analytics Practice in areas such as data access & ingestion, data processing, data integration, data modelling, database design & implementation, data visualization, and advanced analytics.
Engage and collaborate with customers to understand business requirements/use cases and translate them into detailed technical specifications.
Lead quality assurance (QA) activities from design to implementation phase of the proposed MDP solutions to customers.
Collaborate with project managers for project/sprint planning by estimating technical tasks and deliverables.
Engage with clients’ leadership and technology teams in strategic discussions to provide technical strategy and industry guidance to improve their long-term business goals.
Leading pre-sales activities associated with MDP related opportunities, including development of targeted demos, presales collateral, and solution positioning documents
Assist in the development of AMS (support) models, including the required collateral from a presales perspective to help promote AMS offering and positioning to customers
Staying abreast of the latest developments in the modern data platform area (especially Azure analytics services), sharing information and running education sessions with the NTT DATA BS team and customers
Contribute and provide support to MDP relevant analytics innovation initiatives (aka Go To Market development)
Lead small and large teams in delivering solutions for customers.
Develop best practices including reusable code, libraries, patterns, and consumable frameworks for cloud-based data warehousing and ETL.
Maintain best practice standards for the development or cloud-based data warehouse solutioning including naming standards.

Critical Knowledge, Skills & Experience

Experience in designing and hands-on development in cloud-based analytics solutions.
Expert level understanding on Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Azure SQL, Azure Data Lake, and Azure App Service is required.
Designing and building of data pipelines using API ingestion and Streaming ingestion methods.
Knowledge of Dev-Ops processes (including CI/CD) and Infrastructure as code is essential.
Experience in developing NO SQL solutions using Azure Cosmos DB is essential.
Thorough understanding of Azure and AWS Cloud Infrastructure offerings.
Strong experience in common data warehouse modelling principles including Kimball, Inmon.
Experience in additional Modern Data Platforms related technologies such as Snowflake, Matillion, BryteFlow and Tableau are a distinct advantage
Knowledge in Azure Databricks, Azure IoT, Azure HDInsight + Spark, Azure Stream Analytics, Power BI is desirable
Knowledge of Microsoft BI Stack (SSRS/SSAS (Tabular with DAX & OLAP with MDX) SSIS) is desirable.
Knowledge of C# and Hands-on with Powershell scripting is desirable.
Working knowledge of Python is desirable
Experience developing security models.

Technical Soft Skills:
Strong customer engagement skills to understand customer needs for Analytics solutions fully.
Experience in leading small and large teams in delivering analytics solutions for customers Have demonstrated ability to define, develop and implement data models and supporting policies, standards, and guidelines.
Strong data analysis and analytical skills.
Have demonstrated the ability to guide the development of data requirements for projects and drive a user experience that is easy to use and delivers the right information at the right time.
Experience in working in a fast-paced agile environment
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
You will:
Be an excellent communicator both written and verbal
Have strong interpersonal skills, with the demonstrated ability to engage well internally with colleagues within NTTDBS and with customers effectively who have both technical and non-technical backgrounds to develop shared solutions
Have excellent creative problem-solving skills, including undertaking research to inform problem definitions
Be excited about all things data
Be a team player liaising with innovation, sales, and analytical teams across NTTDBS
A ‘Leader in me’ always ensuring leading by example
Be 100% flexible on National travel

Innovation is at the heart of how we work with our customers and how we live and breathe as a team. We are creative, passionate, ambitious and authentic, and we challenge ourselves to get the best outcomes for people and customers in an ever-evolving technology-driven world.

Working at NTT DATA Business Solutions has the feeling of an established start-up that values connection, transparency and trust. This personal approach is teamed with the global scale of one of the largest IT groups in the world.

Find yourself at new career heights with exposure to the latest technologies and working in partnership with customers who truly want to evolve in their journey with us.
Do you have questions?
We are looking forward to receiving your completed application documents.

Title: Test Analyst
Location:
Bentleigh East, Victoria, AU
About us

At Officeworks we make bigger things happen. Our customers, our team, and our community are our heart and soul. And if our brilliant people have taught us anything, it is that we can do all kinds of incredible things, each and every day.

Fast paced. Innovative. Inspiring. With more than 8000 team members and a national footprint of more than 165 retail stores Australia wide – we’re focused on delivering a wide range, low price and great service. We’re about inspiring new ideas and thinking outside the box. We’re about kicking goals, having a laugh and pushing each other. We are about being rewarded and supported. We’re about teaching a customer something new and supporting the community. We’re about making a difference.

About the role

We are excited to announce a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Quality Assurance Analyst to join our Customer Experience team. This exciting role will ensure product quality and customer experience by verifying the intended scope is executed in the right way and at all appropriate junctures of the implementation of a solution.

As a QA Analyst with Officeworks, you have full autonomy and accountability of the quality of what you’re delivering- you are your own Test Manager! In addition, you will Test and Release using world leading practices and tools in Continuous Integration and Delivery, Automation and Agile testing approaches.

As a Quality Assurance Analyst, you will be responsible for specifying, developing and writing test plans, test scripts and producing test cases. You will carry out regression testing using automated and manual test software applications in order to test the behaviour, functionality and integrity of the Officeworks website.


About you

This role will see you working with Micro Services Single Page Application Technology in a Dev Ops environment. This would be the perfect opportunity for a candidate with a strong manual testing background to develop their skillset and more experience in the automated testing space.
You will be someone who is creative and loves to challenge the status quo, you have an inquisitive side with an interest in customer experience to drive great results. You'll also be exceptional communicator who thrives working as part of a close knit team in a fast paced every changing environment.

Additionally, you will have:
Demonstrated experience in a similar role and the ability to work in fast paced Agile environment
Ability to own end-to-end QA process within a team till production release
Experience with test management tools including TestRail
Experience with Automated Test Suite (Nightwatch, Selenium and Cucumber)
Experience with CI/CD software delivery tool such as Jenkins
Worked with open-source automation tools e.g. Cypress
Our culture

At Officeworks we make bigger things happen. Our customers, our team, and our community are our heart and soul. And if our brilliant people have taught us anything, it is that we can do all kinds of incredible things, each and every day.

Fast paced. Innovative. Inspiring. About the role

We are excited to announce a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Quality Assurance Analyst to join our Customer Experience team. This exciting role will ensure product quality and customer experience by verifying the intended scope is executed in the right way and at all appropriate junctures of the implementation of a solution.

As a QA Analyst with Officeworks, you have full autonomy and accountability of the quality of what you’re delivering- you are your own Test Manager! In addition, you will Test and Release using world leading practices and tools in Continuous Integration and Delivery, Automation and Agile testing approaches.

As a Quality Assurance Analyst, you will be responsible for specifying, developing and writing test plans, test scripts and producing test cases. You will carry out regression testing using automated and manual test software applications in order to test the behaviour, functionality and integrity of the Officeworks website.


About you

This role will see you working with Micro Services Single Page Application Technology in a Dev Ops environment. This would be the perfect opportunity for a candidate with a strong manual testing background to develop their skillset and more experience in the automated testing space.
You will be someone who is creative and loves to challenge the status quo, you have an inquisitive side with an interest in customer experience to drive great results. You'll also be exceptional communicator who thrives working as part of a close knit team in a fast paced every changing environment.

Additionally, you will have:
Demonstrated experience in a similar role and the ability to work in fast paced Agile environment
Ability to own end-to-end QA process within a team till production release
Experience with test management tools including TestRail
Experience with Automated Test Suite (Nightwatch, Selenium and Cucumber)
Experience with CI/CD software delivery tool such as Jenkins
Worked with open-source automation tools e.g. Cypress

Date 18th May 2022
TECH DIRECTOR
Your brain is comfortable seamlessly transitioning from the minute detail of coding to day-to-day problem solving, to big-picture thinking. With sound commercial acumen, you also have a flair for communicating the complex
You know tech inside and out and genuinely enjoy providing guidance to clients and team members, so they have a thorough understanding of key technology trade-offs and are empowered to make informed decisions.
A once in a lifetime opportunity to be a part of our award-winning team (including subject matter experts in strategy, delivery, data, digital, CX, media and creative), as Tech Director you'll be building out your dream team and building world-first, transformational products for a brand new fintech start up as well as incubating technology start-ups internally for the agency.
This is an exciting, newly created, and pivotal role for AFFINITY – the #2 Most Effective global agency and one of AFR’s Best Places to Work 2021 – helping us to grow our tech and digital offering as we expand into 2022 and beyond.
Could this be you?
Technically Terrific With a minimum of 10 years in development, you’re the go-to person for all agency and client tech queries, with experience in building web or software applications, .php, Drupal, dev ops, AWS/Snowflake, integration and an interest in CDP, CRM, and marketing clouds. Phew.
Coding Yoda Creator of code frameworks defined to solve client briefs, writing and testing code to ensure it meets quality standards, performance targets and business requirements.
PM Proficient You’re a natural collaborator and leader, providing guidance and assisting teams to complete RFP’s, project scoping, sizing, and pricing estimates, keeping things on track and on budget.
Information Architect You’re well versed in identifying hardware and software components an application will use for implementation. You able to easily translate business and functional requirements and can prepare application and system architecture deliverables. You’re a subject matter expert, providing recommendations keeping up with all new products and technologies to determine fit with the overall application
AFFINITY is The Outcomes Agency. We’re a full-service advertising, CX and media team committed to delivering business-transforming ideas and work for our clients. We’re pretty chuffed to have some heavy-weight global and local awards on our shelves, in fact, we’ve just been recognised as #2 globally by WARC Effective 100. And we’re not doing too badly for ourselves with a number of recent business wins to our name. A welcoming, supportive culture, we’re serious about being the best at what we do, whilst looking out for one another. Our office is smack bang in a great inner-city spot with awesome cafés and public transport on our doorstep. We also enjoy a lot of nice food and wine when we can too!

See yourself being part of a large, transformational change? This could be the role for you!
Who we we:
At Iress, we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players, we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better every day. Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 2,300 people across Australia, the United Kingdom, Africa, Canada, France, New Zealand and Asia.
The opportunity we have:
The Senior Engineer role for someone who is passionate about delivering world class products at scale using data, Cloud technologies, JavaScript, Typescript, React, AWS serverless, infrastructure as code, Dev Ops and more. This is an opportunity to bring your engineering craft and expertise to data products that deliver value to clients using both data processing and full stack development.
The Senior Engineer is a role that is responsible for delivering against the various aspects of product engineering from inception to deployment and production support. The role is performed by engineers who have demonstrated proficiency in several technical specialisations, such as “Software”, “Data”, “Security”, “Support & Reliability” and will have or gain deep knowledge in one or more business domains (e.g. Trading, Lending, Advice).
Some of the great stuff you will be doing:
Working with a mixture of technologies including AWS serverless (Glue, Athena, QuickSight etc.), React, Javascript, Typescript, Python, Node.js, Terraform, BuildKite
Join and add to an energetic, supportive and open team culture
Produces high-quality, robust and resilient software, whether through the development of new code or the modification and improvement of existing code. Ensures quality is "built-in" and ensures quality is inspected appropriately using automation testing techniques.
Contributes positively to the team, provides relevant and appropriate inputs to enable effective team outcomes to be delivered.
Fosters and develops strong working relationships with the wider technology group. Will mentor/coach more junior engineers, and take feedback or seek guidance from more senior engineers.
Effectively manages work, whether assigned or taken. Ensures dependencies, issues or risks on other teams are known and owns remediation of such.
Provides mentoring to less-experienced engineers, ensuring an uplift in the quality of new code or changes to existing code.
Contributes to, or leads in the design of features and non-functional outcomes within the software.
Ensures leverage and scale is gained by working cross-functionally and cross-team. Uses or contributes to platform services.
Ensures software security is appropriate and remediates efficiently if inadequacies arise
What would be the ideal experience for you to have:
Experienced full stack engineer and an expert in at least one object oriented language e.g. Python, C#, C++ or Java.
Experience delivering using JavaScript, Typescript, React, NodeJS or similar technologies.
Experience using AWS serverless services
Experience deploying infrastructure as code using Terraform and Bash scripting
Data analysis using SQL, Spark, Panda or similar
Proven ability to navigate ambiguity and collaborate with other functional teams to ensure consistency and quality outcomes
Experience in, or has owned commercial outcomes for software, whether through acquisition or consumption.
Experience working with product management in product and solution design
Will test the status quo and enjoys thinking about and implementing innovative ways to solve problems - and in doing this is not afraid to fail!
Has a growth mindset and excitement about tackling the next challenge with a team, understands that growth comes from continuously developing through hard work
Experience working within and across teams, including non-technology teams. Experience contributing to aspects of effective team functioning.
Strong 'DevOps' focus and experience building and deploying infrastructure with cloud deployment technologies. Has experience applying effective security measures.
Some of the great things we offer:
Six paid days per year to extend your weekends
State-of-the-art offices
Equity grants for our top 25% performers
Annual Profit Share when Iress meets its annual profit targets
Access to learning and development programs through Udemy
Three days’ leave per year for charity initiatives
Global 36-hour hackathon
Starting school leave - 8.5 days to assist your kids with the transition to school
Discounted health insurance premiums
Up to 26 weeks paid parental leave for primary carers (up to four weeks for secondary carers), and the ability to work part-time when returning to work.
Employment Type
Employee
Time Type

Experience working with product management in product and solution design 
Will test the status quo and enjoys thinking about and implementing innovative ways to solve problems - and in doing this is not afraid to fail! 
Has a growth mindset and excitement about tackling the next challenge with a team, understands that growth comes from continuously developing through hard work 
Experience working within and across teams, including non-technology teams. Experience contributing to aspects of effective team functioning. 
Strong 'DevOps' focus and experience building and deploying infrastructure with cloud deployment technologies. Has experience applying effective security measures.  
Some of the great things we offer: 
Six paid days per year to extend your weekends 
State-of-the-art offices 
Equity grants for our top 25% performers 
Annual Profit Share when Iress meets its annual profit targets 
Access to learning and development programs through Udemy 
Three days’ leave per year for charity initiatives 
Global 36-hour hackathon 
Starting school leave - 8.5 days to assist your kids with the transition to school 
Discounted health insurance premiums 
Up to 26 weeks paid parental leave for primary carers (up to four weeks for secondary carers), and the ability to work part-time when returning to work.  
Employment Type  
Time Type Show more

About us


Lendi Group is the new group born out of the merger of Aussie Home Loans and Lendi. The business consists of two powerhouse brands that are committed to changing the experience of home lending for all Australians by removing barriers and the unnecessary admin from consumers and brokers alike.

Lendi Group operates a multi-brand strategy across Aussie Home Loans and Lendi, pulling together a truly personalised home loans experience for the Australian audience that balances both human support and smart technology.


What you’ll be doing:


You will be a valued member of our engineering team. We value evidence-backed opinions and will have the opportunity to play an integral part in driving the engineering team’s rhythm, culture and processes with opportunities in planning and resource allocation, architecture and design, coding, deployment, and support.

Collaborates with teams to support the evaluation of planned changes, to minimise security risk
Work in security initiatives such as:
Penetration testing
Security monitoring
Vendor assessments
Threat Modelling
Working and coding with engineering teams to increase their developmental security practices
Improve security by building and maintaining cloud and microservice solutions
Collaborating with the operations team to improve our security posture through COTS products and network infrastructure
Vulnerability and Threat Management - Monitoring and Assessment, in the k8s container space.
Collaborating with other business units such as compliance, marketing and data as required
Working as part of a cross-functional dev/ops and sec/ops team as an individual contributor
Be able to identify, analyse and address security concerns
Establishes and promotes automated IT security solution frameworks for re-use in development and production scenarios.


What you’ll bring:


A passion for promoting a security-first culture where security is at the forefront of everyone’s mind
A solid and up-to-date understanding of security best practices, with a focus on cloud controls, design, incident handling procedures and management
A desire to make security simple
Experience securing microservices deployed to the cloud
Experience working with configuration as code and CI/CD
A strong grasp on best practices and the ability to guide
A “You build it, you own it!” mentality
A desire to continually improve the way in that you and your teamwork
The ability to communicate clearly and effectively with your peers, managers and stakeholders
Empathy for your colleagues and the challenges they face
Deep knowledge of networking, infrastructure and applications from a DevOps perspective with a security focus
Hands-on experience in implementing and maintaining security controls across a range of infrastructure, including Cloud.
Knowledge and experience with cloud-native security tooling (particularly in AWS), as well as access management solutions (Auth0)
Experience with logging and monitoring in a security context
A passion for maintaining high-quality secure code, identifying common coding flaws, security issues around operation and management of software.
Perform security assessments to ensure that vulnerabilities are patched and security best practices are applied


It would be great to bring, but is not required to have:


Experience working with AWS e.g. CloudFormation, Terraform, IAM, WAF
Experience with Node.js and/or Typescript
Experience with Docker and containerised environments
Experience with Serverless and serverless architectures
Experience in securing workloads in a Kubernetes environment
Understanding of event-driven systems
A background in software development
An interest in “red team” methodologies


Some of our perks & benefits:


Enjoy the flexibility of remote working arrangements: while headquartered in Sydney, we are open to applicants across the Eastern Seaboard.
We take career development seriously. We have the opportunities, budget and frameworks in place to propel your career in the direction you want to take it!
An additional week’s Loyalty Leave each year after reaching 3 years’ service
We offer generous Paid Parental Leave: we celebrate our growing Lendi Group family with 18-26 weeks leave for primary carers and up to 4 weeks for secondary carers
Regular social and team building activities.
We run wellness initiatives with a strong focus on psychological safety
Close-knit, friendly culture with a warm & casual environment.


Our commitment to diversity

To learn more about life at Lendi Group check out our blog: https://www.lendi.com.au/inspire/category/life-at-lendi/

Lendi is proud to be accredited by Project F for commitment to removing systemic barriers for women in technology!

Is innovation part of your DNA? Do you want to enable a connected future for people, organizations, and society?
Join our growing global NTT team and you’ll be part of the world’s largest ICT company (by revenue). We’ve combined the capabilities of 28 remarkable companies to become one, leading technology services provider. Together, we help our people, clients, and communities do great things with technology to create a more secure and connected future. We employ 40,000 people across 57 countries. By bringing together the world’s best technology companies and emerging innovators, we work together to deliver sustainable outcomes to businesses and the world. Innovation is part of our DNA. We believe it’s key to what makes us different. So, we strive to move forward, challenge the status quo, and drive excellence through the technologies we integrate and the services we deliver around the world. The result is connected cities, connected factories, connected healthcare, connected agriculture, connected conservation, connected mobility, and connected sport. Together we enable the connected future.

Want to be part of the team?

We’re seeking a multiple Implementation Engineers to join our Professional Service business on based in Brisbane CBD. This role will be working within our infrastructure business to deliver and support quality networking outcomes for our clients.

Our data centre team designs, builds and migrates large data centre infrastructure using the latest in technology from vendors such as Cisco, Dell EMC, Microsoft, NetApp, and VMware. Today’s clients use hybrid cloud – a mixture of private cloud and public cloud such as Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure – requiring a new and different skill set to deliver their vision.

What you can do: Exposure to key vendors in data centre infrastructure, plus market leaders in public cloud. You will work with engineers, consultants and solution architects who have decades of experience in data centre technology, providing support and guidance as well as knowledge transfer. You will encounter everything from meeting with clients to designing and deploying solutions, as well as helping to troubleshoot our clients’ problems.

Repeated and demonstrable project experience in the network domain across some/all the following areas:

On Prem Scenarios
o Storage
o Compute
o Compute Virtualisation
o Data Backup, Archiving and Migration

Cloud-based
o Public Cloud Platforms & architecture
o Cloud Migrations
o Hybrid-Cloud Architectures
o Dev/Ops and Automation

Vendor product exposure required and a blend of some of the following:

On Prem Tech
o Dell/EMC
o NetApp
o VMWare
o Cisco Computing Solution
o HPe Computing/Storage Solution
o Hyper-Converged Solutions (HyperFlex, VxRail, Simplivity, and Nutanix)
o Pure Storage
o CommVault (Incl Metallic)
o Veeam

Cloud-based
o Azure
o Google Cloud
o AWS

VMWare on Hyperscalers
o VMWare Cloud on AWS
o Azure VMWare Solution
o Google Cloud VMWare Engine

Vendor/Industry Certifications are preferred but not mandatory
Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.

For more information about this or other opportunities, please contact Vaibhav Gusani. Please quote our job reference number 566001.

Nova Systems Geospatial is a multidisciplinary team of Software Developers, Designers, DevOps Specialists and Geospatial Consultants with a proven track record of building and supplying innovative, high value enterprise spatially enabled software and data solutions. The Geospatial team leads the development of software and geospatial solutions and the provision of geospatial products at Nova Systems. Our services are a significant part of Nova’s broad range of professional services across Defence, Essential Services, Land Management, Government, Utilities, Energy and Resources.

We are flexible in the way we work, and receptive to improving process and ways of bringing new ideas to life through innovation. We challenge convention when it is in the interest of our customers and actively seek employees that think the same way. Our success is built on collaboration, so you can expect to work closely with your colleagues and customers in our mission to build and deliver high value solutions.

We pride ourselves on transparency, compassion for our people and building a safe, fun, and inclusive environment where everyone has the freedom to be their full self. Just to seal the deal, you'll get heaps of flexibility on how you work and be part of a culture where you can contribute and succeed.

About the role:

As a Senior Software Engineer in our Geospatial Solutions team, you will have the opportunity to lead the design and development of a variety of exciting software projects, including web and geospatial applications, backend data processing and analytics frameworks, cloud dev-ops platforms, and mobile applications. You can expect to engage with a range of clients across a number of industry sectors including emergency services, land management and defence.
This role requires an AGSVA NV1 Security Clearance, you will need to be an Australian Citizen and willing to achieve one, if you don't already hold one.

What will you be involved in:
Working within a talented and motivated multidisciplinary team, with a focus on building high quality software solutions and products
Implementing solutions using contemporary technologies, frameworks and approaches - e.g., React, AWS, Serverless, Infrastructure as Code
Leading architecture development, technical solution design and driving coding standards
Delivering a broad range of exciting projects in the geospatial domain
Estimating the scope and time required to deliver projects
Contributing to the overall technical direction of the team
What we would like from you:
Strong architectural pattern knowledge and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated experience in web development technologies and techniques
Demonstrated skills in modern software engineering methods, such as object orientation, API development, test driven development and continuous delivery
Knowledge of modern DevOps approaches such as containerisation and infrastructure as code
Demonstrated skills with RDBMS and NoSQL databases
Experience with cloud computing, specifically AWS and/or Azure Services and associated processes, systems and integration
Comfortable in a customer facing role
A passion for working in a team environment, and a desire to learn new skills and share your knowledge
Experience with ESRI and Open-Source geospatial (GIS) platforms highly regarded
Nova’s Value Proposition; Beyond the pay cheque:

In addition to salary, you are supported with:
Flexible working conditions to suit individual needs and dress for your day
Commitment to Professional and Personal Development (up to $5000 per year)
Reward & Recognition Program offering exclusive discounts from hundreds of major retailers, helping you to save on groceries, petrol, holidays and more!
Additional Leave entitlements include Reserve Leave, Loyalty Leave, Parental Leave and Purchased Leave
Wellbeing Hub with access to health and fitness content
Employee Assistance Program for employees and family members
Access to Defence Health and Travel Insurance
Novated Leasing and Salary Sacrifice
Nova Employee Share Offer
An inclusive and supportive culture
A range of other great benefits, just ask us!
To apply, please click on the "apply now" button and submit your resume using the "upload resume" function in PDF Format (only).

Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please call Lily in Nova Talent Acquisition Team on: (08) 8252 7100

Our success is built on collaboration, so you can expect to work closely with your colleagues and customers in our mission to build and deliver high value solutions.

We pride ourselves on transparency, compassion for our people and building a safe, fun, and inclusive environment where everyone has the freedom to be their full self. Just to seal the deal, you'll get heaps of flexibility on how you work and be part of a culture where you can contribute and succeed.

About the role:

As a Senior Software Engineer in our Geospatial Solutions team, you will have the opportunity to lead the design and development of a variety of exciting software projects, including web and geospatial applications, backend data processing and analytics frameworks, cloud dev-ops platforms, and mobile applications. You can expect to engage with a range of clients across a number of industry sectors including emergency services, land management and defence.
This role requires an AGSVA NV1 Security Clearance, you will need to be an Australian Citizen and willing to achieve one, if you don't already hold one.

What will you be involved in:
Working within a talented and motivated multidisciplinary team, with a focus on building high quality software solutions and products
Implementing solutions using contemporary technologies, frameworks and approaches - e.g., React, AWS, Serverless, Infrastructure as Code
Leading architecture development, technical solution design and driving coding standards
Delivering a broad range of exciting projects in the geospatial domain
Estimating the scope and time required to deliver projects
Contributing to the overall technical direction of the team
What we would like from you:
Strong architectural pattern knowledge and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated experience in web development technologies and techniques
Demonstrated skills in modern software engineering methods, such as object orientation, API development, test driven development and continuous delivery
Knowledge of modern DevOps approaches such as containerisation and infrastructure as code
Demonstrated skills with RDBMS and NoSQL databases
Experience with cloud computing, specifically AWS and/or Azure Services and associated processes, systems and integration
Comfortable in a customer facing role
A passion for working in a team environment, and a desire to learn new skills and share your knowledge
Experience with ESRI and Open-Source geospatial (GIS) platforms highly regarded
Nova’s Value Proposition; Beyond the pay cheque:

In addition to salary, you are supported with:
Flexible working conditions to suit individual needs and dress for your day
Commitment to Professional and Personal Development (up to $5000 per year)
Reward & Recognition Program offering exclusive discounts from hundreds of major retailers, helping you to save on groceries, petrol, holidays and more!
Additional Leave entitlements include Reserve Leave, Loyalty Leave, Parental Leave and Purchased Leave
Wellbeing Hub with access to health and fitness content
Employee Assistance Program for employees and family members
Access to Defence Health and Travel Insurance
Novated Leasing and Salary Sacrifice
Nova Employee Share Offer
An inclusive and supportive culture
A range of other great benefits, just ask us!
To apply, please click on the "apply now" button and submit your resume using the "upload resume" function in PDF Format (only).

Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please call Lily in Nova Talent Acquisition Team on: (08) 8252 7100
