Work for an industry leading advisory firm
Dynamic and flexible working model
Looking for several Data Scientists with varying levels of experience


The ideal candidate has strong technical skills and deep industry experience who can source data from multiple data sources, transform and integrate data to build predictive models or provide insights, for enabling better decision making, operational improvements and increased revenue.

In this role you will:
Set up data pipeline through APIs and integrate developed portals with other platforms
Design database and integrate data models with back-end frameworks such as Django, Flask, and FastAPI using Rest and graph-QL APIs
Identify, create, manage, and maintain analytically rigorous data and automating collection processes
Create data pipelines using Data factory/Azure ML or similar tools in azure
Practical experience working with azure services such as app services, storage account, Logic apps, key vault, etc.
Experience working with docker and containerized automation
Hands on DataOps practices especially be able to Deploy developed data solutions in Azure Dev Ops

You will shine in this role if you have:
BSc/BA/MS/PhD in Data Science, Information Technology or relevant field (graduate degree in Data Science or another quantitative field is preferred).
Experience developing applications with Django backend framework
Experience in Python programming and familiarity with JS is an asset.
SQL query language
Knowledge of machine-learning algorithms o Working with cloud service providers (Microsoft Azure)
Using business intelligence tools (Power BI)
Expertise in relational and No SQL database design and concepts.
Work with data engineering tools and setup pipelines in azure (data factory, azure ML)
Hands on deployment and productionizing models and experiments


If this job looks interesting to you then please don't hesitate to apply, we are looking for several Data Scientists with varying levels of experience, so even if you don't have all the listed skills it would still be worth applying. Work for an industry leading advisory firm

Job Description
DeployPartners deliver high-quality Service Assurance Solutions expertise throughout the Asia Pacific region, we specialise in sales, design, delivery, training and support of Automation and CyberSecurity solutions that meet specific business objectives and technology standards.
We are a leading Australian IT Service consulting company, with representative offices in 10 cities across the globe - www.deploypartners.com looking for an experienced OSS Consultant.
The role will be responsible for delivery on a range of projects for various customers of DeployPartners.
The Role Responsibilities
 Responsible for system installation, configuration, testing
 Estimating required project effort and duration
 Prepare and submit project/weekly reports on work executed
 Prepare and create clear, concise and professional project documentation
 Assisting in presales activities, including responding to RFP, RFQ, SOW
Provide customer support on Tivoli Suite of products and assist with Trouble Tickets logged on live and development systems when not on site.







Requirements
Experience Required

 5 years experience in Network & Telecommunications, cloud infrastructure desirable
 Foundational OSS, Dev ops, Open Shift, Agile
 Knowledge of telecommunication networks, enterprise software
 Certified in IBM Tivoli Product Suite including ITNM, ITM, SCAPM, TNPM, TCR, TIP, OMNIbus, Impact, TBSM and Smart Cloud Analytics, Splunk enterprise
 IBM Dashboard Application Service Hub (DASH)
 Experience in Cisco Prime Suite
 ITSM Solutions such as IBM Tivoli, BMC & HP
 Solid scripting experience (Shell, Perl)
 Experience with databases
 Excellent communication skills (written and oral) with a good command of English
 AGSVA Security Clearance highly regarded



Benefits
The benefits of working with DeployPartners:
 Access to the latest technology
Flexibility of onsite and remote work
CBD Offices in Sydney and Melbourne
Tailored training program
Varied clients in multiple industries
Laptop and Internet and Mobile access paid Industry

Job Description
One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.
Responsibilities
Our team is developing the gateway signal processing software for Viasat's third-generation, global satellite internet network. “Viasat-3,” our revolutionary GEO satellite, is unprecedented both in its terabit per second capacity and its flexibility in directing that capacity where it is needed in real-time. Viasat-3 Flight 1 will cover the Americas upon its launch in 2022, and Flights 2 and 3 will subsequently cover the Europe/Middle East/Africa and Asia/Pacific regions. These spacecraft require an equally innovative gateway architecture, and we are developing an ultra-high throughput GPU-based modem to that end. Our team is responsible for its design, implementation, integration, and test.
We’re looking for a Software Engineer with real-time experience and an interest in signal processing and the latest parallel computing architectures and algorithms. In this role, you will develop, optimize, and test software to perform signal processing, data/configuration management, and failover for our modems, while remaining a critical part of the launch of Viasat's broadband internet service globally.
Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related discipline
3+ Years of experience in real-time software
2+ Years of object-oriented Python or C++ development experience
Familiarity with basic signal processing concepts such as FIR filtering and correlation
Familiarity with Linux OS
Ability to support Dev Ops outside standard working hours and on weekends if needed
Australian Citizenship or Permanent Resident Required

Preferences

Master's Degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Related Discipline
Knowledge of signal processing techniques such as the FFT and Frequency domain filtering
Knowledge of Linear Algebra and Digital Communications
Knowledge of low-level networking, including raw sockets and UDP/IP protocols
Experience with data structures and efficient management of configuration data
Experience with Kubernetes cluster deployment
Experience with DPDK
Knowledge of CUDA C++ and NVIDIA GPUs
#LI-BBS
Additional Requirements and Information
Minimum Education
Bachelors Degree
Years of Experience
3-5 years
Travel
Up to 10%
Citizenship
Australian Citizenship or Australian Permanent Resident required
Clearance
None
Worker Classification

AKQA are always on the lookout for permanent, contract and freelance AEM Developers. If you would like to share your details with us for future opportunities across Australia or New Zealand, please feel free to submit your details which we will keep on file and reach out to you as soon as a suitable position becomes available.


As an Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) Developer, you'll have experience in delivering high-quality digital platforms based on the Java umbrella of technologies. You're a technically excellent programmer who possesses a deep understanding of software engineering principles as well as the latest industry trends.

Located in Melbourne as part of AKQA you'll work in an innovative and inclusive culture, surrounded by some of the brightest minds in their fields. You'll also have the opportunity to learn within a creative and technically advanced team.

ROLE REQUIREMENTS

Developing solutions on Adobe AEM and CQ platform.
Designing applications using design patterns and modern application frameworks.
Writing clean and testable object-oriented code in Java.
Working with REST Web Services and Microservice architectures.

QUALITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS

Proficient skills in Java, J2EE, JSP, Groovy, Spring boot, MVC, JUnit and related Java ecosystems.
Excellent dev-ops skills and experience, enabling you to create market-leading solutions.
Hands on working knowledge of GIT and Maven.
Comprehensive understanding of OSGi, Spring, and associated integrations.
Experience in all levels of testing including unit, integration, smoke and acceptance.
Experience in continuous integration/deployment/delivery practices, tools and process.
Understanding of modern front-end technologies and tooling integrations with both AEM and REST APIs. (JavaScript).
Understanding of Agile principles.
Experience working in cloud computing environments and familiarity with virtualised development environments.
Basic system administration knowledge (Linux/Unix).
Knowledge of code performance and optimisation.
Knowledge of swagger and RESTful API design principles desirable.
Knowledge of OWASP top 10 principles.

Oracle Goldengate Integration Architect -22000CF9

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English

Preferred Qualifications
Job Description / Title : Oracle Goldengate Integration Architect (Senior Principal Consultant)
Locations : Canberra, Melbourne
Citizenship : Security Clearances (NV1 mandatory for defence), AU Citizen mandatory
Job Description:


Provides consulting and advisory services to clients, as a specialist in data integration specializing in Oracle Database, Goldengate and Oracle ODI. The candidate should be a highly proficient software engineering professional with a good understanding of SOA patterns, Integration design and development, backed up by considerable (12+ years) customer facing implementation experience.
Key Responsibilities
Gather integration requirements; plan, coordinate and participate in workshops, solution refinement, development activities, and support the testing of integrations
Provide domain expertise in integration specifically Oracle Goldengate, with experience with Oracle and non-Oracle data sources such as SAP and Mainframe (DB2)
Provide technical leadership to a team of up to 8 resources
Exhibit confidence and ease when interacting with technical management, middle and senior-level managers (client and internal); ability to use indirect influence to build consensus and support for ideas
Demonstrate professional communication skills including presenting in front of clients, client workshops and regional events; development of proposal content, articulation of methodology, and formal written deliverables
Develop and maintain an up to date knowledge of relevant Oracle products and services
Network and Collaborate by sharing knowledge and best practices within the team and cross lines of business

Core competencies, knowledge and experience
Minimum of 12 years relevant experience in Oracle Integration Solutions, e.g. Oracle Goldengate and ODI, and various RDBMS systems including Oracle.
Must have delivered multiple tier-1, full life cycle implementations across multiple domains including security
Must be capable of designing integrated solutions and architectures in heterogeneous environments
Must be proficient with application/internet gateways, SQL, encryption standards.
Must be capable of leading Interactions with clients’ technical resources and management, ability to plan for and facilitate workshops, influence key decision makers, act independently to develop best-practice, innovative solutions.
Understanding of Agile methodology and general SDLC, as well as DevOps and CI/CD concepts and tools.
Expertise in quick evaluation of product fitment for given requirements, define future roadmap for cloud transformation programs, identify risks and define mitigations.
Exposure to SAML/OAUTH/JWT
Oracle Certification, Agile Scrum certification or TOGAF
Working knowledge of Dev Ops including continuous build / deployment

Mandatory Skills
Oracle Goldengate (Experience using Goldengate in a Mainframe context)
Oracle and non-Oracle RDBMS
Web services, REST/SOAP Services, XML, XSLT, WSDL, APIs
Oracle PaaS Integration Platforms (SOACS, AOIC, OIC, DIPC, ICS, PCS, ODICS, JCS, VBCS)
Demonstrated ability to convey a strong presence, maintain a professional image, and deal confidently with complex business problems in complex business environments

Preferential Skills
Experience with Master Data Management (MDM)
Knowledge/Experience within another domain, e.g. Security, Analytics

Job Description / Title : Oracle Goldengate Integration Architect (Senior Principal Consultant)

Job Description:


Provides consulting and advisory services to clients, as a specialist in data integration specializing in Oracle Database, Goldengate and Oracle ODI. The candidate should be a highly proficient software engineering professional with a good understanding of SOA patterns, Integration design and development, backed up by considerable (12+ years) customer facing implementation experience.
Key Responsibilities
Gather integration requirements; plan, coordinate and participate in workshops, solution refinement, development activities, and support the testing of integrations
Provide domain expertise in integration specifically Oracle Goldengate, with experience with Oracle and non-Oracle data sources such as SAP and Mainframe (DB2)
Provide technical leadership to a team of up to 8 resources
Exhibit confidence and ease when interacting with technical management, middle and senior-level managers (client and internal); ability to use indirect influence to build consensus and support for ideas
Demonstrate professional communication skills including presenting in front of clients, client workshops and regional events; development of proposal content, articulation of methodology, and formal written deliverables
Develop and maintain an up to date knowledge of relevant Oracle products and services
Network and Collaborate by sharing knowledge and best practices within the team and cross lines of business

Core competencies, knowledge and experience
Minimum of 12 years relevant experience in Oracle Integration Solutions, e.g. Oracle Goldengate and ODI, and various RDBMS systems including Oracle.
Must have delivered multiple tier-1, full life cycle implementations across multiple domains including security
Must be capable of designing integrated solutions and architectures in heterogeneous environments
Must be proficient with application/internet gateways, SQL, encryption standards.
Must be capable of leading Interactions with clients’ technical resources and management, ability to plan for and facilitate workshops, influence key decision makers, act independently to develop best-practice, innovative solutions.
Understanding of Agile methodology and general SDLC, as well as DevOps and CI/CD concepts and tools.
Expertise in quick evaluation of product fitment for given requirements, define future roadmap for cloud transformation programs, identify risks and define mitigations.
Exposure to SAML/OAUTH/JWT
Oracle Certification, Agile Scrum certification or TOGAF
Working knowledge of Dev Ops including continuous build / deployment

Oracle Goldengate (Experience using Goldengate in a Mainframe context)
Oracle and non-Oracle RDBMS
Web services, REST/SOAP Services, XML, XSLT, WSDL, APIs
Oracle PaaS Integration Platforms (SOACS, AOIC, OIC, DIPC, ICS, PCS, ODICS, JCS, VBCS)
Demonstrated ability to convey a strong presence, maintain a professional image, and deal confidently with complex business problems in complex business environments

Experience with Master Data Management (MDM)
Knowledge/Experience within another domain, e.g. Security, Analytics

About the company:
PERSOLKELLY brings together the legacy and experience of four organizations that shaped the staffing landscape over the past century: Kelly Services, who pioneered the modern temporary help industry in 1946; SKILLED, who crafted the staffing industry in Australia in 1964; Programmed, the leading provider of operations and maintenance services across Australia and New Zealand; and PERSOLKELLY, the largest workforce solutions provider in APAC.

About the company:

PERSOLKELLY brings together the legacy and experience of four organizations that shaped the staffing landscape over the past century: Kelly Services, who pioneered the modern temporary help industry in 1946; SKILLED, who crafted the staffing industry in Australia in 1964; Programmed, the leading provider of operations and maintenance services across Australia and New Zealand; and PERSOLKELLY, the largest workforce solutions provider in APAC.

About our Client:

Our Client is a multinational professional services company mainly involved in the operations management and analytics. They offer insurance, banking, financial services, utilities, healthcare, travel, transportation and logistics services.

Primary purpose of the role:

This role requires providing technical expertise, strong thought leadership and guidance across both application development and support of the Australian Business Division (ABD) Digital team activities; to influence/introduce/refine processes and practices within the team and across teams, with the view to deliver rapid yet reliable solutions; to embrace DevOps ways of working; to deliver digital solutions for the Business Division to agreed time and quality standards.

The provision of strong technical expertise and leadership by building and sharing in-depth technical and business knowledge
Analysing, designing, and coding the solution and providing support for solutions and other applications and being accountable for the same
The provision of robust design solutions that are of exceptional performance and quality
To help define lean processes, practices and standards and ensuring design solutions adhere to these through reviews
Managing expectations of stakeholders
Assist in building the capability of the team through facilitating training, close collaboration and knowledge sharing with colleagues (Must)
Ensure that customer delivery, customer focus, regular open communication, engagement, and satisfaction is made a clear priority (Must)

We would love to talk to you if you have:

Insurance industry experience strongly preferred
Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science or related IT discipline
10 years development experience preferred with minimum 5 years. (3+ years building enterprise applications with Java 8+)
Experience in helping build team capability, establishing & influencing processes/practices and working well in a team
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Highly developed analytical and problem-solving skills
Continuous improvement mindset
Experience working in agile, lean, Dev Ops & cross functional teams
Expertise in use of JIRA and Confluence
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Preferred Technical Skills:

Must have Java 8+, Spring boot, XML-XSLT
Highly regarded - Liquibase, Drools, Scala
Must have extensive server-side development experience using Microservices, REST/JSON, SOAP, message queues and relational databases
Some front-end development experience using spring mvc, templates and jquery preferred
Source control - Git preferred
Testing tools - Junit, Mockito, Jassert
Continuous delivery using Jenkins, Docker and Rancher
Linux distro-based development using Intellij preferred

Note : The non-negotiable skill is the Jave8+, Spring boot, XML-XSLT

How to Apply:

This role offers you an exciting opportunity to join a diverse team within a highly successful organization. If you are ready for a change and wish to be part of a fast-paced team where you can make a difference, then we would be interested to hear from you.

If you are interested, please click 'APPLY' or contact Prasanth Natesan, Recruitment Consultant on Prasanth.Natesan@persolkelly.com.au for a confidential discussion.

We propel our people forward by supporting their careers in fresh ways, backed by our expertise and capability.

We're committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment which values and respects diverse styles, backgrounds, experience and perspectives.

We welcome and encourage women, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent and people from diverse backgrounds to apply.

Date: 28-Jul-2022

Location:
Melbourne, VIC, AU Brisbane, QLD, AU Sydney, NSW, AU

Department: Consulting

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 30177

.NET/Sitecore Tech Lead

At Deloitte Digital, we are all responsible for challenging the status quo, and bringing innovative and differentiated thinking to everything we do. Deloitte Digital is an innovative leader in online and mobile strategy, design and development. We work with a wide range of clients helping them adapt to and harness new media and technology. Our combination of strategic thinking and innovative solutions is what sets us apart, and we make sure to stay at the forefront of new technology.

About the role

Our Digital Managed Services team is responsible for the ongoing support and development of client production systems. We work alongside our build teams from initial solution design through to operations support and continuous improvement. This end-to-end involvement allows us to shape the solutions we operate. Our high-performing team is comprised of highly experienced technical specialists, front-end and back-end developers, DevOps engineers, and delivery managers.

Our Melbourne team is growing and we’re on the look-out for an experienced Sitecore Lead to join us. You will have leading technical competency in the Microsoft.NET and Sitecore space as well experience leading software engineers to deliver and support enterprise digital platforms.

With a background in software development and support with a passion for technology, the focus of this role is on maintenance and delivery of high quality well engineered solutions, working with our team and clients to deliver outcomes to address complex challenges and environments. You will also be a leader within the Sitecore and .NET capability team mentoring junior and senior developers in efficiently delivering high-quality software engineering outcomes and provide thought leadership to keep our team at the forefront of the latest software engineering practices.

As a Senior .NET / Sitecore Technical Lead you will be the primary technical leader on large enterprise Sitecore and .NET support and maintenance projects. You will work with both technical and non-technical client stakeholders to understand, design, implement and maintain solutions.

Along with the experience and energy you bring to the team, you’ll be responsible for:

Advising and consulting with client on how to best meet requirements with Sitecore and .NET solution technology
Advising clients on best practice software engineering, code quality and dev ops practices
Solving complex issue for Sitecore based implementations
Delivering and maintaining large scale and complex digital implementations across different client industries, development teams and technologies.
Managing and mentoring teams of developers and full stack technologists
Supporting service delivery managers to develop and manage release plans, scope, variations, and technical risks
Contributing your knowledge and experience to continuously improve the processes and practices used do deliver software across the Deloitte Digital technology team.
Contribute to business development through providing solution options and development estimates

About your experience

To be considered for this position, you will have deep and broad Digital experience and a proven track record of delivering and maintaining digital projects, including:

Minimum 8 years’ experience across software engineering disciplines and Microsoft.NET technologies
Minimum 2 years’ experience of managing technical teams in delivering solutions using waterfall and agile methodologies
Experience delivering solutions on cloud platforms – preferably Microsoft Azure.
Experience working with continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines.
Experience working with Sitecore and/or other similar WCMS or Digital Experience platforms
Proven success in technology leadership across a range of enterprise digital technologies and projects including Web Content Management, Web Applications and Portals, APIs and System integration
Understand and demonstrate experience with leading dev ops practices, including tools and techniques for continuous integration / delivery
A desire to contribute to the broader success of the technical team by playing a mentoring and coaching role to other team members
Understanding of ITIL service delivery lifecycle

Desirable experience (will be considered an advantage):
Experience with test automation and code scanning tools highly regarded.
Experience with Docker/Kubernetes highly regarded.
Experience working with monitoring tools like Dynatrace/New Relic/Splunk/Sumo Logic
Experience working in a multi-client engagement.

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space. Date: 28-Jul-2022

Melbourne, VIC, AU Brisbane, QLD, AU Sydney, NSW, AU

Our Digital Managed Services team is responsible for the ongoing support and development of client production systems. We work alongside our build teams from initial solution design through to operations support and continuous improvement. This end-to-end involvement allows us to shape the solutions we operate. Our high-performing team is comprised of highly experienced technical specialists, front-end and back-end developers, DevOps engineers, and delivery managers.

Our Melbourne team is growing and we’re on the look-out for an experienced Sitecore Lead to join us. You will have leading technical competency in the Microsoft.NET and Sitecore space as well experience leading software engineers to deliver and support enterprise digital platforms.

With a background in software development and support with a passion for technology, the focus of this role is on maintenance and delivery of high quality well engineered solutions, working with our team and clients to deliver outcomes to address complex challenges and environments. You will also be a leader within the Sitecore and .NET capability team mentoring junior and senior developers in efficiently delivering high-quality software engineering outcomes and provide thought leadership to keep our team at the forefront of the latest software engineering practices.

As a Senior .NET / Sitecore Technical Lead you will be the primary technical leader on large enterprise Sitecore and .NET support and maintenance projects. You will work with both technical and non-technical client stakeholders to understand, design, implement and maintain solutions.

Along with the experience and energy you bring to the team, you’ll be responsible for:

Advising and consulting with client on how to best meet requirements with Sitecore and .NET solution technology
Advising clients on best practice software engineering, code quality and dev ops practices
Solving complex issue for Sitecore based implementations
Delivering and maintaining large scale and complex digital implementations across different client industries, development teams and technologies.
Managing and mentoring teams of developers and full stack technologists
Supporting service delivery managers to develop and manage release plans, scope, variations, and technical risks
Contributing your knowledge and experience to continuously improve the processes and practices used do deliver software across the Deloitte Digital technology team.
Contribute to business development through providing solution options and development estimates

About your experience

To be considered for this position, you will have deep and broad Digital experience and a proven track record of delivering and maintaining digital projects, including:

Minimum 8 years’ experience across software engineering disciplines and Microsoft.NET technologies
Minimum 2 years’ experience of managing technical teams in delivering solutions using waterfall and agile methodologies
Experience delivering solutions on cloud platforms – preferably Microsoft Azure.
Experience working with continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines.
Experience working with Sitecore and/or other similar WCMS or Digital Experience platforms
Proven success in technology leadership across a range of enterprise digital technologies and projects including Web Content Management, Web Applications and Portals, APIs and System integration
Understand and demonstrate experience with leading dev ops practices, including tools and techniques for continuous integration / delivery
A desire to contribute to the broader success of the technical team by playing a mentoring and coaching role to other team members
Understanding of ITIL service delivery lifecycle

Desirable experience (will be considered an advantage):
Experience with test automation and code scanning tools highly regarded.
Experience with Docker/Kubernetes highly regarded.
Experience working with monitoring tools like Dynatrace/New Relic/Splunk/Sumo Logic
Experience working in a multi-client engagement.

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space. Show more

Manager Application Support and Operations

ATCO's Australian operations are headquartered in Perth, Western Australia and specialise in creating innovative, customer-focused energy and infrastructure solutions.

ATCO owns and operates Western Australia's largest gas distribution network with more than 750,000 connection points and 14,000km of pipelines. ATCO also operates two progressive power generation stations - in Adelaide and the Pilbara.

At ATCO, we understand the long-term benefits of innovative, green solutions. Backed by a strong 75-year history in the delivery of power solutions, our capabilities include designing, building, owning and operating the full range of power generation facilities including renewables, hydrogen and pumped hydro. We have been investing in alternative and renewable energy solutions for 30 years and continue to respond to disruption in the energy sector by investing in our people, our communities and in innovative technologies.

The Manager Application Support and Operations will manage the day to day operations of business applications and technology. You will be responsible for maintaining high internal stakeholder satisfaction, ensuring service providers meet contractual obligations and SLA’s.

Qualifications and Experience:

Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Information Systems or similar
Service Delivery Management qualifications and/or experience particularly for applications and cloud services.
ITIL qualifications in service management

You will have experience in:

Managing major application outsourcing and other service contracts
Managing major incidents within a complex, multi-vendor, multicloud application environment
Creating and executing continuous improvement plans
Implementing and managing an IT Asset Management system (CMDB, software and hardware)
IT Change Management processes
Service Level Management processes
Negotiating vendor contracts
Preparing and presenting reports to Senior Executives
Strong financial management skills in budgeting, forecasting, and cost control.
Demonstrated critical thinking, planning and management skills at a strategic level.
High level technical knowledge and experience in application and digital systems
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
Ability to influence senior stakeholders, undertake complex negotiations and build strategic relationships.
Experience in digital transformation programs and Dev Ops is desirable but not essential

Benefits:

Access to additional purchased leave
Novated Lease and Car Benefits
Employee Share Purchase Plan
Access to a range of corporate discounts, including health insurance, banking and fitness clubs.
Become a member of Energy West Social Club
Access to ATCO's Employee Assistance Program

ATCO fosters an inclusive workplace culture where everyone is treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and women.

Applications close COB Friday 19th August. However, the company reserves the right to close the advertising at an earlier date. Manager Application Support and Operations

Working at Atlassian
Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.
To help our teams work together effectively, this role requires you to be located in the AUS/NZ timezones.
With a sufficient timezone overlap with the team, we're able to hire eligible candidates for this role from any location in Australia and New Zealand. If this sparks your interest, apply today and chat with our friendly Recruitment team.
Your future team
Our Jira Foundation team is comprised of people with backgrounds in SaaS, Microservices, DevOps and Jira. We unlock developer productivity to (scale and build Jira Cloud).We are here to be the highway that will allow developers to deliver their changes to Jira end users by providing the platform and tools to achieve that goal.
We're hiring a Product Manager, reporting to Group Product Manager. You are a Product Manager with a background in building SaaS products, DevOps, APIs and Microservices. Here, you'll be responsible for Jira dev journey from E2E by working with teams focused on each stage of the software delivery lifecycle.
What you'll do
Partner with leadership, Engineering, Program Managers, and Product Managers to align on the solution you'd propose and contribute to key company goal (with visibility to the CEO's team of executives including CPO, COO and CTO).
Set goals that are in alignment with organisational commitment on Developer productivity and drive teams across Jira family towards them with clearly expressed success criteria, metrics and OKRs.
Be responsible for Jira dev journey from E2E by working with teams focused on each stage of the software delivery lifecycle
Develop insights from user feedback to target the best improvements to dev velocity
Communicate actively with stakeholders and leadership. Address CXO level execs when required with support from your hiring manager.
Your background
Proven experience in Product Management managing a SaaS product.Ability to deeply diagnose am ambiguous problem area and lead the teams to clarity rallying them behind a strong vision and clearly crafted goals.
Past knowledge and experience of DevOps and DevOps products (no specific preference of tools here)
Good knowledge of REST APIs and Microservices.
Experience creating and implementing a dev-productivity strategy for a fast-growing product.
Knowledge of industry best practices around dev-ops like Dora https://www.devops-research.com/research.html
Ability to paint a compelling vision to inspire cross-functional teams and senior leaders
Our perks & benefits
To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more.
About Atlassian
The world’s best teams work better together with Atlassian. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team.
We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Senior Business Analyst
Job Title: Senior Business Analyst

Contract Type: Contract

Salary: AU$850 - AU$940 per day

Reference: 6781

Contact Name: Jonathan Salvatore

Contact Email: jonathans@eitr.com.au

Job Description
Large NSW Government Department is seeking an experienced Technical Business Analyst to join the team for an initial 12 month contract. You will work on Asset Maintenance Planning Projects. Projects tend to be mostly in the infrastructure space, with a requirement for understanding applications and how they integrate and are developed.

Required Skills and Experience:
Technical Business Analyst in Infrastructure or Integration Projects (min. of 5 years)Business Analyst in Application Development & Business Process Re-engineering Projects (min. of 5 yrs)Experience in managing small projects, under the direction of a senior project manager or program manager.Experience working (influencing & negotiating) with a diverse set of stakeholders (of varying seniority) including: development teams, Dev Ops teams, testing teams, infrastructure teams, service partners and business representativesExperienced in both Agile and Waterfall methodologies (e.g. Business analysis plan, business requirements, functional requirements, requirements traceability matrix; Agile ceremonies, disciplines and procedures)IT Process Re-engineering Experience - "As Is" and "To Be"; assess and redesign to eliminate inefficiencies and/or improve controls and/or improve efficiency/effectivenessAble to deal with and manage conflict with different stakeholders, escalating to the project manager where appropriate.Experience working in a team of business analysts, specifically sharing knowledge and work to improve efficiency and avoid duplicationExperience in leading more Junior BA's and or other analysts within the teamExperience in collecting, collating and analysing data from diverse sourcesAdvanced Excel skills
You must be either an Australian Citizen or Australian Permanent Resident to be considered for this role.


Please send your CV in WORD format only.
Apply now

PMO consultancy, which works closely with a number of private and government clients, has a newly created role for a Test Analyst opened. This role has come about due to new initiatives from their client base over the next few years.


The Testing Analysts will primarily conduct tests for all configuration changes for the platform’s solutions. The Testing analyst will design, develop, and administer a series of tests and evaluations that identify any potential issues with platform configuration before its general release to their client base.


Some duties many include:

Analysing users stories and/use cases/requirements for validity and feasibility
Collaborate closely with Development Teams, Solutions Architect and Client Teams
Design, develop and execute all levels of testing of all configurations changes in Development and SIT Environments
Design and develop test automation where possible
Detect, raise and track software defects and inconsistencies to closure
Provide timely solutions for any defects identified
Provide Testing support and documentation in Azure Dev Ops
Design, develop and review appropriate metrics needed to evaluate test performance and platform quality by developing relevant dashboards and reports. Actively drive consulting firm in increasing the Testing Maturity


Ideally you will have some of the following:

Tertiary Qualifications in IT is preferred.
You must be an Australian citizen and will possess or be willing to go through the process to obtain and maintain a (Baseline, NV1) personnel security clearance.
At least 2-4 years’ experience in testing position
Able to research and write up a project related brief
Automated testing (desirable)
Azure DevOps, JIRA or similar tools
Strong attention to detail.
Ability to see the big picture.
Planning and organizational skills.
Proficiency in document and report writing.
Ability to work in a team.
Awareness of Software Development Life Cycle.
Logical and critical thinking skills.
Proficiency with Agile Development software.


If you’d like to hear more, please apply for a confidential chat. ROLE HIGHLIGHTS
Customer-facing applications with over 1 Million subscribers
Full time permanent role - WFH anywhere in Australia or work hybrid from the Sydney office
Strong team – Super passionate about modern React and Node with TypeScript
THE COMPANY

As a tech company working on greenfield products, we are in the process of disrupting & innovating with products across Australia and the USA, we now have a paying customer base of over a million.


Our web team appreciates quality & a functional programming approach. We have a strong senior capability so we have a great opportunity to bring 2 or 3 capable mid to senior level engineers with some commercial experience backed up by a computer science/software engineering degree (or equivalent experience).

Alongside building new products our teams focus is on scalability, security and performance optimisation so our app can handle over 1million concurrent users. We leverage AWS to help us scale.
We’re proud of our craft and passionate about the work that we do. We build together and we collaborate to build a sustainable workplace as well as products. We love the web – our team is vibrant with a “can-do” attitude: we all love to learn.

THE ROLE

As a Mid to Senior Front-End Engineer, you will be part of either the video, CTV, or web apps team. Your work will include integration into various web platforms, and including unit testing and peer reviews. A need to articulate your opinion and passion for code quality, processes and engineering is a must, and an interest in online streaming is highly regarded.


Using React & BaconJS, and moving to RxJS and TypeScipt, and soon to introduce a monorepo solution. MobX and Docker used on an AWS infrastructure with some NodeJS services, you will be building visually pleasing, functional and performant UIs. We collaborate and you'll gain a strong understanding of our architecture and development standards.


This will be a fast-paced role, with room to ask questions and make mistakes. You’ll be working with a great team of 9 primarily senior developers, with future opportunity for leadership.
Essential
Strong fundamental Front End: JavaScript/Typescript, CSS & HTML
Minimum 4 years React experience building consumer facing application
Experience with quality practices (i.e. unit testing)
Desirable
Dev Ops
NodeJS, Docker & some experience with writing backend
Knowledge of accessibility best practice, SEO, and performance

CULTURE AND BENEFITS
Remuneration ranges from $150k - $175k + Super
We work hard for great rewards – which we understand comes from a sustainable work environment. That can look different for everyone, which is why we believe in offering flexible hours partnered with a social and collaborative environment (currently a mix of hybrid and remote).
Democracy is key – we’re in this together, and everyone’s voice is important. Your input is always valued regardless of your seniority.


Contact Annie Anderson for more information – 0480 274 497.

Melbourne, Australia
 Tech Hiring
 2896386
Job Description
Role Purpose
The purpose of the role is to create exceptional and detailedarchitectural application design and provide thought leadership andenable delivery teams to provide exceptional client engagement andsatisfaction.
Do
Develop architectural application for the new deals/ majorchange requests in existing deals
Creates an enterprise-wide architecture that ensures systems arescalable, reliable, and manageable.
Manages application assets and directs the development effortswithin an enterprise to improve solution delivery and agility
Guides how to construct and assemble application components andservices to support solution architecture and application development
Maintains the frameworks and artefacts used in theimplementation of an application, with reference to the systematicarchitecture of the overall application portfolio
Responsible for application architecture paradigms such asservice-oriented architecture (SOA) and, more specifically,microservices, ensuring business achieve agility and scalability for afaster time to market
Provide solution of RFP’s received from clients and ensureoverall design assurance
Develop a direction to manage the portfolio of to-be-solutionsincluding systems, shared infrastructure services, applications in orderto better match business outcome objectives
Analyse technology environment, enterprise specifics, clientrequirements to set a collaboration design framework/ architecture
Depending on the client’s need with particular standards andtechnology stacks create complete RFPs
Provide technical leadership to the design, development andimplementation of custom solutions through thoughtful use of moderntechnology
Define and understand current state solutions and identifyimprovements, options & tradeoffs to define target state solutions
Clearly articulate and sell architectural targets, recommendationsand reusable patterns and accordingly propose investment roadmaps
Evaluate and recommend solutions to integrate with overalltechnology ecosystem
Tracks industry and application trends and relates these to planningcurrent and future IT needs
Provides technical and strategic inputs during the projectplanning phase in the form of technical architectural designs andrecommendations
Account mining to find opportunities in the existing clients
Collaborates with all relevant parties in order to review theobjectives and constraints of solutions and determine conformance withthe Enterprise Architecture.
Identifies implementation risks and potential impacts.
Create new revenue streams within applications as APIs that canbe leveraged by clients
Bring knowledge of automation in application by embracing Agileand dev-ops principles to reduce manual part
Understanding application requirements and design astandardize application
Creating Intellectual Property in forms of services, patterns,models and organizational approaches
Designing patterns, best practices and reusable applicationsthat can be used for future references
Ensure system capabilities are consumed by system components andset criteria for evaluating technical and business value in terms ofTolerate, Invest, Migrate and Eliminate
Provide platform to create standardize tools, uniform design andtechniques are maintained to reduce costs of maintenance

Display
Lists the competencies required to perform this role effectively:
Functional Competencies/ Skill
Domain/Industry Knowledge – Awareness and knowledge of broadeconomic, demographic, technological and global trends within ownecosystem – Master
Market Intelligence – Deep specialized understanding of theecosystem practice, overall market & competition and nuances ofdelivery in that domain – Master
Systems Thinking – Understanding of the Wipro system(interrelatedness, interdependencies and boundaries) and perform problemsolving in a complex environment - Expert
Leveraging Technology – In-depth knowledge of and mastery overecosystem technology that commands expert authority respect –Master
Asset reusability – ability to re-use the assets to ensurescalability and optimization - Expert
Technical knowledge – architecture design principles,framework and documentation - Master
Competency Levels
Foundation
Knowledgeable about the competency requirements. Demonstrates (inparts) frequently with minimal support and guidance.
Competent
Consistently demonstrates the full range of the competency withoutguidance. Extends the competency to difficult and unknown situations aswell.
Expert
Applies the competency in all situations and is serves as a guide toothers as well.
Master
Coaches others and builds organizational capability in the competencyarea. Serves as a key resource for that competency and is recognisedwithin the entire organization.

Performance Parameter
Measure
1.
Support sales team to create wins
% of proposals with Quality Index >7, timely support of theproposals, identifying opportunities/ leads to sell services within/outside account (lead generation), no. of proposals led
2.
Delivery support
CSAT, delivery as per cost, quality and timelines, Identify anddevelop resuable components, utilization %, Recommend tools for reuse,automation for improved productivity and reduced cycle times, # ofreusable components
3.
Capability development
% trainings and certifications completed, increase in ACEcertifications, thought leadership content developed (white papers,Wipro PoVs)
4.
Practice Building
Identifying opportunities for architects in the account and outsidethrough known contacts, Contribute towards domain and technologyaccelerator kits, Mentoring junior architects
5.
Team Management
Team attrition %, Employee satisfaction score 
Role Purpose
The purpose of the role is to create exceptional and detailedarchitectural application design and provide thought leadership andenable delivery teams to provide exceptional client engagement andsatisfaction.
Do
Develop architectural application for the new deals/ majorchange requests in existing deals
Creates an enterprise-wide architecture that ensures systems arescalable, reliable, and manageable.
Manages application assets and directs the development effortswithin an enterprise to improve solution delivery and agility
Guides how to construct and assemble application components andservices to support solution architecture and application development
Maintains the frameworks and artefacts used in theimplementation of an application, with reference to the systematicarchitecture of the overall application portfolio
Responsible for application architecture paradigms such asservice-oriented architecture (SOA) and, more specifically,microservices, ensuring business achieve agility and scalability for afaster time to market
Provide solution of RFP’s received from clients and ensureoverall design assurance
Develop a direction to manage the portfolio of to-be-solutionsincluding systems, shared infrastructure services, applications in orderto better match business outcome objectives
Analyse technology environment, enterprise specifics, clientrequirements to set a collaboration design framework/ architecture
Depending on the client’s need with particular standards andtechnology stacks create complete RFPs
Provide technical leadership to the design, development andimplementation of custom solutions through thoughtful use of moderntechnology
Define and understand current state solutions and identifyimprovements, options & tradeoffs to define target state solutions
Clearly articulate and sell architectural targets, recommendationsand reusable patterns and accordingly propose investment roadmaps
Evaluate and recommend solutions to integrate with overalltechnology ecosystem
Tracks industry and application trends and relates these to planningcurrent and future IT needs
Provides technical and strategic inputs during the projectplanning phase in the form of technical architectural designs andrecommendations
Account mining to find opportunities in the existing clients
Collaborates with all relevant parties in order to review theobjectives and constraints of solutions and determine conformance withthe Enterprise Architecture.
Identifies implementation risks and potential impacts.
Create new revenue streams within applications as APIs that canbe leveraged by clients
Bring knowledge of automation in application by embracing Agileand dev-ops principles to reduce manual part
Understanding application requirements and design astandardize application
Creating Intellectual Property in forms of services, patterns,models and organizational approaches
Designing patterns, best practices and reusable applicationsthat can be used for future references
Ensure system capabilities are consumed by system components andset criteria for evaluating technical and business value in terms ofTolerate, Invest, Migrate and Eliminate
Provide platform to create standardize tools, uniform design andtechniques are maintained to reduce costs of maintenance
Coordinating input on risks, costs and opportunities forconcepts
Developing customised applications for the customers alignedwith their needs
Perform design and code reviews thoroughly on regular basis,keeping in mind the security measures
Understanding design and production procedures and standards tocreate prototypes and finished products
Work closely with systems analysts, software developers, datamanagers and other team members to ensure successful production ofapplication software
Offer viable solutions for various systems and architectures todifferent types of businesses
Seamless integration of new and existing systems to eliminatepotential problems and maintain data structure and bring value in termsof development
Transforming all applications into digital form and implementand evolve around mesh app and service architecture that support newtechnologies like IOT, blockchain, machine learning, automation, BOTSetc

Develops and establishes relevant technical, business processand overall support metrics (KPI/SLA) to drive results
Bring value in terms of quality in development activities byleveraging cloud based and scalable infrastructure
Manages multiple projects and accurately reports the status ofall major assignments while adhering to all project management standards

Ensure quality assurance of all the architecture or designdecisions and provides technical mitigation support to the deliveryteams
Recommend tools for reuse, automation for improved productivityand reduced cycle times

Develops trust and builds effective working relationshipsthrough respectful, collaborative engagement across individual productteams

Ensure optimal Client Engagement
Support pre-sales team while presenting the entire solution designand its principles to the client
Negotiate, manage and coordinate with the client teams to ensure allrequirements are met and create an impact of solution proposed

Competency Building and Branding
Ensure completion of necessary trainings and certifications
Develop Proof of Concepts (POCs), case studies, demos etc. fornew growth areas based on market and customer research

Competency Levels
Foundation
Knowledgeable about the competency requirements. Demonstrates (inparts) frequently with minimal support and guidance.
Competent
Consistently demonstrates the full range of the competency withoutguidance. Extends the competency to difficult and unknown situations aswell.
Expert
Applies the competency in all situations and is serves as a guide toothers as well.
Master
Coaches others and builds organizational capability in the competencyarea. Serves as a key resource for that competency and is recognisedwithin the entire organization.

DXC Technology (NYSE:DXC) - where brilliant people embrace change and seize opportunities to advance their careers and amplify customer success. People are the heart of our business. We support each other and work as a team, globally and locally to deliver excellence for our customers and colleagues. We use the power of technology to deliver mission critical IT services that move the world. DXC.com
Analytics is growth area and is well placed to deliver increased capability and an expanded offering to address the critical data, AI and IOT challenges inherent in solving complex customer business problems.
We currently have an opening for a Data Engineer to join the team in Melbourne.
The skills and experience you will bring:
4 – 8 years’ experience in a Data role
Data Engineering with ADF/DataBricks, ADLS Gen 2, Azure DW or Synapse, Azure Analysis Services
Data Ingestion with various file formats (parquet, Avro, etc)
Experience in Designing & Developing ingestion framework
Data warehousing - Data Modelling, Requirements Gathering, SQL, ETL/ELT development in Microsoft Azure SQL DW
Agile/Dev Ops - Jira, Confluence, Agile ceremonies
Source Control - Git etc
Job Scheduling - Control-M
Domain – Telecom domain experience highly regarded
Python/Scala/Spark (This will be beneficial)
Excellent communication skills
Prior experience working collaboratively
Agile/Scrum methodology experience
Passion for being a trusted advisor to customers as a Consultant
Our culture and benefits - DXC is committed to building better futures for our customers, colleagues, environment, and communities. We take care of each other and foster a culture of inclusion, belonging and corporate citizenship. We put this to action developing and implementing societal initiatives within our Social Impact Practice . #WeAreDXC
As an employer of choice, our “people first” philosophy means we offer competitive remuneration, benefits, training and career opportunities that reflect our commitment to improving the lives of our employees, and the communities in which we live and work.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
DXC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we welcome submissions from people from all walks of life. We celebrate our diversity and recognise it is the unique contributions of our people that give us our edge. We stand by the ‘bring your whole-self to work’ philosophy. It is our inclusive culture that powers our results, and our company grows only if our people grow. Job Description:
As a Senior Cloud Engineer at Pluralsight, you will join a highly engaged team to design, optimise, and support our core cloud infrastructure. You will directly partner with our DevOps teams to increase the stability, reliability, and usability of our infrastructure while building a product that crafts the innovators of tomorrow through technical education. You, as a member of our Cloud-Engineering team, will work in a key position, and your efforts will have a direct and meaningful impact on our product and learners world-wide. If this sounds like you, please read on and apply below!
What you’ll own
As a Cloud Engineer with a knack for troubleshooting and problem solving, you will be responsible for monitoring our environments, servers, and applications for health, performance, and security. You will collaborate with our hardworking teams of Software and DevOps Engineers, as well as Security and IT to decide how to best build meaningful outcomes for our end users and engineer solutions that move us along our journey towards highly scalable, reliable infrastructure services.
Be responsible for the availability, latency, performance, efficiency, change management, monitoring, emergency response, and capacity planning
Work in tandem with out DevOps & development teams to identify and implement the most optimal cloud-based solutions
Manage infrastructure and cloud environments in accordance with security and compliance guidelines
Automate infrastructure services through scripting or infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform)
Develop a flexible infrastructure to promote Developer self-service, while promoting continuity across our overall environment
Ensure redundancy and resilience of infrastructure and services while fostering continual performance improvement
Design, implement, maintain, secure, and scale core shared infrastructure, environments, and servers
Maintaining a pulse on new technologies and discovering hidden opportunities in our environment
Use technical expertise and experience to evaluate industry technologies and assess relevance
Experience you’ll need
A successful candidate will be well experienced in key areas such as Cloud Ops (AWS), Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation), and Systems/Network engineering.
Strong systems administration skills, especially with Linux Operating Systems
Understanding of how to configure, deploy, run, and maintain large cloud-hosted systems, including auto-scaling, monitoring, performance tuning, troubleshooting, and disaster recovery
Proven experience in setting up and configuring AWS services (EC2, RDS, ECS, VPC, Route53, ELB, ALB, Lambda, Elasticache, CloudFront, Service Catalog, CloudWatch, CloudFormation, etc)
Solid understanding of network security and performance
Knowledge of compliance frameworks (PCI, SOX, SOC 2, ISO 27001)
Strong scripting proficiency
Database administration experience would be a plus
Hands on experience with Kubernetes would be a plus
Solid understanding and adoption of Dev/Ops mentality and tools
Experience with designing and supporting infrastructure via Infrastructure-as-Code in AWS, via CDK, CloudFormation or Terraform
At Pluralsight, we believe you should live your best life in and out of the office!
Benefits include:
Generous remuneration package including competitive base salary, bonus structure and superannuation (of course!)
Unlimited Annual Leave. Take the time out that you need, when you need it
Market leading Health Insurance. Health comes first. We offer Comprehensive BUPA Gold level hospital insurance, and Top Extras for you and your family!
Income protection, Life and TPD insurance for peace of mind.
Wellness reimbursements. Receive payment up to $130 (AUD) per month for fitness and wellness activities
Tuition reimbursement. Learn something new and let us help you with the bill
A little more about the team...
Using the latest tech, we design the tools to teach people cloud faster and better. The team is dedicated (and a little quirky), and we’re all in it together. The team enables product teams which use cloud-first Serverless Architecture with tools like Lambda, API Gateway, GraphQL and ReactJS. The Cloud Engineering team focuses on teaching other engineers how to work within a cloud native environment. We’re friendly, no-nonsense, and collaborative. There are no heroes, just great teams.
Bring yourself. Pluralsight is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status. ABOUT BELONG
Belong’s mission is to deliver inspired, effortless, human connection.
To support our rapid growth, improve our speed to market, deliver data-driven, secure, automated and customer centric digital experiences we are renewing all our platforms from the ground up. We’ve set up cross-functional agile teams covering our all our systems.
ABOUT THE ROLE
As a Senior Data Engineer, your purpose is to bring a lean, agile approach to the data domain, help us to bring to life Belong’s mission – to deliver inspired, effortless human connection by helping to ensure data is at the heart of every decision that is made.
You will be responsible for building world class Data platforms in AWS environments, leveraging all available services and mentoring other engineers on best practice Data implementations to generate business value.
Your key responsibilities include:
Work closely with a dedicated cross functional team
Deliver new and support existing functionality (with a Dev Ops mind set).
Build, optimise and automate data pipelines
Identify problems or areas for continuous improvement and provide solutions proactively.
Collaborate in agile ways with Products Owners and the wider team to respond to business demand and deliver best practice solutions.
Delivers complex, cross functional initiatives with speed by ensuring teams adopt relevant methods and tools based on new ways of working.
ABOUT YOU
To be successful in this role, you must have:
2+ years of commercial experience in building, optimising and automating ‘data’ pipelines on AWS using Spark, EMR, Lambda, Glue, Kinesis, Athena, RedShift, EKS, etc
Experience in data profiling, ETL development, SQL optimisation
Familiarity with Data Modelling Techniques - Data Vault 2.0, Dimensional modelling
Experience in one or more of Python, Java, R, Spark SQL
Experience in data visualisation tool such as Tableau
Working knowledge of modern data warehousing architecture
Extensive experience working in an agile cross functional team
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Desired qualifications:
AWS Certified Associate Level certification
AWS Certified Data Analytics certification
If this opportunity sounds like a perfect fit for you, we'd encourage you to apply!
___________________________
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce in all its forms. We encourage applicants from diverse gender, cultural and linguistic backgrounds and applicants who may be living with a disability. We also offer flexibility in all our roles, to ensure everyone can participate.

FY23|S&M|#4275
Location(s)
Melbourne, Australia;
Your opportunity
Working with the Partner Sales organization, you will use your technical expertise and intuition for business to ensure our high-value partners (both alliances and channels) are able to grow their business by demonstrating the full scope of New Relic's product suite. You will enable our leading partners by providing domain expertise and by building technical assets and solutions to address their specific needs. You would also be responsible for enabling the Partner technical sales team to position New Relic solutions along with partner solutions for greater value to joint customers. You will also be working with partners in customer deals advising on technical selling opportunities.

 You have a keen understanding of customer needs, partner needs, industry trends and you have outstanding customer relationship building skills at all levels. You love to solve technical problems in real-time and thrive on playing multiple roles - solution architect, technology confidant, and evangelist!

 Are you ready to be part of this extraordinary story? If yes, this is the role for you!
What you'll do
* Oversee the adoption, optimization, and integration of New Relic’s products within a partner’s business infrastructure, platform, service or offering
Build technical assets such as workshops, solution packages, and applications to enable our leading partnersEvangelize new product features & provide partner and customer feedback to New Relic product management and engineering groupsWork closely with the Partner Sales team to identify and qualify revenue opportunities through the partners and enable New Relic Sales teams on how to grow pipeline and revenue at customers using partner platformsAssist the Customer Success team in the post-sales technical process: installation, deployment, training, technical check-ups, and critical issue managementEnsure timely resolution of partner issues by coordinating support responsesMaintain a deep understanding of the partner’s business as well as their technical environment
This role requires
10+ years of technical pre-sales experienceExperience working as/with Services partners, MSPs and/or SIsStrong technical background and partner sales/customer orientationProgramming experience with a modern programming language (Python, Java, Go, etc.)Superior organizational and project management skillsStrong presentation & negotiation skillsExcellent communication, critical thinking & analytical skills
Bonus points if you have
Specific experience in Application Performance Management (APM) concepts and/or other monitoring solutionsExperience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)Experience of helping or advising customers on cloud migration, Dev/Ops adoption and/or Digital transformationHands-on experience with React, Javascript, HTML5 and CSS (or equivalent experience with other front-end frameworks, such as Vue or Angular)Python programming experienceJavascript development experienceOpen Source contributionsBachelor's degree in Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent
We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to create more perfect software. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.

We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional, and business success through a workforce model called Flex First. The Flex First model allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or a combination of both.

Read more about Flex First and New Relic’s vaccine policy as part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and healthy workplace in light of the COVID-19 pandemic at www.newrelic.com/blog/how-to-relic/future-of-work.

Our hiring process

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.

New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.

New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Our client is a leading global custodian and fund services firm with a sizeable presence in Australia. The Project Manager role sits in the Change & Transformation team that services internal teams (Client Services, Back & Middle Office operations, Financial Reporting & Tax, Product and Transitions), clients, regulators, and partners with external vendors.

The role will require a motivated, results-focused person that has excellent project management and communication skills (both written and verbal). Must be interpersonal, deal with different levels of stakeholders, a quick learner, and confident in dealing with all matters, Business domain, IT, Product, Risk, Compliance, Legal and Global Governance.

The role of the Project Manager is to engage in, support, and deliver on:

Client / Business change projects
Emerging new business initiatives/projects
Internal/external technical change programs
Various continuous improvement programs

The position requires the Project Manager to:

Analyse, plan, execute, monitor, and deliver Business and/or IT projects
Establish and agree on scope, cost, schedule, and resources with awareness of strategic objectives
Implement appropriate status reporting and communication plan
Lead multi-disciplined teams uniting them in purpose across different jurisdictions
Plan and manage multiple and concurrent work streams across one or more projects
Be risk aware and meet compliance mandates ensuring the protection of business operations
Secure business operational readiness, IT handover, and attestations prior to go-live
Respect and assist the wider project community including contributing to best practices

Responsibilities.

Project planning, management, quality, control, and benefits realisation
Direct and indirect management of project resources as required
Manage project risks and issues reporting
Act as an escalation point for workstream issues, stakeholders, and project sponsor
Establish trust and confidence by clients through confident and competent management of client stakeholders
Collaborate closely with the client development team to ensure unified client management practices
Attend and chair (where required) client-specific meetings – Steering committees, working groups, change forums, planning sessions, etc

Qualifications/Experience:

8+ years of project management experience within Financial Services Industry
Prior financial services experience across any of Asset Management, Fund Administration, Superannuation, or Life Insurance is highly desirable
5+ years of hands-on Technology transformational change experience
Waterfall and Agile methodology experience
MS. Project, PowerPoint, Excel – Intermediate/Advanced
Experience in Custody, Middle Office, and/or Back Office
Prior experience with delivering business operational change and transformation
Financial reporting, Tax, and Regulatory experience – desirable
Client transitions, client onboarding experience – desirable
Prior experience with process mapping, interface, and data mapping
Prior experience in Dev/Ops or application/IT service management
Prior experience working with data warehouse, SQL, BI reporting, unit pricing, reconciliation, and/or accounting software – desirable
