About the role

At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive and to achieve this, we need a talented Engineer to join our Secrets Management squad in the Identity and Access Management Technology Area, which provides and maintains leading edge capability, methodology and governance to enable our businesses and our people to access systems and services, simply, seamlessly and securely.

As an Engineer, you will be a part of the squad working to expand HashiCorp Vault footprint in the bank to allow applications to scale up rapidly ad securely. This role will require you to enable systems to enhance their functional capabilities in automation.

You can also check out our Engineer persona to get an insight in to what a day in their life might look like.

What will your day look like

The Secrets Management Squad helps applications securely store, retrieve, and rotate static or dynamic secrets for their build or runtime use cases programmatically. The team continually enhances the Secrets technology and security offering whilst having a high demand of applications to integrate with the HashiCorp Vault platform. The service is deployed in all ANZ cloud environments as well as on premises, and performs all implementations via Dev Ops processes and tooling.

A typical day may involve:
Works with the Product Owner, engineers, analysts and testers to develop fit for purpose solution patterns, platform upgrades and self-service application onboarding to HashiCorp Vault.
Enables continuous improvement practices to increase delivery speed
Works in collaborative teams to build innovative solutions
Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around
reviews, quality and documentation
What will you bring?

To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:

Experience on micro services architecture such as Kubernetes, Docker etc.
Experience on DevOps CI-CD tools such as Bamboo, Bitbucket, Github, Jenkins etc.
Intermediate Linux/Unix administrator skills and TCP/IP network fundamentals
Intermediate programming and scripting background in shell/bash scripting, python, powershell
Intermediate experience with infrastructure and application configuration management tools such as Ansible, puppet, terraform etc
Basic to intermediate understanding and experience on event management tools such as Splunk, SumoLogic, Elastic search etc.
Experience with HashiCorp Vault or similar Secrets Management solution is a plus but a strong willingness to learn and upskill in Vault is just as desirable
Passionate, self-starter with the ability to work on problems from inception to completion
Strong communication skills
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Experience in working in an agile environment

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture and we actively encourage people to try new things. So if this role interests you and you feel you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you!

So, why join us?

We’re reinventing the way we do banking, and our community of collaborative, innovative thinkers who create human-centered solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter.

We’ll also offer you the opportunity to develop your career, working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated and create a great place to grow, thrive and belong.

A happy workplace is a thriving one, and some of the perks you’ll get from being an Engineer at ANZ are:

Lifestyle leave - Top up annual leave with additional purchased leave or take a longer period of unpaid time off

Discounts on our financial products, including an extra $500 in super for all females to address the super parity

Competitive parental leave policies – 26 weeks paid parental leave for both mums and dads and lump sum childcare contribution when you return to work

We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

Interested in joining us? Click Apply now, or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities.

This role is required to work from an ANZ workplace. Under the Victorian Government’s COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination (Workers) Directions, the successful candidate will need to provide evidence that they have received two doses of an approved COVID-19 vaccine, or have a medical exemption evidenced by an authorised medical practitioner, in order to be appointed to the role.

Please Note: After your initial application you may be asked to complete an online assessment, this invite will be sent to you via email from our assessment partner SHL. A happy workplace is a thriving one, and some of the perks you’ll get from being an Engineer at ANZ are:

Lifestyle leave - Top up annual leave with additional purchased leave or take a longer period of unpaid time off

Discounts on our financial products, including an extra $500 in super for all females to address the super parity

Competitive parental leave policies – 26 weeks paid parental leave for both mums and dads and lump sum childcare contribution when you return to work

We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

Interested in joining us? Click Apply now, or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities.

This role is required to work from an ANZ workplace. Under the Victorian Government’s COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination (Workers) Directions, the successful candidate will need to provide evidence that they have received two doses of an approved COVID-19 vaccine, or have a medical exemption evidenced by an authorised medical practitioner, in order to be appointed to the role.

Please Note: After your initial application you may be asked to complete an online assessment, this invite will be sent to you via email from our assessment partner SHL. Please action this request as early as possible, this will enable us to manage your application and provide you with an update in a timely manner. Show more

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges
THE FUTURE IS WHAT WE MAKE IT
DevOps Engineer
Adelaide, South Australia
The world is changing. And it’s a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We’re building a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.
Sine is now a part of Honeywell Connected Enterprise. Our head office is in Adelaide, South Australia and we have offices in Los Angeles, The Philippines and more to come! At Sine, we build better human experiences. That’s what gets us moving every day — we thrive on helping the largest corporates through to the local school, around the world, find easier ways to streamline their workplace, through visitor, contractor, staff and asset management. As a team, we are committed to being a part of a mission that matters. Striving to develop innovative, industry-leading solutions to everyday workplace challenges. We want to make our customers’ operations safer, simpler and more secure.
Sine has been rolled out to thousands of companies around the world and is used at locations such as schools, sports stadiums, offices, industrial, medical, retail and commercial facilities.
About the Role
Honeywell Sine is looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our Australian team! You will be responsible for the development and maintenance of infrastructure to assist with the deployment and operations of Sine's cloud services using Terraform, AWS, CloudFormation, Bitbucket, Docker, ECS, Kubernetes and networking components.
We're looking for an enthusiastic dev-ops engineer who has experience as a developer and is excited to build out reusable components for automation into AWS services.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, build and maintain infrastructure ‘as code’ for our application platform.
 Maintain and improve developer experience though networking/routing and discovery
Collaborate with our engineering teams to deliver, operate and monitor services
Engage in technical discussion of new solutions and advise on architectural decisions through a deep understanding of systems internals.
Build automation to execute common operations on various AWS services.
Leverage experience to evaluate new offerings from AWS to advise and drive adoption.
 Keep an eye out for interesting open source projects we can leverage to make our platform better.
Contribute to our infrastructure roadmap as we scale our platform.
Contribute to and improve our test, build & deployment CI pipelines.
Encourage innovation and foster an environment of continuous improvement.
Share technical solutions and product ideas through documentation, design reviews, pair programming, code review and technology discussions.
Key Experience & Capabilities:
A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent technical qualification
 Practical experience developing software solutions using technologies like (Node.js, Postgres, Docker and ECS)
Experience with CI/CD tooling (e.g: Jenkins, CircleCI, TravisCI, BitBucket Pipelines, AWS Pipelines etc)
Strong understanding of containerisation with technologies like (i.e: docker-compose, Kubernetes, ECS, Fargate).
Experience with distributed logging, monitoring and alerting (e.g: NewRelic, Cloudwatch, ELK, Graphite, Statsd, Prometheus, Sumologic, Datadog).
Experience with a range of storage engines (e.g: Postgres, Elasticsearch, Aurora, MongoDB, Redis) and know when each type is useful.
Experience with AWS and it's best practices.
Understanding of Unix/Linux Environments.
Experience with building infrastructure as code with modern automation tools (e.g: Terraform, Cloudformation, etc).
Understanding of how web applications work, from the underlying network protocols (HTTP, TCP) through to application (Apache, Nginx), browser behaviour and everything in between.
Effective communication skills, via interactive mediums and documentation.
Discover More
We’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshaper, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/
If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell.
The future is what we make it. So join us and let’s do this together.
Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer, and we support a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.

A career that gives you more

The role of Senior Analyst Engineering will provide critical thinking and a high degree of technical innovation and attention to detail while being recognised as a trusted advisor to the team and stakeholders. The characteristics include being versatile, displaying leadership qualities and enthusiasm to take on new problems across the full SDLC, ultimately assisting in moving technology forward.

About the role

Apply relevant specialist knowledge and experience to understand, influence and advise internal and/or external clients. Functions including the use of discretion/delegation and authority may be carried out within clearly defined policies, principles and specific objectives and may include people leadership roles with leadership accountability for a team, or teams, of employees. Employees are responsible for the delivery of work but accountability may sit at a higher Group.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Estimate of the effort required to implement the software user stories then develop and validate the components
Contribute to User Stories creation including but not limit to Acceptance Criteria and Test Acceptance Criteria
Develop test automation (Unit, Component, Integrated Component and Feature) scripts to validate the acceptance criteria contained in the user stories
Develop scripts that deploy the software components onto the infrastructure and then validate them
 Perform Root Cause Analysis on issues discovered in the software components
Proactively address issues discovered in software components, infrastructure and scripts
Ensure that quality and SDLC procedures defined for the position within the service are followed
Ensure that an automation first approach is followed
 Participate in production releases

Ensure Configuration Management and Knowledge Management processes are adhered to - Own, manage and demonstrate uplift from PIRs for continuous improvement on the release process

 Provide Technical Leadership / Mentorship to the Engineers.

Your Skills and Experience:

Proven experience in Programming and Applications Design, with general IT experience, coupled with tertiary qualifications in Computer Science or a related discipline.

Knowledge of database packages such as Oracle RDS, Postgres, Redis

Excellent Programming Skills: angularJS, React, TypeScript, JSP, EJB, Struts, Spring, Sprint boot, hibernate, Java 8

Experience with Agile methodologies

Automated testing frameworks and processes.

Dev Ops experience and familiar with Jenkins, CI / CD pipelines.

Strong in AWS or similar Cloud Based technology

Experience with the Agile software development approach

To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status. Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advert.

To help keep our community safe, candidates are required to comply with vaccine requirements outlined in state based public health orders Work type: Permanent Full time
Location: Aust - VIC Metro

Making Mobility Seamless
Vix is a global leader in automated fare collection, transit information and transit analytics solutions. Trusted by over 200 city and regional transport authorities around the world, we have been driving change in fare collection for over 35 years.
We offer a genuinely flexible working environment – customer outcomes and commitment to delivery is the focus at Vix. Work from the office, work from home, work from the local café – you’ll be able to manage your personal and professional commitments seamlessly at Vix. In fact, HRD gave Vix the excellence award in 2021 for our MyFlex program.
Our core values are a statement of intent about the type of business we strive to be and describe the way we work and how we interact with each other, our customers and our partners:
#Think like a customer
#Focus on what matters
#Do great things together
#Be smart, stay curious
Find out more about your new workplace here!
We're on the hunt for a motivated, engaged Team Lead – Corporate IT Systems for this key leadership position within Vix Technology. You’ll work with and be responsible for a small team in the APAC region delivering our regional Corporate IT strategy and supporting sites across APAC. You’ll also work with other teams globally to deliver and develop best practice solutions as well as consulting with the wider business in an SME capacity across projects and internal processes.
We are a global organisation at Vix - embracing the strength that individual diversity brings to an organisation. Bring your individual orientation, cultural heritage and distinctive thinking – we want to hear from you!
What will you be responsible for?
Leading the Corporate IT service delivery within APAC as part of a global team
Contributing to the development of a global corporate IT strategy
Keeping abreast of current and emerging technology trends, as well as best practice
Vendor liaison for procurement, warranty and escalation management
Operating in a F-T-S (Follow the Sun) escalation/resolution and ITIL based model of IT incidents and service requests, through the CIT service-desk platform, within set SLA
Recommending, designing, and implementing solutions that adhere to current best practices in order to support the systems and services used by Vix
Maintenance, administration and monitoring of all Corporate IT infrastructure platforms and systems, including firewalls, intra/inter-site networking connectivity, and AWS corporate production accounts
Reviewing and maintaining system automation solutions and developing additional automation opportunities
Ensuring that all communications infrastructure and supported systems are maintained and monitored appropriately
Engaging with internal and external stakeholders to ensure that IT platforms deliver to business needs effectively
Participating in optimisation and auditing activities to ensure effective standardisation and configuration of infrastructure environments
Operating within a PCI compliant environment, with strict adherence to ISO27001 and ISO9001 standards
Generating and maintaining internal records, registers and system documentation
Contribution to, and delivery of, the global Corporate IT strategic plan

What does our ideal candidate look like?
Tertiary qualification in Information Technology, or related discipline
Ability to work independently, and as part of a globally decentralised team
Enthusiastic, customer service minded personality with excellent communication skills
Experience with many or all the following technical solutions: Cisco Meraki switches and firewalls, multi-tenant AWS environments, enterprise security and antivirus platforms, infrastructure monitoring suites, MS Active Directory administration inc. group policy
Demonstrable experience with concepts, practices and architecture related to cloud technologies
Advanced problem solving and diagnostic capabilities

Desirable:
ITIL Foundations Certified
Relevant industry recognised certifications, (eg: CCNA or greater, ECMS, Microsoft Role Based certifications - Windows/m365)
AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner (or greater)
Practical experience with configuring international network environments
Experience supporting internal dev-ops and engineering teams

What’s in it for you?
Besides the opportunity to work for a global company that is customer and people focused. We offer:
An award-winning flexible working culture with a truly flexible working environment –– we don’t get hung up on location, we are interested in achieving outcome for and delivering to our customers.
A focus on learning and development – we have a sleek onboarding and L&D platform – get up to speed quickly and continue learning on your Vix journey
Paid parental leave
Active social club and lots of company activities

Sounds good? Then apply now. Get on board here!
Add your resume and anything else to showcase why you would be a great addition to our team. Don’t forget to include confirmation of your working rights as we can only accept application from candidates in the location advertised with existing working rights.
No recruitment agencies, please! We won’t accept any introductions.
Vix Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all people and want to build a workforce as diverse as the community we serve. We aim to have a work environment where everyone feels included and everyone can realise their full potential. Making Mobility Seamless
Vix is a global leader in automated fare collection, transit information and transit analytics solutions. Trusted by over 200 city and regional transport authorities around the world, we have been driving change in fare collection for over 35 years.
We offer a genuinely flexible working environment – customer outcomes and commitment to delivery is the focus at Vix. Work from the office, work from home, work from the local café – you’ll be able to manage your personal and professional commitments seamlessly at Vix. In fact, HRD gave Vix the excellence award in 2021 for our MyFlex program.
Our core values are a statement of intent about the type of business we strive to be and describe the way we work and how we interact with each other, our customers and our partners:
#Think like a customer
#Focus on what matters
#Do great things together
#Be smart, stay curious
Find out more about your new workplace here!
We're on the hunt for a motivated, engaged Team Lead – Corporate IT Systems for this key leadership position within Vix Technology. You’ll work with and be responsible for a small team in the APAC region delivering our regional Corporate IT strategy and supporting sites across APAC. You’ll also work with other teams globally to deliver and develop best practice solutions as well as consulting with the wider business in an SME capacity across projects and internal processes.
We are a global organisation at Vix - embracing the strength that individual diversity brings to an organisation. Bring your individual orientation, cultural heritage and distinctive thinking – we want to hear from you!
What will you be responsible for?
Leading the Corporate IT service delivery within APAC as part of a global team
Contributing to the development of a global corporate IT strategy
Keeping abreast of current and emerging technology trends, as well as best practice
Vendor liaison for procurement, warranty and escalation management
Operating in a F-T-S (Follow the Sun) escalation/resolution and ITIL based model of IT incidents and service requests, through the CIT service-desk platform, within set SLA
Recommending, designing, and implementing solutions that adhere to current best practices in order to support the systems and services used by Vix
Maintenance, administration and monitoring of all Corporate IT infrastructure platforms and systems, including firewalls, intra/inter-site networking connectivity, and AWS corporate production accounts
Reviewing and maintaining system automation solutions and developing additional automation opportunities
Ensuring that all communications infrastructure and supported systems are maintained and monitored appropriately
Engaging with internal and external stakeholders to ensure that IT platforms deliver to business needs effectively
Participating in optimisation and auditing activities to ensure effective standardisation and configuration of infrastructure environments
Operating within a PCI compliant environment, with strict adherence to ISO27001 and ISO9001 standards
Generating and maintaining internal records, registers and system documentation
Contribution to, and delivery of, the global Corporate IT strategic plan

What does our ideal candidate look like?
Tertiary qualification in Information Technology, or related discipline
Ability to work independently, and as part of a globally decentralised team
Enthusiastic, customer service minded personality with excellent communication skills
Experience with many or all the following technical solutions: Cisco Meraki switches and firewalls, multi-tenant AWS environments, enterprise security and antivirus platforms, infrastructure monitoring suites, MS Active Directory administration inc. group policy
Demonstrable experience with concepts, practices and architecture related to cloud technologies
Advanced problem solving and diagnostic capabilities

Desirable:
ITIL Foundations Certified
Relevant industry recognised certifications, (eg: CCNA or greater, ECMS, Microsoft Role Based certifications - Windows/m365)
AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner (or greater)
Practical experience with configuring international network environments
Experience supporting internal dev-ops and engineering teams

Date: 21-Jul-2022

Location:
Melbourne, VIC, AU Brisbane, QLD, AU Canberra, ACT, AU Sydney, NSW, AU

Department: Consulting

Description:
Dynamics CRM Architect

At Deloitte Digital, we are all responsible for challenging the status quo, and bringing innovative and differentiated thinking to everything we do. Deloitte Digital is an innovative leader in online and mobile strategy, design and development. We work with a wide range of clients helping them adapt to and harness new media and technology. Our combination of strategic thinking and innovative solutions is what sets us apart, and we make sure to stay at the forefront of new technology.

About our team

Part Business. Part Creative. Part Technology. One hundred per cent digital. Through 22 studios spread across the globe, we provide clients with a full suite of digital services, covering digital strategy, user experience, content, creative, engineering and implementation across mobile, web and social media channels.

About the role

Our Digital Managed Services team is responsible for the ongoing support and development of client production systems. We work alongside our build teams from initial solution design through to operations support and continuous improvement. This end-to-end involvement allows us to shape the solutions we operate. Our high-performing team is comprised of highly experienced technical specialists, front-end and back-end developers, DevOps engineers, and delivery managers.

Our Melbourne team is growing and we’re on the look-out for an experienced Microsoft Dynamics CRM Architect to join us. You will have leading technical competency in the Microsoft Dynamics as well experience leading software engineers to deliver and support enterprise digital platforms.

With a background in software development and support with a passion for technology, the focus of this role is on maintenance and delivery of high quality well engineered solutions, working with our team and clients to deliver outcomes to address complex challenges and environments. You will also be a leader within the Microsoft Dynamics capability team mentoring junior and senior developers in efficiently delivering high-quality software engineering outcomes and provide thought leadership to keep our team at the forefront of the latest software engineering practices.

As a Dynamics Technical Lead you will be the primary technical leader on large enterprise Dynamics maintenance and development projects. You will work with both technical and non-technical client stakeholders to understand, design, implement and maintain solutions.

Note – This role is open to Australian citizens owing to client requirements.

Along with the experience and energy you bring to the team, you’ll be responsible for:

Advising and consulting with client on how to best meet requirements with Dynamics solution technology
Advising clients on best practice software engineering, code quality and dev ops practices
Solving complex issue for Dynamics based implementations
Delivering and maintaining large scale and complex digital implementations across different client industries, development teams and technologies.
Managing and mentoring teams of developers and full stack technologists
Supporting service delivery managers to develop and manage release plans, scope, variations, and technical risks
Contributing your knowledge and experience to continuously improve the processes and practices used do deliver software across the Deloitte Digital technology team.
Contribute to business development through providing solution options and development estimates

About your experience

To be considered for this position, you will have deep and broad Digital experience and a proven track record of delivering and maintaining digital projects, including:

Minimum 8 years’ experience across software engineering disciplines and Microsoft Dynamics technologies
Minimum 2 years’ experience of managing technical teams in delivering solutions using waterfall and agile methodologies
Experience working with continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines
Hands on estimation methodology
Proven success in technology leadership across a range of enterprise digital technologies and projects including CRM, Portals, APIs and System integration
Hands on Dynamics CRM development and configuration experience (create custom workflows and plugins, APIs, etc)
Understand and demonstrate experience with leading dev ops practices, including tools and techniques for continuous integration / delivery
A desire to contribute to the broader success of the technical team by playing a mentoring and coaching role to other team members
Understanding of ITIL service delivery lifecycle

Desirable experience (will be considered an advantage):
Field Services and/or Sales and/or Service and/or PSA experience
Dynamics portals experience
Power Platform experience
Microsoft Dynamics Certifications - PL-600 - Microsoft Solution Architecture Certification, PL-200: Microsoft Power Platform Functional, PL-900 : Power Platform Fundamentals, AZ-900: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals
Talent or Marketing for Dynamics
Experience with test automation and code scanning tools highly regarded.
Experience working in a multi-client engagement.

Deloitte culture

Deloitte Digital is a major force on the Australian Digital Landscape. We combine fun with serious intent where business, creativity and technology intersect.

We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social – and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed – in every sense of the word

If you have questions regarding this role, please contact Ian in our Talent Acquisition Team via the Our Recruiters section on our careers website.

By applying to this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.

At Deloitte, we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another; prioritise respect, fairness, development and wellbeing; foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background, experience, identity, ability or thinking style, and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request.

The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider. Date: 21-Jul-2022

Title: QA Analyst - Geeks2U
Location:
North Rocks, New South Wales, AU
About us

At Officeworks we make bigger things happen. Our customers, our team, and our community are our heart and soul. And if our brilliant people have taught us anything, it is that we can do all kinds of incredible things, each and every day.
2 years ago we acquired Geeks2U to expand our scope of services we offer to our customers. Geeks is now integrated into our Officeworks Store network and website creating a “one stop shop” for all the technology needs of our household and business customers.
Geeks2U is Australia’s leading on-site technology support provider and prides itself on delivering prompt, no fuss, same day tech services to customers in both metropolitan and regional areas right across Australia.

About the role

We are excited to announce a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Quality Assurance Analyst to join our Customer Experience team. This exciting role will ensure product quality and customer experience by verifying the intended scope is executed in the right way and at all appropriate junctures of the implementation of a solution.
As a QA Analyst with Geeks2U, you have full autonomy and accountability of the quality of what you’re delivering- you are your own Test Manager! In addition, you will Test and Release using world leading practices and tool in Continuous Integration and Delivery, Automation and Agile testing approaches.
As a Quality Assurance Analyst, you will be responsible for specifying, developing and writing test plans, test scripts and producing test cases. You will carry out regression testing using automated test software applications in order to test the behaviour, functionality and integrity of all Geeks2U Applications.
This role will see you working with Micro Services Single Page Application Technology in a Dev Ops environment. This would be the perfect opportunity for a candidate with a strong manual testing background to develop their skillset and experience in the automated testing space.

About you

Our ideal candidate will demonstrate a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in a similar role, including exposure to a wide range of open source software’s and mobile applications. You’ll be comfortable working in a fast paced, Agile environment and have exposure to test management tools including TestRail. Additionally, you demonstrate experience with open source automation software such as Jenkins.

Our culture

It’s all in a day’s work when you’re part of the Officeworks community – where you’re not defined by who you are, but what you can do. We celebrate our teams’ uniqueness by offering the below to the Officeworks family:
An inclusive, diverse, and supportive environment.
Flexible working arrangements to best support your individual needs.
A key focus on wellbeing and safety.
Generous discounts at Officeworks, Bunnings, Kmart, Target and Catch.
Ongoing training and development opportunities to progress your career.
Industry leading Growing Families policy and access to Circle In portal for Working Families.
At Officeworks, we operate best when our team represents the communities we serve. We proudly commit to providing a safe and supportive work environment for everyone. We actively encourage applications from all candidates, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people with disabilities.
Officeworks is a ‘Circle Back Initiative’ employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.
Officeworks requires all new team members to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 (unless they have a medical exemption). This recognises that governments in a number of jurisdictions have already mandated vaccinations for people working in retail and is about creating a safer workplace for team, customers and the community. As a Quality Assurance Analyst, you will be responsible for specifying, developing and writing test plans, test scripts and producing test cases. You will carry out regression testing using automated test software applications in order to test the behaviour, functionality and integrity of all Geeks2U Applications.
This role will see you working with Micro Services Single Page Application Technology in a Dev Ops environment. This would be the perfect opportunity for a candidate with a strong manual testing background to develop their skillset and experience in the automated testing space.

About you

Our ideal candidate will demonstrate a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in a similar role, including exposure to a wide range of open source software’s and mobile applications. You’ll be comfortable working in a fast paced, Agile environment and have exposure to test management tools including TestRail. Additionally, you demonstrate experience with open source automation software such as Jenkins.

Our culture

It’s all in a day’s work when you’re part of the Officeworks community – where you’re not defined by who you are, but what you can do. We celebrate our teams’ uniqueness by offering the below to the Officeworks family:
An inclusive, diverse, and supportive environment.
Flexible working arrangements to best support your individual needs.
A key focus on wellbeing and safety.
Generous discounts at Officeworks, Bunnings, Kmart, Target and Catch.
Ongoing training and development opportunities to progress your career.
Industry leading Growing Families policy and access to Circle In portal for Working Families.
At Officeworks, we operate best when our team represents the communities we serve. We proudly commit to providing a safe and supportive work environment for everyone. We actively encourage applications from all candidates, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people with disabilities.
Officeworks is a ‘Circle Back Initiative’ employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.
Officeworks requires all new team members to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 (unless they have a medical exemption). This recognises that governments in a number of jurisdictions have already mandated vaccinations for people working in retail and is about creating a safer workplace for team, customers and the community. 2 years ago we acquired Geeks2U to expand our scope of services we offer to our customers. Geeks is now integrated into our Officeworks Store network and website creating a “one stop shop” for all the technology needs of our household and business customers.
Geeks2U is Australia’s leading on-site technology support provider and prides itself on delivering prompt, no fuss, same day tech services to customers in both metropolitan and regional areas right across Australia.

job_title: This DevOps advert is to the tune of Vanilla Ice... MUST READ. Dev Ops Baby
listing_jobDesc:
Read to the tune of Vanilla Ice - Ice Ice Baby

Yo, VIP, Let's kick it!!!!

Dev Dev Baby, Ops Ops Baby

All right stop, collaborate with dev and listen
Ops is back with my brand new invention
DevOps grabs a hold of you tightly
Then you flow like powershell daily and nightly
Will it ever stop? Yo - I don't know
Turn off the containers and I'll blow
To the extreme, you rock AWS like a vandal
Deploy to the cloud continuously like a scandal.

Dance
DevOps is the market that booms
Your testing your brain like a poisonous mushroom
Deadly, when you write a dope bash script
Anything less than cloud strategy is a felony
Love it or leave it, You better terraform
You better hit bull's eye, The dev's don't play
If there was a problem, Yo, you'll solve it
Check out this advert while JDP revolves it

Ops Ops Baby Vanilla, Dev Dev Baby... Vanilla
Dev Ops Baby Vanilla, Ops Dev Baby... Vanilla

Now that the business is jumping
With the AWS kicked in, the ec2's are pumpin'
Quick to deploy, to the point no stopping
Your cooking serverless computing like a pound of bacon
Delivering code, if it ain't quick and nimble
You go crazy when you hear a tester
And a chef hat with an AGILE tempo
Your on a roll and it's time to go solo
Rollin' in your .NET 5.0
With the containers down so your hair can blow-up
The scrum-master on standby, Waving just to say Hi
Did you stop? No - it's CD, why?

Kept on scripting to the next stop
You bash a left and your heading to the next infrastructure block
That infrastructure was dead

Yo - so you continuously integrated to S3 Beachfront Ave
Puppet was hot wearing less than bikinis
Ruby lovers driving Lamborghinis-onrails
Jealous 'cause you're out making monthly k$9
Agile Coach with a meeting and you with no time
Ready for the employee of the month on the wall
The office acting nice because they're so full of fried chicken balls
Release date ranged out like a bell
You asked your tester - All you hear is a bombshell
Failing on the final test real fast
Jumped your car, slammed on the gas
Melbourne traffic Collins streets packed
Try to get away before you get called back
Team Lead on the scene, You know what I mean
They backed me up, confronted all the **** code fiends
If there was a problem, Yo - you'll solve it
Check out this advert while JDP revolves it

Ops Ops Baby... Vanilla,

Dev Dev Baby... Vanilla
Dev Ops Baby... Vanilla,

Ops Dev Baby... Vanilla

Take heed, 'cause James Farrey a lyrical poet
Melbourne's on the scene for DevOps just in case you didn't know it
My town, that created all this career sound
Enough to shake and kick holes in your current works ground
'Cause my style's like a banter bomb spill
Feasible job options that you can vision and feel
Conducted and formed, this role is a hell of a concept
I make it hype and you want to step

With this. You apply via this page

CV like a ninja, cover letter like a razor blade

So good - other clients say, "damn"
If your skillset was a drug, I'd sell it by the gram
When I get you the job it's time to get loose
Expense all the drinks even the juice
If there was a candidate shortage, Yo - I'll solve it!
Check out this advert while JDP revolves it.

Ops Ops Baby Vanilla, Dev Dev Baby Vanilla
Dev Ops Baby Vanilla, Ops Dev Baby Vanilla

Yo man - Let's get you out of there! Word to your current boss!

DevOps Baby Too code, DevOps Baby Too code Too code
DevOps Baby Too code Too code, DevOps Baby Too code Too code

Word to your motherboard.

To make it easy for you, I am looking for Senior DevOps engineers who appreciate Vanilla Ice. You will have the following in the trunk of your 5.0:


Bash / PowershellPuppet, Ansible, Chef,
AWSTerraformKubernetesComing from a network engineer background or development background.NET experienceCI / CD

James Farrey
Just Digital People
ph/txt: 0415 676 072
w: www.justdigitalpeople.com.au
e: james@justdigitalpeople.com.au Read to the tune of Vanilla Ice - Ice Ice Baby

Digital Health Technology team powers digital experiences and engagement to enhance the lives of millions of people every day through connected care. We build, deliver and manage a portfolio of data management platforms and mobile offerings in support of our core businesses. We thrive on simple and elegant architecture and agility. You’ll be immersed in a dynamic high-growth environment and empowered to excel, take informed risks, and drive ingenuity across the enterprise.
ResMed is a global leader in connected devices and digital health. We help millions of people sleep, breathe and live better lives. Are you ready to help fuel our growth? As ResMed continues to evolve with the future of healthcare, our customer-centric organization focuses on cloud-connected devices and digital health technologies that are designed to help treat and manage sleep apnea, COPD, and other chronic respiratory diseases that, together, affect over one billion people worldwide.
Let’s talk about the team
We are a small cross-functional product team with a broad range of responsibilities and duties. We collaborate with product managers and other development teams globally across the Digital Health Technology group of ResMed. We’re passionate about solving problems across the entire software development lifecycle – whether that’s investigating new technologies, frameworks and cloud services, developing new features, improving our CI/CD pipelines and test automation, or figuring out how to better automate our release process. We’re always up for a challenge and love learning new things!
Let’s talk about the role
We’re looking for a full-stack engineer who is ready to dive in and work on a variety of tasks including frontend and backend development as well as dev-ops and infrastructure related tasks. You’ll be comfortable working both autonomously and as part of a team and will be willing to lend your talents and experience to other team members when they need it.
Some of the key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
Expanding on the existing frameworks and services to implement new features and innovate on our software products
Designing and architecting new microservices and micro-frontends.
Working with others to design, implement and support our AWS infrastructure and services
Extending our automated unit testing and integration testing frameworks
Implement security and performance improvements to our services
Production support (occasionally)
Let’s talk about the Skills and Experience required:
3+ years of software engineering experience with an object-oriented language.
Experience with a frontend client-side framework, preferably Angular
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Solid ability in writing clean maintainable code.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Experience writing automated tests.
Experience with a cloud platform.
Languages: Java (currently our primary language), Javascript/Typescript, Python
Amazon Web Services (AWS). Particularly experience in ECS, EC2, Lambda, DynamoDB, RDS, OpenSearch, AmazonMQ.
AWS certifications will be desirable
Frameworks: Spring Boot, Angular
Experience with both relational and NoSQL databases will beneficial
Knowledge and experience in CI/CD pipeline tools and infrastructure (preferably experience in Jenkins, Terraform, AWS CodeBuild and AWS CodePipeline) will be valuable
Interest in digital health and medical devices
Experience with microservice and micro-frontend architectures
Ability to articulate and implement a vision while inspiring our large developer community to join forces. Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now!

At GenesisCare we want to hear from people who are as passionate as we are about innovation and working together to drive better life outcomes for patients around the world.
Do you want to work on products that improve the world we live in? If you join GenesisCare’s Digital Solutions team you can not only work on a modern tech stack, but you also get to work on a web application that is helping improve the standard of care that cancer patients receive, in a dynamic, fun team full of genuinely good humans.
About the position
We are searching for a passionate, Senior Front-end Engineer who can help us lift our front-end engineering practices. You will be a central part of the development of our product and have a say in choosing technologies, tools, and architecture of new product features, we are still a small (but growing team) so you will be able to influence our tech stack and architecture decisions in this role
Our front-end is built using React with Hooks, apollo with graphQL, moving from SCSS to Styled Components coupled with StoryBook We maintain code quality with Jest + Enzyme for unit testing, Cypress for automation testing and Eslint to follow TypeScript standards
About you
You will be someone who can lead on new ideas, think outside the box, challenges the status quo, has high energy levels and is someone that wants to work in a dynamic, fun, fast paced environment.
With your eye for detail, you don’t want to be handed a Figma link, you want to be involved in how the design comes to be through ideation and implementation. You’ve chosen React as your tool of the trade and with it you can work magic. You are opinionated about quality and the engineering processes involved in creating maintainable, performant and good-looking componentry.
You enjoy mentoring and teaching colleagues at all levels, while also learning from them, and you want to be able to contribute to team culture and our tech guilds.
Skills and Experience for success:
7+ years experience working in software development
3+ years of front-end development using React (must have)
1+ year experience with GraphQL frameworks Apollo
Experience creating and maintaining shared component libraries e.g. Storybook
Experience with styling libraries/frameworks e.g. styled components, material-ui
Experience with build tools such as Docker, webpack or esbuild
About Us
The Digital Solutions team at GenesisCare has a vision to deliver evidence-based care around the world using a common platform to improve patient experience and life outcomes. We do this by building products for Patients, Doctors, Nurses & Radiation Therapists. Our products are built to provide intelligent automated workflows to drive consistency across the treatment journey, we leverage Machine Learning to improve decision support for staff, ultimately with the goal of improving patient’s lives.
Technologies we use
Front-end: Webpack, TypeScript, React, Apollo, GraphQL, SCSS, Styled Components, Jest, Cypress
Backend: Python Django, Graphene, Redis, Redis Streams, Celery, Fast API etc.
Hosting/Ops: AWS, Docker, Terraform, DataDog, Cloud Watch, Sentry, Elastic Cache, Redash
How we work
Teams: Each team consists of 3-5 engineers, a PO and either a BA or a Designer and Clinical Subject Matter expert. Teams are cross-functional, self-organised and most use a flavour of Scrum with a 2-week sprint.
Guilds: Guilds are a place to share knowledge and experiences across tech, product and clinical areas. We have a weekly tech guild/tech reading club and a quarterly clinical guild where we hear from Doctors, Nurses and Patients that use our applications.
Test focused: We like to test the code we build, and we have a continuous integration infrastructure in place that runs our tests on every push.
DevOps mindset: We are cloud first, and everything outside local dev is hosted in AWS. Each team is responsible for deployments and monitoring of their own services. All work is managed through GitHub and Jira.
Privacy and data security: we take our patients’ right to privacy seriously, and are continuously enhancing our practices to achieve this, while supporting our products’ deployments in multiple regions, including the EU and US.
Remote First: We have distributed teams across the UK, USA and Australia. We have a remote first principle and have evolved our team ways of working during the last few years of remote work. Note if you are Sydney based, our team in Sydney do get together once a week at our head office for some good old-fashioned face to face time.
GenesisCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. At GenesisCare we want to hear from people who are as passionate as we are about innovation and working together to drive better life outcomes for patients around the world.

Locations: Remote - AU Wide
We give you a world of potential
Do you take pride in delivering high-quality outcomes and outstanding results, and has a knack for building long lasting relationships? If so we have a great opportunity for you!
Our Services Operations team require an exceptional Platform Engineer who will be able to maintain, support and grow the Oceania web application environments in adherence with business and technology service levels.
This position will give you work life balance offering remote working, open to all across Australia. Flexibility is required for some out of hours work which includes software releases and ad-hoc application support as part of an on-call roster.

A role you will love
The Platform Engineer is responsible for maintaining and deploying Computershare’s software across our production and test environments. Platform Engineers are responsible for managing Windows server environments, managing ADC configuration, creating and maintaining application deployment process, deploying application packages, and supporting internally developed applications and backend platforms throughout their test and production lifecycle.
The team is reliant on close collaboration with both operational and development teams, strong relationship building with both internal and external stakeholder application user groups, development teams, product support teams, & internal business groups. Acting as trouble-shooters and consultants, they assist other technology teams to ensure the delivery of robust applications and services.
Responsibilities of the role include:
Manage Windows Server based hosted environments as part of the Service Operations team (involving environment builds, deployments, ADC management, patching, monitoring, etc.)
Deploying and maintaining Computershare’s software.
Liaising with development operations and development teams to ensure consistent delivery of software services.
Automation and process improvement.
The use of technology stacks such as Windows Server, IIS, PowerShell, Citrix ADC & SQL server.

What will you bring to the role?
You are expected to contribute to Computershare’s technology stack by reviewing and enhancing existing processes, supporting our larger group’s automation initiatives. Be a pioneer in challenging the status quo to find a more productive way of doing things better. You are required to continuously strive to maintain high performance in the face of change, keeping us ahead in our industry.
Key skills required:
Exposure to enterprise level application hosting
Experience with .Net Application Server management (IIS, Windows Services)
Experience with basic SQL Server queries
Some exposure to scripting and process automation
Exposure to deployment tools (Octopus Deploy, Azure Dev ops or similar)
Experience with Software Development Lifecycle processes
Strong mind-set to enforce security standards, both in the environments and when collaborating with teams

Desired Skills:
Exposure to enterprise level application hosting
Microsoft .NET Stack (Windows Server, IIS, Windows Services)
PowerShell
Citrix ADC
RabbitMQ
SSRS
Kubernetes
Degree in Computer Science or equivalent

Come be part of our company that prides itself on providing ample career development.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX: CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 14,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 40,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation, and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand our customers’ needs to allow us to drive better outcomes.
We are happy to accommodate individual needs during your application journey. If you require disability accommodations or adjustments, please email us at TalentAcquisition@computershare.com detailing your requirements and contact information.
Computershare is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by applicable law.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment. Locations: Remote - AU Wide

Click here to watch a video by Sam from Proxyrack:
https://youtu.be/9m_WShu3AiA
Proxyrack is a fully remote company that makes enterprise-level data collection available for all businesses. Their customers love them because they offer a quality network at an affordable price, with a fast setup and low friction to get started!
With ten fully remote workers working from all over the world - Australia, China, Eastern Europe, the US, and the Philippines - Proxyrack aims to build a positive remote atmosphere of collaboration and teamwork! Everyone is free to take initiative, come up with ideas for improvement and drive the processes forward. Feedback flows freely and openly in all directions - and collaboration leads to the best possible results. It’s important to try new things and even make mistakes, as long as you learn from them!
If you’re looking for an ambitious company dedicated to growth, this may be the perfect opportunity for you. Join Proxyrack, a successful company aiming to become be the #1 choice for affordable data collection solutions!
Right now, Proxyrack is looking for a Dev Ops Engineer to help deliver apps from developers to production and ensure high availability for their customers.
As the new Dev Ops Engineer, you will:
Learn the company’s current set-up (utilizing Hashicorp products - Nomad, Consul, Vault)
Implement CI/CD for the existing microservice applications
Manage & improve high availability requirements by orchestrating applications between multiple datacenters
Own the core services used by multiple engineering team members.
Develop & implement your own ideas for improving the setups
You will interact mostly with the Founder and the Dev Team, but will report to the General Manager who will make sure you have everything you need.
During the first few weeks, you will receive training and get to know the team, but will also have the opportunity to start making your own plan and maybe even implement some of it. The tools you’ll use are Slack, Notion and Jira. This is a full-time role, but you are free to manage your own schedule, as long as you can have some overlap with other timezones for certain projects or meetings.
Requirements
To be a successful candidate, you need:
DevOps experience
Experience in using Linux: Ubuntu - HashiCorp Nomad (Orchestration tool), HashiCorp Consul (Mesh networking), HashiCorp Vault (Secrets)
Experience in using Baremetal servers / Ansible Playbooks / Golang & NodeJS repositories
Excellent skills in TCP/IP networking
Our ideal candidate is someone who doesn’t mind working by themselves and doesn’t require much hand-holding, with the ability to solve problems and make their own suggestions on how to improve. You also need to be tech-savvy and eager to take on new challenges.
If you’re also looking for a long-term position with lots of room for growth and the ability to implement your own ideas, go ahead and apply!
Benefits
What’s in it for you?
$5000 - $8000* per month
Full time & fully remote
Flexibility to create your own schedule
Endless opportunities for career growth
Personal development budget
Yearly review with the possibility of salary increase
Please note that this is a gross salary and that you are responsible for any tax-related procedures in your country of residence. We kindly ask you to apply only if you are happy to work remotely as an independent contractor.
This position will be closed as soon as we find the perfect match. So, make sure to read the description carefully and take your time to submit a high-quality application that stands out.
If you apply, JobRack will respond promptly and keep you updated throughout the process.
Please expect the hiring process to include:
1 - Filling in the application form once you click “Apply”
2 - Being invited to record a short video to introduce yourself
3 - Completing test tasks, if short-listed
4 - Attending video interviews where you will have the opportunity to talk more about your previous experience and the new role
Applications are only accepted through JobRack. Proxyrack has specifically requested that you do not contact them directly. If you have any questions please contact us using support@jobrack.eu
To make sure you receive updates on your application please add recruitment@jobrack.eu to your email address book.

Got questions about working remotely? Check out JobRack’s FAQ for answers to everything you might want to know. https://jobrack.eu/jobseeker-faq Click here to watch a video by Sam from Proxyrack:

During the first few weeks, you will receive training and get to know the team, but will also have the opportunity to start making your own plan and maybe even implement some of it. The tools you’ll use are Slack, Notion and Jira. This is a full-time role, but you are free to manage your own schedule, as long as you can have some overlap with other timezones for certain projects or meetings.
Requirements
To be a successful candidate, you need:
DevOps experience
Experience in using Linux: Ubuntu - HashiCorp Nomad (Orchestration tool), HashiCorp Consul (Mesh networking), HashiCorp Vault (Secrets)
Experience in using Baremetal servers / Ansible Playbooks / Golang & NodeJS repositories
Excellent skills in TCP/IP networking
Our ideal candidate is someone who doesn’t mind working by themselves and doesn’t require much hand-holding, with the ability to solve problems and make their own suggestions on how to improve. You also need to be tech-savvy and eager to take on new challenges.
If you’re also looking for a long-term position with lots of room for growth and the ability to implement your own ideas, go ahead and apply!
Benefits
What’s in it for you?
$5000 - $8000* per month
Full time & fully remote
Flexibility to create your own schedule
Endless opportunities for career growth
Personal development budget
Yearly review with the possibility of salary increase
Please note that this is a gross salary and that you are responsible for any tax-related procedures in your country of residence. We kindly ask you to apply only if you are happy to work remotely as an independent contractor.
This position will be closed as soon as we find the perfect match. So, make sure to read the description carefully and take your time to submit a high-quality application that stands out.
If you apply, JobRack will respond promptly and keep you updated throughout the process.
Please expect the hiring process to include:
1 - Filling in the application form once you click “Apply”
2 - Being invited to record a short video to introduce yourself
3 - Completing test tasks, if short-listed
4 - Attending video interviews where you will have the opportunity to talk more about your previous experience and the new role
Applications are only accepted through JobRack. Proxyrack has specifically requested that you do not contact them directly. If you have any questions please contact us using support@jobrack.eu
To make sure you receive updates on your application please add recruitment@jobrack.eu to your email address book.

Got questions about working remotely? Check out JobRack’s FAQ for answers to everything you might want to know. https://jobrack.eu/jobseeker-faq Show more

12 months + 12 month option / Fed Gov
Current WFH directive 3 days in office 2 days at home - subject to change
Australian Citizenship is a requirement

The Opportunity:
The Enterprise Data Warehouse Engineer will lead a project stream of the Client's Datawarehouse platform. This includes updating data development documentation, providing technical guidance to developers and reviewing/approving data designs and data models.
The role will focus on collaborating with key business areas in the development and implementation of consumable reports and analytics to address key risks and emerging trends within these areas.
Key Responsibilities:
Provide technical leadership to the project delivery team through design reviews, advising on implementation best practices, defining and refining release process and technical workshops.
Review and refine the data delivery framework in order to enhance integration of new sources, performance of existing data delivery and rapid development of new subject areas.
Set peer review and data modelling, development and release standards.
Own the technical implementation of new data from analysis to delivery (designing and delivering data dictionary, defining the release steps, defining best practices of data modelling and review steps).
Development and maintenance of SQL analytical and ETL code.
Optimisation and tuning of SQL code to ensure optimal performance.
Development and maintenance of system documentation.
Work within a state of the art, greenfields dev ops environment.
Collaboration with data consumers, database development, testers and IT support teams.

Key Skills:
Technical leadership/ data governance
Data modelling and peer review
Expertise in SQL
Knowledge of metadata/model driven frameworks
Experience working in an Agile environment
Experience reverse engineering end user SQL code

Eligibility:
Must be an Australian citizen

Apply now.
For more information please speak with Iain 0262010100 or our Consultants on 0262010100 or 0386139999. 12 months + 12 month option / Fed Gov

This job can be based in; Sydney, Brisbane or Melbourne!

About Us

The Dubber AI Centre of Excellence has a vision to Transform Conversations, ultimately allowing busy professionals to have better, more productive meetings.

Dubber is the world's leading Unified Call Recording and Voice AI platform. Built to scale to meet any need, Dubber allows businesses and government to unlock the insights in calls, videos and messages. This is empowered by innovative speech and language technology, enabling solutions that increase productivity and ensure compliance.

Dubber is listed on the ASX (DUB) with offices in Brisbane, Melbourne, Sydney, London, Oxford, Atlanta and Dallas.

We're searching for talented team members who can help us achieve our vision.

Who You'll Be Working With

The Dubber AI Centre of Excellence consists of software, machine learning and signal processing engineers. We work in close coordination with product managers, designers and engineering teams across Dubber to deliver innovative technologies through our AI Platform to transform captured conversations into business value.

The Opportunity

To support growth of our Dubber AI Centre of Excellence we are seeking a Software Engineer to join our AI Platform Delivery team, building and maintaining a platform to deploy configurable pipelines of batch and streaming AI algorithms at scale.

About You

We are looking for a motivated, passionate individual, excited about solving complex problems and driven to make our customers smile.

The ideal candidate has several years experience working in software development focussed on deploying scalable workflows of containerised microservices processing streaming or batch data sources. Familiarity working with streaming audio and video data is desirable. You will also be capable of addressing practical considerations to deploy new AI algorithms such as resiliency, efficiency, latency, memory and processing load. In particular, you will be involved with building new streaming services to conduct AI processing at low latency to end users.

We are looking for someone who is constantly curious, motivated to see problems through to solutions, and invested in staying up to date with the latest advancements in the field. While we would prefer candidates who can be available to work in our Brisbane, Melbourne or Sydney office, we are open to consider remote work arrangements for the right person.

Essential

Bachelors in Computer Science, Telecommunications, Engineering or Mathematics preferable.
3-5+ years relevant work experience.
Strong experience with Golang and Python is desirable.
Good understanding of software design patterns.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
Excellence in technical communication with peers and non-technical cohorts.
Strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.
Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment.

Not essential, but preferred

Experience building scalable microservices
Dev/ML Ops familiarity
Experience with CircleCi, K8s and Docker
Familiarity with Audio/Video streaming protocols such as WebRTC
Familiarity with Elixir

Why Dubber?

Dubber offers a competitive salary and share options with work from home and office flexibility. We are one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in the world with learning and growth opportunities every step of the way.

With offices across the world, our employees don't just join a local but global team! Inclusion is important to us, and we like to keep things fun, so we run Friday Drinks, BBQ's, Team Lunches and more. Check out our website to see why our team love being Dubsters.

Next steps

We will be reviewing applications as they come in so don't wait to apply, and please reach out to recruit@dubber.net for a confidential chat or if you have any questions. This job can be based in; Sydney, Brisbane or Melbourne!

Dubber is the world's leading Unified Call Recording and Voice AI platform. Built to scale to meet any need, Dubber allows businesses and government to unlock the insights in calls, videos and messages. This is empowered by innovative speech and language technology, enabling solutions that increase productivity and ensure compliance.

Dubber is listed on the ASX (DUB) with offices in Brisbane, Melbourne, Sydney, London, Oxford, Atlanta and Dallas.

We're searching for talented team members who can help us achieve our vision.

Who You'll Be Working With

The Dubber AI Centre of Excellence consists of software, machine learning and signal processing engineers. We work in close coordination with product managers, designers and engineering teams across Dubber to deliver innovative technologies through our AI Platform to transform captured conversations into business value.

The Opportunity

To support growth of our Dubber AI Centre of Excellence we are seeking a Software Engineer to join our AI Platform Delivery team, building and maintaining a platform to deploy configurable pipelines of batch and streaming AI algorithms at scale.

About You

We are looking for a motivated, passionate individual, excited about solving complex problems and driven to make our customers smile.

The ideal candidate has several years experience working in software development focussed on deploying scalable workflows of containerised microservices processing streaming or batch data sources. Familiarity working with streaming audio and video data is desirable. You will also be capable of addressing practical considerations to deploy new AI algorithms such as resiliency, efficiency, latency, memory and processing load. In particular, you will be involved with building new streaming services to conduct AI processing at low latency to end users.

We are looking for someone who is constantly curious, motivated to see problems through to solutions, and invested in staying up to date with the latest advancements in the field. While we would prefer candidates who can be available to work in our Brisbane, Melbourne or Sydney office, we are open to consider remote work arrangements for the right person.

Essential

Bachelors in Computer Science, Telecommunications, Engineering or Mathematics preferable.
3-5+ years relevant work experience.
Strong experience with Golang and Python is desirable.
Good understanding of software design patterns.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
Excellence in technical communication with peers and non-technical cohorts.
Strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.
Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment.

Not essential, but preferred

Experience building scalable microservices
Dev/ML Ops familiarity
Experience with CircleCi, K8s and Docker
Familiarity with Audio/Video streaming protocols such as WebRTC
Familiarity with Elixir

Why Dubber?

Dubber offers a competitive salary and share options with work from home and office flexibility. We are one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in the world with learning and growth opportunities every step of the way.

With offices across the world, our employees don't just join a local but global team! Inclusion is important to us, and we like to keep things fun, so we run Friday Drinks, BBQ's, Team Lunches and more. Check out our website to see why our team love being Dubsters.

Next steps

We will be reviewing applications as they come in so don't wait to apply, and please reach out to recruit@dubber.net for a confidential chat or if you have any questions. This job can be based in; Sydney, Brisbane or Melbourne!

Utilise your 2-3+ years as PO to lead and drive a talented technical team
Permanent and long term contract working options available
Can be based anywhere in Australia
Our customer requires a proven Product Owner with min 1-2 years experience performing such a role. Its vital you have a solid technical understanding to be able to liaise between the tech team and SMEs (and vice versa). Role reports to the Portfolio Manager.

This is a critical role working on a critical product.
Not only is it vital to the success of the business but the effective operation of this product is saving Australian lives every single week!

The client is open to offering a 12 month contract or permanent full time opportunity depending on each candidate's fit. This role can be based anywhere in Australia (remote / WFH / Sydney, Melbourne/ Brisbane / Adelaide Etc) however Melbourne based candidates will have the option of working from fantastic newly rennovated offices in the inner east.

This role will define your career and enable you to leave a professional legacy that will continue to be felt over the next 10-20 years.

A full PD is available on application.

Purpose
To provide fast, local content decisions on behalf of the Agile team, providing the business value and context and ensuring this is met in the delivery. Responsible for deﬁning stories and prioritising the team backlog to streamline the execution of Program and Agile Release Train priorities as a core member of the extended Product Management team.

Team Backlog & Iteration Execution
Elaborate User Stories for implementation either before, during iteration planning or during the iteration ensuring alignment with Features and the Agile Release Train
Own and maintain the team backlog, including stories, enablers and defects
Program Increment Planning & Execution
Participate in program backlog refinement and preparation for PI planning event, contributing to the program vision, roadmap, Features and drafting the team specific objectives for the upcoming PI as a member of the extended Product Management team
People Leadership
Ensure effective people management of team members including:
Work collaboratively with the product portfolio teams to create an environment that supports and enables high performing teams.


Skills & Experience
Required
Experience with Agile methodologies
Demonstratable experience as a Product Owner within an Agile and/or /SAFe context
Relevant Tertiary qualifications / IT related professional qualifications and / or proven IT people and technical leadership capability.
Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills
Backlog Management experience
Strong and proven people leadership skills to coach, mentor and engage teams
Excellent communication skills (oral and written) with ability to express complex ideas clearly
Desired
Experience with the SAFe methodology.
SAFe Product Owner/Product Manager Certified
Experience with Lean and User-Centred Design methodologies
Experience with Cloud based technologies such as Azure
Experience with Azure Dev Ops
Exposure to the Health / eHealth Industry
