Be part of a world class team in Sydney
Flexible working arrangements
Permanent Role
As Australia’s oldest company and first bank we are focussed on delivering our customers with next generation products and services. Cash & Transactional Banking Technology leads core banking technology for the Group. Incorporating development, change and integration of Deposits platforms into Banking & Digital channels, and partnering Business in technology strategy and change.
How will I help?
Key Responsibilities of Senior Infrastructure Engineer include but not limited to:
Familiarise themselves with full RHEL Estate, across One Bank Midrange, including IBM, OPC, Cloud, Legacy environments.
SME to be point of contact for all RHEL systems for customers, infra teams and vendors.
Take ownership and engage to correct teams where required and drive to resolution.
Providing guidance and support to all supporting run partners for RHEL Estate.
Produce detailed analysis helping the run partner improve.
Document processes\procedures and standards for the run partner to adhere to.
Review others’ system designs to ensure selection of appropriate technology, efficient use of resources, and integration of multiple systems and technology.
Ensure that the system design balances functional, service quality, security, and systems management requirements.
Maintains awareness of opportunities provided by new technology to address challenges or to enable new ways of working. Contribute to briefings and presentations about their relevance and potential value to the organisation.
Contribution to project delivery as per customer engagement. Producing detailed component specifications and translate these into detailed designs for implementation using selected products:
Within a business change programme, assists in the preparation of technical plans and cooperates with business assurance and project staff to ensure that appropriate technical resources are made available.
Provides advice on technical aspects of system development and integration (including requests for changes, deviations from specifications, etc.) and ensures that relevant technical strategies, policies, standards, and practices (including security) are applied correctly
Proactively upskilling and identifying emerging technologies which could be adopted into Westpac Automation and enhance our BAU automation or stability of our RHEL systems.
What’s in it for me?
You’ll play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years and be instrumental in achieving our purpose of helping Australians and New Zealanders succeed. So, we’ll back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You’ll also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need?
Engineering level experience in deploying and supporting RHEL servers, OPEN LDAP, AD, backup, and virtualised technology in a large and complex environment (Westpac RHEL environment).
Strong RHEL analytical & troubleshooting skillset.
Deep understanding of Group Policy and OPEN LDAP authentication
Strong knowledge of VMware and Cloud hosting technologies from a support and diagnosis perspective
Expert knowledge of RHEL roles and feature operability: Veritas Clustering, DNS, Centreon, Redhat Satellite etc.
Deep technical troubleshooting of system failures and application awareness
Understanding of Splunk and APP Dynamics tool set
Deep understanding of RHEL Pattern including support systems and toolsets
Ability to decipher and assess logging and diagnostic information to identify patterns
Heightened knowledge of network model (OSI) and troubleshooting skills
Advanced experience with Chef/Ansible scripting for server administration\automation.
Working closely with Information Security to manage and monitor security patching for servers, endpoint security, and OS hardening - clear understanding of ciphers applicable to the RHEL estate.
Operationalise new systems or technologies that fall under RHEL L3 responsibility
RHEL Level 3 team are required to understand how the automation pipeline works so we can support it.
Working knowledge of dev-ops toolsets: Chef Automate, Artifactory, Bitbucket, AWX(Ansible Tower), Jenkins pipelines, etc
Identifying Automation opportunities across our RHEL Estate and work with Automation and X-Files team to implement as required
Maintains an in-depth knowledge of specific specialisms and provides expert advice regarding their application.
Can supervise specialist consultancy. The specialism can be any aspect of information or communication technology, technique, method, and product or application area.
What’s it like to work there?
As well as good pay and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you’ll get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We’ll even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion
How do I Apply?
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
Our people are our highest priority, and we are committed to placing our redeployees in available roles before we review other applicants.
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy , and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy. Be part of a world class team in Sydney

Our people are our highest priority, and we are committed to placing our redeployees in available roles before we review other applicants.
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy , and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy. Be part of a world class team in Sydney
Flexible working arrangements
Permanent Role
As Australia’s oldest company and first bank we are focussed on delivering our customers with next generation products and services. Cash & Transactional Banking Technology leads core banking technology for the Group. Incorporating development, change and integration of Deposits platforms into Banking & Digital channels, and partnering Business in technology strategy and change.
How will I help?
Key Responsibilities of Senior Infrastructure Engineer include but not limited to:
Familiarise themselves with full RHEL Estate, across One Bank Midrange, including IBM, OPC, Cloud, Legacy environments.
SME to be point of contact for all RHEL systems for customers, infra teams and vendors.
Take ownership and engage to correct teams where required and drive to resolution.
Providing guidance and support to all supporting run partners for RHEL Estate.
Produce detailed analysis helping the run partner improve.
Document processes\procedures and standards for the run partner to adhere to.
Review others’ system designs to ensure selection of appropriate technology, efficient use of resources, and integration of multiple systems and technology.
Ensure that the system design balances functional, service quality, security, and systems management requirements.
Maintains awareness of opportunities provided by new technology to address challenges or to enable new ways of working. Contribute to briefings and presentations about their relevance and potential value to the organisation.
Contribution to project delivery as per customer engagement. Producing detailed component specifications and translate these into detailed designs for implementation using selected products:
Within a business change programme, assists in the preparation of technical plans and cooperates with business assurance and project staff to ensure that appropriate technical resources are made available.
Provides advice on technical aspects of system development and integration (including requests for changes, deviations from specifications, etc.) and ensures that relevant technical strategies, policies, standards, and practices (including security) are applied correctly
Proactively upskilling and identifying emerging technologies which could be adopted into Westpac Automation and enhance our BAU automation or stability of our RHEL systems.
What’s in it for me?
You’ll play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years and be instrumental in achieving our purpose of helping Australians and New Zealanders succeed. So, we’ll back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You’ll also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need?
Engineering level experience in deploying and supporting RHEL servers, OPEN LDAP, AD, backup, and virtualised technology in a large and complex environment (Westpac RHEL environment).
Strong RHEL analytical & troubleshooting skillset.
Deep understanding of Group Policy and OPEN LDAP authentication
Strong knowledge of VMware and Cloud hosting technologies from a support and diagnosis perspective
Expert knowledge of RHEL roles and feature operability: Veritas Clustering, DNS, Centreon, Redhat Satellite etc.
Deep technical troubleshooting of system failures and application awareness
Understanding of Splunk and APP Dynamics tool set
Deep understanding of RHEL Pattern including support systems and toolsets
Ability to decipher and assess logging and diagnostic information to identify patterns
Heightened knowledge of network model (OSI) and troubleshooting skills
Advanced experience with Chef/Ansible scripting for server administration\automation.
Working closely with Information Security to manage and monitor security patching for servers, endpoint security, and OS hardening - clear understanding of ciphers applicable to the RHEL estate.
Operationalise new systems or technologies that fall under RHEL L3 responsibility
RHEL Level 3 team are required to understand how the automation pipeline works so we can support it.
Working knowledge of dev-ops toolsets: Chef Automate, Artifactory, Bitbucket, AWX(Ansible Tower), Jenkins pipelines, etc
Identifying Automation opportunities across our RHEL Estate and work with Automation and X-Files team to implement as required
Maintains an in-depth knowledge of specific specialisms and provides expert advice regarding their application.
Can supervise specialist consultancy. The specialism can be any aspect of information or communication technology, technique, method, and product or application area.
What’s it like to work there?
As well as good pay and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you’ll get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We’ll even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion
How do I Apply?
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
Our people are our highest priority, and we are committed to placing our redeployees in available roles before we review other applicants.
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy , and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy. Show more

A global mining giant is seeking an experienced Azure Solution Architect for an initial 12 month contract possessing experience in Dev Ops, Python, C# and Azure Containers. The ideal candidate has come from a full stack development background that has progressed into architecture.


Responsibilities include:
Full stack application architecture with some coding
Produce, review and manage architectural documentation based on business / project requirements
Ensure the application architecture design and integration is in alignment the client's enterprise architecture and Government standards
Ensure all architecture artefacts and designs are presented
Key skills:
Experience in using Microsoft products including Azure App Service, Azure Containers, Azure Cache, Power BI, Azure DevOps & ArchiMate
Coding experience with Python OR C# required
DevOps and Azure Containers
Experience with full-stack application architecture
Excellent ability to design and implement solutions and models
Superior skills to examine and identify application structural necessities by evaluating client operations, applications, and programming
Skilled in preparing accurate design and architecture solutions
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement
Agile methodology delivery experience
Desirable:
Experience in working with Simulation and Optimisation capabilities highly regarded
Mining Experience highly desirable
If you are interested and have the required experience, please apply now via the link below to be considered.

job_title: Software Development Engineer, Information Security - Automation and Orchestration
listing_jobDesc:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, related field or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of experience designing, building, deploying, operating, scaling and evolving distributed systems and high-volume transaction applications in a 24/7 dev ops environment.
5+ years of industry experience in software development with Java, C#, or other similar object-oriented language.
Experience with software development methodologies like Kanban, SCRUM, or Scrumban.
Ability to communicate and interpret requirements documented via user stories or technical specs.
Experience with full stack development teams, owning APIs, UIs, and data stores. Operating software in data centers or cloud environments.

Job summary
Amazon’s Information Security is looking for Software Development Engineers who are passionate about building scaled software supporting the high-tempo needs of security operations at Amazon.
Threat intelligence, detection, monitoring, hunting, and response. Forensics, malware, security analysis and machine learning. If these concepts interest you – read on!

As the ideal candidate for this role, you will:

Have experience in shipping software designs and partnering with systems engineers, development engineers and technical program managers.
Demonstrate great passion for customers, agility and adaptability in the face of fast changing business requirements and innovation.
Take an active part in leading the design, development and operations of software/tooling used to keep Amazon’s customers safe.
Ship software in a fast-paced environment and collaborate on new approaches to building and serving Amazon’s security.

Our systems/products are critical path and used by security engineers daily in their quest to defend Amazon and its customers against internal and external threats. The role reports to a Software Development Manager located in Seattle, USA with a geographically distributed team across Seattle and Sydney.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
For up to date news covering diversity and inclusion, sustainability and community engagement, please visit: https://www.aboutamazon.com.au/

About the team
Our tech team operates out of our fabulous Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane offices, and from home (during COVID-19) leveraging technology.
We support flexible working options blending at home and in office.
Amazon offers great benefits including a competitive compensation and stock plan. We also look after our people with benefits including: subsidized private health and life insurance, commuter benefits and even an Amazon discount.


Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases.
Understanding of DevOps and operational support of software in production; build tolls and CI/CD.
Experience with Amazon Web Services tech stack is a plus. Working knowledge of core AWS products [S3, Lambda, Dynamo, RDS, ELBs, Route53 etc.]
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to partner with engineers, program managers, and customers.
Ability to think outside of the box, innovating and driving product vision for the space, focusing on goals and needs of end customers.
Ability to deal with high degree of ambiguous/undefined set problems; ability to think abstractly and big, solutioning on your feet.
Strong, object-oriented design and coding skills. Knowledge scripting languages a plus.
Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field or equivalent work experience is a plus.

Acknowledgement of country:
In the spirit of reconciliation Amazon acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.

Greater Adelaide Area (Hybrid)
Information & Communication Technology Developers / Programmers
Are you a data engineer, analyst or mechanical engineer with a passion for problem solving with data? At MaxMine we are developing a new data collection and analytics platform to improve open pit mining operations across the globe. We solve real problems with innovative and tangible solutions that actually stick.
With so much hype in our space, and a solution that delivers real value, our clients can’t get enough of our services, and we need more help to continue delivery and grow our offering.
About Us
Mining operations deal in massive scale operational problems. They ‘lift and shift’ millions of tonnes of material and consume hundreds of millions of dollars per year in operating expenses. A 1% improvement across load and haul fleets can add literally millions to their bottom lines. We are delivering these improvements to our clients across Africa and Australia.
MaxMine is an automated business improvement product which performs advanced analytics and data science on truck operational data to deliver significant cost savings and productivity gains to global miners. We apply engineering science and mathematics to operational data that we collect with our hardware. We store and analyse this data via our cloud platform and deliver results straight into client’s operations.
Our approach is the future of Professional Consulting Services, and everything that we do, and how we do it reflects this. We are a value focused tech company, which happens to work across Operational and Engineering domains in the Mining Services industry. With a growing client base and rapid expansion of services, analytics and operations we have a range of interesting projects which will have an impact.
About You
You probably don’t fit many roles… Too much software for an “engineer”, too much engineer for a software developer. We are looking for people that are keen analysts with a flair for programming and development. Are you keen to solve challenging problems on big operational datasets? Not afraid to get your hands dirty in order to deliver a big outcome for clients.
You are a curious person and a problem solver.
You love exploring large datasets, and understand that there is more than one solution to every problem
You tell stories with data
You can convey insights simply and effectively to people of all walks of life.
You like to solve problems once, so that they stay solved.
Other stuff
We have an immediate need for a senior data engineer / analyst / scientist or data savvy engineer to contribute to our engineering analysis team. We are currently seeking expressions of interest from current candidates who have:
A Degree in Engineering or Computer Science degree or similar experience
3-7 years of experience performing data analysis of any sort
Solved real world problems developing algorithms and software
Are ideally proficient with an Object Oriented language such as Python, C#, Java
Attention to detail and following through on solving client’s actual problems
Some exposure to client liaison functions would be highly desirable
A commercial mindset, focused on value for our clients and value for our business
Our Technology
We work with a range of technologies across the full spectrum of dev-ops and data-science. Our platform is based on;
Snowflake, DBT, PowerBI, python, bokeh

You don’t need to know all of the above, but need to be willing and able to learn. There is also scope to bring new technologies to our platform team where they fit within our existing technology and can demonstrate business value.
Our Values
Our team’s cohesion and success draws from a culture of shared values. We are looking for someone who identifies with all of the following to ensure they are a good fit for the company and vice versa.
Customer – We play the long game, as one team
Impact – We move the needle for our customers, people & environment
Ubuntu – We believe ‘I am because we are’
Finishing – We celebrate when things are done
Excellence – We take pride in our work. Quality output with a sense of urgency
Playful spirit – We have a good laugh
What We Offer
Lots of chances to learn and grow – you’ll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the city, part of a culture which values sharing knowledge every day
A competitive compensation package
A chance to join a rapidly scaling start-up
The opportunity to shape your role, our team and our product Greater Adelaide Area (Hybrid)

Genpact is a professional services firm that creates lasting, impactful transformation. With a startup spirit and 90,000+ curious and courageous minds, we have the expertise to go deep with the world’s biggest brands—and we have fun doing it.
We build solutions that demonstrate outstanding design for our clients and their customers. This is your opportunity to be part of a team that is building a positive impact on the world by crafting solutions that people love and making a difference in people’s lives.
Inviting applications for the role of DevOps Engineer:
In this role you will follow the team’s standards to create and manage an automated DevOps release management pipeline which delivers tooling for next generation application development efforts (the Dev) and on-going production operations (the Ops).
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with DevOps Engineers and Cloud Architect to support development teams with a full set of DevOps ALM tools by leading the establishment of the right tooling and processes that will result in a fully automated release management pipeline to include: the automated build process, environment setups, testing scripts, deployments, and production operational metrics/debugging information (to target developers).
Partner with development and operations teams to facilitate practical automation solutions and custom modules. Troubleshoot automation issues and wen required engage the resources to find practical solutions that move projects forward in a timely manner.
Be a trusted automation and tooling advisor for DevOps initiatives by providing objective, practical and relevant ideas, insights and advice.
Deliver tasks based on project objectives; technically support projects through to completion. Ensure deliverables are completed within target timeframes and are consistently of high-quality, documented and support transition of operational activities
Collect and format the data required for established KPIs to ensure performance is measured against expected business outcomes.
Cultivate a Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery mindset.
Qualifications:
Significant AWS DevOps cloud infrastructure technical expertise is essential
Experience deploying and managing Big Data solutions (Hadoop clusters, ETL processing, etc) and data integration (i.e. moving data from a data warehouse to another system)
Programming background, having designed and implemented CI/CD pipelines
Experience automating across all areas of the value chain into production environments
Ability to deliver high quality engineering practices and guidance to team members
Experience working in a bank or financial institution is preferred
Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Genpact through our direct sourcing partner, the Ian Martin Group, who manages Genpact’s Contractor Talent Community. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by Ian Martin and will not be an employee of Genpact.
Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. For more information, visit https://www.genpact.com/careers Genpact is a professional services firm that creates lasting, impactful transformation. With a startup spirit and 90,000+ curious and courageous minds, we have the expertise to go deep with the world’s biggest brands—and we have fun doing it.
We build solutions that demonstrate outstanding design for our clients and their customers. This is your opportunity to be part of a team that is building a positive impact on the world by crafting solutions that people love and making a difference in people’s lives.
Inviting applications for the role of DevOps Engineer:
In this role you will follow the team’s standards to create and manage an automated DevOps release management pipeline which delivers tooling for next generation application development efforts (the Dev) and on-going production operations (the Ops).
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with DevOps Engineers and Cloud Architect to support development teams with a full set of DevOps ALM tools by leading the establishment of the right tooling and processes that will result in a fully automated release management pipeline to include: the automated build process, environment setups, testing scripts, deployments, and production operational metrics/debugging information (to target developers).
Partner with development and operations teams to facilitate practical automation solutions and custom modules. Troubleshoot automation issues and wen required engage the resources to find practical solutions that move projects forward in a timely manner.
Be a trusted automation and tooling advisor for DevOps initiatives by providing objective, practical and relevant ideas, insights and advice.
Deliver tasks based on project objectives; technically support projects through to completion. Ensure deliverables are completed within target timeframes and are consistently of high-quality, documented and support transition of operational activities
Collect and format the data required for established KPIs to ensure performance is measured against expected business outcomes.
Cultivate a Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery mindset.
Qualifications:
Significant AWS DevOps cloud infrastructure technical expertise is essential
Experience deploying and managing Big Data solutions (Hadoop clusters, ETL processing, etc) and data integration (i.e. moving data from a data warehouse to another system)
Programming background, having designed and implemented CI/CD pipelines
Experience automating across all areas of the value chain into production environments
Ability to deliver high quality engineering practices and guidance to team members
Experience working in a bank or financial institution is preferred
Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Genpact through our direct sourcing partner, the Ian Martin Group, who manages Genpact’s Contractor Talent Community. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by Ian Martin and will not be an employee of Genpact.
Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. With a startup spirit and 90,000+ curious and courageous minds, we have the expertise to go deep with the world’s biggest brands—and we have fun doing it.

job_title: Senior Test Analyst - Customer Contact Virtualisation
listing_jobDesc:
Initial 6 months contract + Extensions
Large Re-Platforming Project
Flexible Work Environment
Our client is looking for a Senior Test Analyst for an initial 6 month contract. You will be part of a re-platforming project to Microsoft Dynamic, where data is collected from multiple sources and scheduled (MS Dynamics) for processing in the appropriate system.

Responsibilities will include:
Providing Testing services
Test Lead for the project
Manage multiple test phases (SIT and UAT)
Coordinate testing Business SME's end users etc
Reporting to ELT level
Essential Skills and Experience:

At least 5 years' experience in a Test Analyst role
ISTQB Advanced Test Analyst or equivalent certification
Test methodologies: CD/CI (Dev Ops), Agile, Iterative, Scrum
Proficient in HPALM application, both execution and defect management
Effective communications skills and the ability to develop working relationships with staff and managers at all levels
IVR
Familiar with Contact Centre Cloud Platforms, preferably Nice CXOne
Microsoft Dynamics
Ability to work effectively without constant supervision
Proven ability to develop system and regression test scripts and co-ordinate the testing
Good problem-solving skills.
At least 5 years' experience in a Senior Test role
For more info contact Aparna @ aparna.sharma@peoplebank.com.au Initial 6 months contract + Extensions

#LI-NS1

About Datadog:

Datadog is a best-in-class SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. Built by engineers, for engineers, our monitoring and security platform is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries to enable digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers' entire technology stack. We're dedicated to creating, developing, and supporting our product and customers, allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops, and Security teams globally. Come join the team for an exciting opportunity to learn from top-level leaders and colleagues and grow alongside the company as we rapidly expand.


The Team:

We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The technical solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through demos, presentations, technical evaluations, and ongoing support. Technical solutions is a growing global team that collaborates constantly to share knowledge and continuously advance our technical skillset.


The Opportunity:

Sales engineers help qualify and close opportunities with customers and partners. You will provide technical expertise through sales presentations, product demonstrations, and supporting technical evaluations (POVs). SEs also have a voice with the product team to help prioritize features based on input from customers, competitors, and partners.


You Will:

Partner with the Sales Team to articulate the overall Datadog value proposition, vision and strategy to customers
Own technical engagement with customers during the trial phase. Communicate Datadog's value based on activities and work with customers on any identified issues or concerns to successful conclusion
Technically close complex opportunities through advanced competitive knowledge, technical skill, and credibility
Deliver product and technical briefings / presentations to potential clients
Maintain accurate notes and feedback in CRM regarding customer input both wins and losses
Proactively engage and communicate with customers and Datadog business/technical teams regarding product feedback and competitive landscape


You Are:

Passionate about educating customers on observability risks that are meaningful to their business
Able to build and execute an evaluation plan with a customer
Exceptional at written and oral communication skills. This role requires an ability to understand and articulate both the business benefits (value proposition) and technical advantages of our offering
Able to think creatively about a wide variety of challenges. You're going to find new things every day
Experienced in programming/scripting with any of the following: Java, Python, Ruby, Go, Node.JS, PHP, and .NET etc.
Someone with a minimum of 3 years in a Sales engineering or DevOps engineering role.
Able to sit up to 4 hours, traveling to and from client sites
Able to travel via auto, train or air up to 20% of the time


Bonus Points:

Previous experience selling into public sector
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher, Mesos or other container technologies.
Experience in systems administration: Windows, Linux
Strong knowledge of current infrastructure and monitoring solutions and technologies.


Why You Should Apply:

Generous and competitive global benefits
New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan
Continuous career development and pathing opportunities
Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space
Best in breed onboarding
Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally
Friendly and inclusive workplace culture

#LI-RD1

Equal Opportunity at Datadog:

Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.


Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog's Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice. #LI-NS1

Nova Systems Geospatial is a multidisciplinary team of Software Developers, Designers, DevOps Specialists and Geospatial Consultants with a proven track record of building and supplying innovative, high value enterprise spatially enabled software and data solutions. The Geospatial team leads the development of software and geospatial solutions and the provision of geospatial products at Nova Systems. Our services are a significant part of Nova’s broad range of professional services across Defence, Essential Services, Land Management, Government, Utilities, Energy and Resources.

We are flexible in the way we work, and receptive to improving process and ways of bringing new ideas to life through innovation. We challenge convention when it is in the interest of our customers and actively seek employees that think the same way. Our success is built on collaboration, so you can expect to work closely with your colleagues and customers in our mission to build and deliver high value solutions.

We pride ourselves on transparency, compassion for our people and building a safe, fun, and inclusive environment where everyone has the freedom to be their full self. Just to seal the deal, you'll get heaps of flexibility on how you work and be part of a culture where you can contribute and succeed.

About the role:

As a Software Engineer in our Geospatial Solutions team, you will have the opportunity to lead the design and development of a variety of exciting software projects, including web and geospatial applications, backend data processing and analytics frameworks, cloud dev-ops platforms, and mobile applications. You can expect to engage with a range of clients across a number of industry sectors including emergency services, land management and defence.

Please note: Some of the projects and clients we work on require an AGSVA Security Clearance, if this is required, we will discuss with you during your application process. You must be an Australian Citizen to achieve this type of clearance.
What will you be involved in:
Code development for UIs, API’s, back-end components, and data ETL processes for solutions deployed to web, desktop, and cloud environments
Supporting technical requirements elaboration and creation of user stories and acceptance criteria
Developing automated unit and integration tests
Working under Agile (scrum) development and release processes in a team environment
Contributing to the preparation of technical documentation and software architecture documents
Engaging with clients and stakeholders to demonstrate work in progress and receive feedback
Supporting technical pre-sales activities, estimation of services work and technical input into business development and bid activities
Sharing knowledge and mentoring junior staff to develop and improve the Nova Systems software development capability
Contribute to initiatives to standardize our software development approach
What we would like from you:
Strong software development and coding skills using modern languages (e.g. Javascript, .NET), frameworks (e.g. AngularJS) and database technologies (RDBMS, NoSQL)
Experience in the practical application of the Agile development methodology through requirements analysis, backlog management, sprint planning, testing, and release
Experience using scripting languages (such as Python) to customise applications and automate processes
Working knowledge of the deployment of custom software solutions to cloud infrastructure
Strong interpersonal skills (proactive, consultative, and professional approach)
Able to analyse and understand complex processes and information workflows
Comfortable using configuration management tools and testing frameworks
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment and customer facing role
Desirable requirements:
Experience with commercial or Open-Source geospatial platforms such as ESRI, FME, Mapbox, Geoserver, Leaflet, or Google
Knowledge of devops and contemporary cloud automation processes and tools (such as serverless, CI/CI pipelines, infrastructure as code)
Certification in relevant standards and software, such as the Scrum process and AWS/Azure accreditation
Typical experience:
A bachelor’s degree in software engineering, information technology, computer science (or equivalent)
4-8 years hands-on experience in a software development consulting environment or internal software development team
Broad general ICT experience across software development, infrastructure, and cloud technologies
Nova’s Value Proposition; Beyond the pay cheque:
In addition to salary, you are supported with:
Flexible working conditions to suit individual needs and dress for your day
Commitment to Professional and Personal Development (up to $5000 per year)
Reward & Recognition Program offering exclusive discounts from hundreds of major retailers, helping you to save on groceries, petrol, holidays and more!
Additional Leave entitlements include Reserve Leave, Loyalty Leave, Parental Leave and Purchased Leave
Wellbeing Hub with access to health and fitness content
Employee Assistance Program for employees and family members
Access to Defence Health and Travel Insurance
Novated Leasing and Salary Sacrifice
Nova Employee Share Offer
An inclusive and supportive culture
A range of other great benefits, just ask us!
To apply, please click on the "apply now" button and submit your resume using the "upload resume" function in PDF Format (only).

Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please call Lily in Nova Talent Acquisition Team on: (08) 8252 7100

Working knowledge of the deployment of custom software solutions to cloud infrastructure
Strong interpersonal skills (proactive, consultative, and professional approach)
Able to analyse and understand complex processes and information workflows
Comfortable using configuration management tools and testing frameworks
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment and customer facing role
Desirable requirements:
Experience with commercial or Open-Source geospatial platforms such as ESRI, FME, Mapbox, Geoserver, Leaflet, or Google
Knowledge of devops and contemporary cloud automation processes and tools (such as serverless, CI/CI pipelines, infrastructure as code)
Certification in relevant standards and software, such as the Scrum process and AWS/Azure accreditation
Typical experience:
A bachelor’s degree in software engineering, information technology, computer science (or equivalent)
4-8 years hands-on experience in a software development consulting environment or internal software development team
Broad general ICT experience across software development, infrastructure, and cloud technologies
Nova’s Value Proposition; Beyond the pay cheque:
In addition to salary, you are supported with:
Flexible working conditions to suit individual needs and dress for your day
Commitment to Professional and Personal Development (up to $5000 per year)

Nova Systems does not accept any recruitment agency solicitations. Nova Systems Geospatial is a multidisciplinary team of Software Developers, Designers, DevOps Specialists and Geospatial Consultants with a proven track record of building and supplying innovative, high value enterprise spatially enabled software and data solutions. The Geospatial team leads the development of software and geospatial solutions and the provision of geospatial products at Nova Systems. Our services are a significant part of Nova’s broad range of professional services across Defence, Essential Services, Land Management, Government, Utilities, Energy and Resources.

We are flexible in the way we work, and receptive to improving process and ways of bringing new ideas to life through innovation. We challenge convention when it is in the interest of our customers and actively seek employees that think the same way. Our success is built on collaboration, so you can expect to work closely with your colleagues and customers in our mission to build and deliver high value solutions.

We pride ourselves on transparency, compassion for our people and building a safe, fun, and inclusive environment where everyone has the freedom to be their full self. Just to seal the deal, you'll get heaps of flexibility on how you work and be part of a culture where you can contribute and succeed.

About the role:

As a Software Engineer in our Geospatial Solutions team, you will have the opportunity to lead the design and development of a variety of exciting software projects, including web and geospatial applications, backend data processing and analytics frameworks, cloud dev-ops platforms, and mobile applications. You can expect to engage with a range of clients across a number of industry sectors including emergency services, land management and defence.

Please note: Some of the projects and clients we work on require an AGSVA Security Clearance, if this is required, we will discuss with you during your application process. You must be an Australian Citizen to achieve this type of clearance.
What will you be involved in:
Code development for UIs, API’s, back-end components, and data ETL processes for solutions deployed to web, desktop, and cloud environments
Supporting technical requirements elaboration and creation of user stories and acceptance criteria
Developing automated unit and integration tests
Working under Agile (scrum) development and release processes in a team environment
Contributing to the preparation of technical documentation and software architecture documents
Engaging with clients and stakeholders to demonstrate work in progress and receive feedback
Supporting technical pre-sales activities, estimation of services work and technical input into business development and bid activities
Sharing knowledge and mentoring junior staff to develop and improve the Nova Systems software development capability
Contribute to initiatives to standardize our software development approach
What we would like from you:
Strong software development and coding skills using modern languages (e.g. Javascript, .NET), frameworks (e.g. AngularJS) and database technologies (RDBMS, NoSQL)
Experience in the practical application of the Agile development methodology through requirements analysis, backlog management, sprint planning, testing, and release
Experience using scripting languages (such as Python) to customise applications and automate processes
Working knowledge of the deployment of custom software solutions to cloud infrastructure
Strong interpersonal skills (proactive, consultative, and professional approach)
Able to analyse and understand complex processes and information workflows
Comfortable using configuration management tools and testing frameworks
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment and customer facing role
Desirable requirements:
Experience with commercial or Open-Source geospatial platforms such as ESRI, FME, Mapbox, Geoserver, Leaflet, or Google
Knowledge of devops and contemporary cloud automation processes and tools (such as serverless, CI/CI pipelines, infrastructure as code)
Certification in relevant standards and software, such as the Scrum process and AWS/Azure accreditation
Typical experience:
A bachelor’s degree in software engineering, information technology, computer science (or equivalent)
4-8 years hands-on experience in a software development consulting environment or internal software development team
Broad general ICT experience across software development, infrastructure, and cloud technologies

Full time, Fixed Term Contract (1 year)
Work-From-Home flexibility
Leading University and ranked in the world's top 100


The Company

Granite Consulting has partnered with one of Australia's leading university to support in hiring Lead Full Stack Developer who will perform hands on development tasks related to capturing, ingesting, storing and processing data associated within the University’s Smart Campus platform and actively participate in the design and development of supporting UI’s aimed at delivering exciting insights and a world class UX to our stakeholders.

The Role

Core Accountabilities:
Full stack development utilising AWS technologies and modern programming languages. e.g. NodeJS, Python.
Design, deploy and optimise data ingestion pipelines, architectures and data sets including IoT sensor data.
Design, deploy and optimise data integration pipelines, supporting real-time data analytics, ETL, data modelling and SQL-based queries.
Develop integration pipelines between the University’s Enterprise applications and the Smart Campus platform.
Develop supporting web-based user interfaces (browser & mobile) using standard frameworks such as ReactJS.
Provide technical leadership to other Smart Campus developers and analysts


Selection Criteria:
Education/Qualifications
The appointee will have relevant tertiary qualifications in Electrical / Computer / Mechatronic Engineering or Computer Science or related field with extensive industry experience.
Knowledge and skills:
Demonstrate Business Services values by acting in the best interest of your employer; displaying service excellence by striving to deliver beyond expectations and taking ownership of the delivery; and value working collaboratively, connecting with people and building relationships in your workplace.
Extensive experience and knowledge of using the AWS cloud platform in an enterprise environment to deliver world class services and capabilities.
Extensive development experience in the AWS technologies with strong focus on big data & Dev Ops related technologies, including:
AWS Kinesis Data Streams & Analytics
AWS Cloud Formation
AWS Lambda
AWS Cloud Formation
AWS Redshift, Athena & Quick sight
AWS Landing Zone
AWS S3 & DynamoDB
AWS IoT (Nice to have)
Coding proficiency in the modern programming languages - Node JS (must have), Python (nice to have).
Strong background in data integration – real-time data analytics, ETL, data modelling and SQL skills.
Proven experience in developing asynchronous designs.

Keen to hear more? Click 'Apply Now' with your latest resume!
Email on renu.khandelwal@graniteconsulting.com.au

Come and lead our platform software engineering team, and be the multiplying force. You will still be doing the techie coding stuff too.

Let’s talk about the role

Focussing on solving cross-cutting problems for the organization and other engineering teams, they are a creative cohesive group of highly intelligent engineers. They need a hands-on technical lead who’s excited to mentor them to the next level of platform solution engineering.

Even though you’ll be leading a small team – don’t worry you’re still going to be a lead coder too (teaching by example)
Uplift the design and build capability using evolutionary architecture and modern engineering practices
Love engaging senior leaders, bringing people on a journey, and influencing decisions
Crucially you’ll be evolving our development toolkit:
Golang, Python, Node.js, Java
TDD, paired programming
AWS ECS, Kubernetes, Lambda & AWS Batch Jobs, Step Functions, Spark
Kinesis, Kafka, SQS, SNS, Firehose
DynamoDB, RDS, S3, Athena
Apigee (API Gateway), AWS Cognito, Okta (Identity Management)
CI/CD (BuildKite & Ansible)

Let’s talk about you!

A polyglot Lead Engineer with commercial experience in AWS, CI/CD, distributed systems, event-driven applications, micro-services, container orchestration, and event-sourcing.

Judgment (bring your knowledge of distributed computing, understanding the trade off’s)
Dev-ops (be an advocate for dev-ops and agile ways of working)
The team focused (experienced people leader of platform software engineers)
Passion (always on the hunt for the next best tech, learn and network through conferences and meetups to understand what others are doing)


Sound like you?

That’s a good sign! In return for your energy and ideas, we offer genuine flexible family life/work balance e.g. adjusted days, hours. Health, well-being, and social initiatives to help you feel well and connected, as well as our hugely popular extra week of leave program.

We always support a safe, healthy, engaging, and productive working environment for all employees and workers, whether that be in your home an office, or a combination of both.

Are you a DevOps engineer looking for a new challenge? We have a great opportunity for a skilled DevOps engineer who appreciates the value of a quality team, has an attention to detail and can roll up sleeves and deliver. This is an important role that needs strong communications, collaboration and team building skills. If you think this role is for you, get in touch with us today.

Company Overview

RoZetta Technology is a world-leading big data and advanced analytics information architecture company, and an advanced AWS Consulting Partner. Our systems provide the bedrock of scalable, robust, and reliable data-focused software platforms. Our projects shift perspectives to provide understanding and purpose to what was once just data. We exist to create value for our customers and to affect positive change in business, industry, economy, and society.

Division

The Development Services division is responsible for creating and implementing targeted and tailored solutions for RoZetta Technology and their customers. This division’s competence extends from full-stack web solutions, API middleware and databases, advanced data visualisation with JavaScript single page applications, and Big Data tool sets such as Spark and Redshift.

Role

As a DevOps Engineer you will focus on cloud/local infrastructure selection and design, platform provisioning and operation during the software development lifecycle, all aspects of build, test and deployment automation. The position shall ensure collaborative working relationship between dev-ops and development teams, resulting in the fast flow of planned work while simultaneously increasing reliability, stability, resilience and security of production environments.

Core Responsibilities
Working with the Architects and Senior Developers to convert high level architectures into deployable and maintainable designs
Automating and scripting the build and maintenance of the infrastructure providing experience in various deployment orchestration and configuration management tools
Contributing to reliable software creation through definition and ownership of software build processes
Acting as a modern System Administrator of cloud based software environments
Developing component software design, coding and testing according to specific work packages and project needs relating to dev ops function (eg deployment automation)
Contributing to the identification and comparison of development, deployment and support processes and tools, and able to lead all aspects of their adoption/implementation
Development of systems and processes that are easy to maintain and support to hand over to the Operations Team
Undertaking assigned integration planning and software building definition tasks
Assisting in the preparation of project proposals
Any other duties deemed necessary
Essential Requirements
Belief and promotion of DevOps philosophy
Good written and oral communications
Good knowledge and experience with Amazon Web Service platforms and all aspects of their management
Demonstrated prior experience with build, deployment and operational aspects of software development practices, having participated in the definition of such activities and imparting strong sense of automation
Experience installing, configuring and maintaining Linux servers and setting directions in technologies and processes
A demonstrated ability to work in a team environment and directly with project managers
Ability to use initiative and think creatively
Excellent problem solving & analytical abilities including debugging & performance improvements
Ability to work independently with initiative and a degree of autonomy, given broad direction
Collaboration skills – ability to adopt and encourage a cooperative approach to all internal and external relationships
Ability and desire to share knowledge amongst members of the team
Understanding of highly available systems operations in a commercial environment
Desirable Requirements
Python development experience
Proven operational experience with Chef/Puppet, Ansible, CloudFormation or similar technologies
Strong understanding of TCP/IP networking and related protocols

If you would like to join our innovative team send your application to:

recruitment@rozettatechnology.com Are you a DevOps engineer looking for a new challenge? We have a great opportunity for a skilled DevOps engineer who appreciates the value of a quality team, has an attention to detail and can roll up sleeves and deliver. This is an important role that needs strong communications, collaboration and team building skills. If you think this role is for you, get in touch with us today.

Company Overview

RoZetta Technology is a world-leading big data and advanced analytics information architecture company, and an advanced AWS Consulting Partner. Our systems provide the bedrock of scalable, robust, and reliable data-focused software platforms. Our projects shift perspectives to provide understanding and purpose to what was once just data. We exist to create value for our customers and to affect positive change in business, industry, economy, and society.

Division

The Development Services division is responsible for creating and implementing targeted and tailored solutions for RoZetta Technology and their customers. This division’s competence extends from full-stack web solutions, API middleware and databases, advanced data visualisation with JavaScript single page applications, and Big Data tool sets such as Spark and Redshift.

Role

As a DevOps Engineer you will focus on cloud/local infrastructure selection and design, platform provisioning and operation during the software development lifecycle, all aspects of build, test and deployment automation. The position shall ensure collaborative working relationship between dev-ops and development teams, resulting in the fast flow of planned work while simultaneously increasing reliability, stability, resilience and security of production environments.

Core Responsibilities
Working with the Architects and Senior Developers to convert high level architectures into deployable and maintainable designs
Automating and scripting the build and maintenance of the infrastructure providing experience in various deployment orchestration and configuration management tools
Contributing to reliable software creation through definition and ownership of software build processes
Acting as a modern System Administrator of cloud based software environments
Developing component software design, coding and testing according to specific work packages and project needs relating to dev ops function (eg deployment automation)
Contributing to the identification and comparison of development, deployment and support processes and tools, and able to lead all aspects of their adoption/implementation
Development of systems and processes that are easy to maintain and support to hand over to the Operations Team
Undertaking assigned integration planning and software building definition tasks
Assisting in the preparation of project proposals
Any other duties deemed necessary
Essential Requirements
Belief and promotion of DevOps philosophy
Good written and oral communications
Good knowledge and experience with Amazon Web Service platforms and all aspects of their management
Demonstrated prior experience with build, deployment and operational aspects of software development practices, having participated in the definition of such activities and imparting strong sense of automation
Experience installing, configuring and maintaining Linux servers and setting directions in technologies and processes
A demonstrated ability to work in a team environment and directly with project managers
Ability to use initiative and think creatively
Excellent problem solving & analytical abilities including debugging & performance improvements
Ability to work independently with initiative and a degree of autonomy, given broad direction
Collaboration skills – ability to adopt and encourage a cooperative approach to all internal and external relationships
Ability and desire to share knowledge amongst members of the team
Understanding of highly available systems operations in a commercial environment
Desirable Requirements
Python development experience
Proven operational experience with Chef/Puppet, Ansible, CloudFormation or similar technologies
Strong understanding of TCP/IP networking and related protocols

If you would like to join our innovative team send your application to:

Making Mobility Seamless
Vix is a global leader in automated fare collection, transit information and transit analytics solutions. Trusted by over 200 city and regional transport authorities around the world, we have been driving change in fare collection for over 35 years.
We offer a genuinely flexible working environment – customer outcomes and commitment to delivery is the focus at Vix. Work from the office, work from home, work from the local café – you’ll be able to manage your personal and professional commitments seamlessly at Vix. In fact, HRD gave Vix the excellence award in 2021 for our MyFlex program.
Our core values are a statement of intent about the type of business we strive to be and describe the way we work and how we interact with each other, our customers and our partners:
#Think like a customer
#Focus on what matters
#Do great things together
#Be smart, stay curious
Find out more about your new workplace here!
We're on the hunt for a motivated, engaged IT Systems Engineer to administer and improve the Vix global infrastructure. With an overarching remit of continuous improvement, you’ll be responsible for all aspects of IT infrastructure. Working within a global team, you’ll manage support escalations across the business, encompassing AWS services, WAN and internal networks, virtualised systems, VPN, telephony and other communication platforms. Beyond the operational focus, you’ll get to contribute to business improvement, be an SME for internal projects, and contextualise your delivery with cost management and enhanced service delivery in mind.
We are a global organisation at Vix - embracing the strength that individual diversity brings to an organisation. Bring your individual orientation, cultural heritage and distinctive thinking – we want to hear from you!
What will you be responsible for?
Operate in a F-T-S (Follow the Sun) escalation/resolution model for IT incidents and service requests, through the IT helpdesk platform, within set SLA’s
Design and implement solutions that adhere to current best practices to best support Vix systems and services
Maintain, administer and monitor all corporate IT infrastructure and systems, including firewalls, intra/inter-site networking connectivity, virtualisation, and AWS VPC/TGs
Administration and governance of enterprise telephony platforms (3CX) over multiple regions
Ensure that all communications infrastructure and supported systems are maintained and monitored appropriately
Participate in optimisation and auditing activities to ensure effective standardisation and configuration of infrastructure environments
Operate within a PCI compliant environment, with strict adherence to ISO27001 and ISO9001 standards
Generation and maintenance of internal records, registers and system documentation
Contribution and delivery of the global Corporate IT strategic plan
What does our ideal candidate look like?
Tertiary qualification in Information Technology, or related discipline
Ability to work independently, and as part of a globally decentralised team
Enthusiastic, customer service minded personality with excellent communication skills
Experience with many or all of the following technical solutions: Cisco Meraki switches and firewalls, multi-tenant AWS environments, enterprise security and antivirus platforms, infrastructure monitoring suites, MS Active Directory administration inc. group policy
Demonstrated experience with concepts, practices and architecture related to cloud technologies
Advanced problem solving and diagnostic capabilities
Desirable:
Relevant industry recognised certifications, (eg: CCNA or greater, ECMS, AWS CCP)
ITIL Foundations Certified
Practical experience with configuring international network environments
Experience supporting internal dev-ops and engineering teams
What’s in it for you?
Besides the opportunity to work for a global company that is customer and people focused. We offer:
An award-winning flexible working culture with a truly flexible working environment –– we don’t get hung up on location, we are interested in achieving outcomes for and delivering to our customers.
A focus on learning and development – we have a sleek onboarding and L&D platform – get up to speed quickly and continue learning on your Vix journey
Paid parental leave
Active social club and lots of company activities

Sounds good? Then apply now. Get on board here!
Add your resume and anything else to showcase why you would be a great addition to our team. Don’t forget to include confirmation of your working rights as we can only accept application from candidates in the location advertised with existing working rights.
No recruitment agencies, please! We won’t accept any introductions.
Vix Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all people and want to build a workforce as diverse as the community we serve. Job Type

Sydney NSW, Australia

Full-time

About the Role
Argenti is a professional service company specialising in cloud computing. We assist our clients to modernize and consolidate IT infrastructure, automate workloads, and pursue next-generation innovation. We’re now seeking an experienced Microsoft Dynamics Engineer to help our clients modernize a vital system.
The Role & Capabilities

Development of digital forms within Microsoft Dynamics 2016 v9.0 on prem
Ability to use TSQL within sql server database to be able to troubleshoot and assist in identifying the root cause of the defect which may reside within the database
Budling plugins and workflows for defined applications
Using Azure dev/ops server to assist the developer with automated building and deploying of software code between the development and test environments
Designing and programming code and API’s in .NET
Building windows forms, windows services in .NET
Ability to develop using JavaScript / HTML
SQL server integration services and Kingsway soft
Integrating SQL server database using TSQL

Experience required:

Minimum of 3 years’ experience in software development.
Demonstrated experience in the configuration of MS Dynamics 365
Demonstrated experience working with Azure DevOps
.NET
Microsoft Dynamics
TSQL, SQL,
Azure DevOps
JavaScript, HTML

About the Company
Argenti is an ISO 9001 certified Cloud Engineering firm, providing end-to-end IT solutions for clients including architecture assessment, application design and development, and system modernisation across multiple clouds.

Must be based in Australia

OUR CLIENT:
Work with one of the largest, well known IT vendors in today’s time.


THE ROLE:
As a Network Services Specialist you will be responsible for communicating and producing viable technical solutions to meet the organisations needs.


RESPONSIBILITY:
Your key responsibilities will include:

Understand client requirements to develop and address solutions
Work closely with Senior Architects to achieve and create deliverables
Develop techniques to reduce workload and improve efficiency
Create processes to help develop and evolve technologies
Propose new, creative solutions for complex issues

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:

Cisco CCNP certification (CCIE preferred RS, DC, or enterprise)
Experience in designing and developing large scale systems

About the Company

Australia’s leading Credit Reporting FinTech company is looking for a Dev ops Engineer

About You

Demonstrated teamwork skills including the ability to work autonomously and as part of a team. Ability to manage priorities and task scheduling with minimal direction. Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to write concisely for documentation, project specifications and business cases

Skills and Experience


Have a deep understanding of AWS components like EC2, Terraform, IAM, RDS, S3, DynamoDB, Kinesis, SQS.

Proficiency in programming/scripting languages. (Python, Bash)
Experience operating software in production: building monitoring into your code, tweaking dashboards, defining alerts (Grafana, PagerDuty and AWS CloudWatch
Experience diagnosing and resolving problems in high-throughput web applications and network services.

Experience Time series databases such as InfluxDB.
Experience and knowledge of building micro services and working with containers.
Experience with incident management processes and ITIL terminology for incident and problem management

Benefits

High performing and supportive team
Great work/life balance with hybrid culture
Personal development and growth opportunities
Free gym membership
Fully stocked kitchen and bar

Job description

Design and Development of a leading SaaS Solution within the FinTech industry.
Fully remote working position based from any location.
Excellent salary package

Client Details
One of the fastest-growing Australian fintech scale up companies who have been operating for over 5 years. This role provides the opportunity to be a part of a progressive company at the forefront of technology within their industry.

Job Offer
You will be pivotal to the continued growth and security of the organisation and will cover all aspects of full stack, secure development, workflow engineering and integration.

The company use Angular as their preferred for front end development and PHP and moving towards NodeJS for their backend. They work in Azure Devops environment using CI/CD pipelines, Docker and Kubernetes.

You will be working in a fast paced company who work on daily Agile stand up's. They also offer a full flexible working environment which is primarily from home and as such these roles can be based anywhere.

Experience within the following technologies is required:
Strong Angular skills
Node.JS
Postgres or MYSQL or Sql Server database experience
Experience within an Azure or AWS Dev Ops environment would be advantageous with exposure to Docker and/or Kubernetes

Full job description available upon request.

For a confidential chat please get in touch with Kevin Howell at FutureYou on either kevinhowell@future-you.com.au or call 0439210056. Alternatively please apply online Job details

job_title: DevOps Engineer - Data Engineering Team - harrison.ai
listing_jobDesc:
As part of the Data, Engineering and IT team, you’ll be a solution integrator who helps build effective technology environments for our stakeholders.
 join us?
 Do work that matters. We’re pioneering AI technologies that help raise the standard of healthcare for millions of people every day.
 Well-funded and global, backed by world-class investors including Blackbird Ventures, Skip Capital and Horizon Ventures. Raised Australia’s largest Series B ($129m) in 2021.
Work with a bunch of awesome, genuine people who are passionate about what they do.
 Flexible and remote-friendly working
Make a real impact. You won’t be another ‘cog in the wheel’ here. We give full trust and autonomy for you to be heard, to work on the big hairy projects – and to make a real difference.
Grow your career with us. We’re big believers in lifelong learning. You’ll be given a $1000 personal L&D budget, access to LinkedIn Learning, plus opportunities for internal mobility to fast-track your career.
 Market-leading parental support including 16 weeks gender-neutral paid parental leave and $10,000 support for egg or sperm freezing.
 Do your best work and have fun doing it with unlimited wellbeing leave, monthly meditations, inclusive team events, and lots more!

About your role
The efficient collection, storage and delivery of high-quality data is critical to harrison.ai’s mission of delivering impossible healthcare using artificial intelligence. As a DevOps Engineer in the Data Engineering team, you will use cutting edge engineering technologies to build a world-leading data engineering platform, providing harrison.ai’s AI engineers with fast and efficient access to an array of petabyte-size data sources. From data collection and labelling to model training and evaluation, the platform will offer a seamless experience for building best-in-category AI models from end to end.
In this role you will report to the Head of Data Engineering and work in partnership with the infrastructure engineers within the harrison.ai Data Engineering team. You will build high-quality software to power our data labelling efforts, improve data processing pipelines, provide controlled API access to our data lake, and manage our various AI model training infrastructure. You will be successful in this role by combining your skills in building production quality software with curiosity and a strong desire to grow in your career and learn new skills.

At harrison.ai we take pride in pushing technical boundaries and finding solutions for often loosely defined problems. While building together you will be part of a team culture that highly values, supports and respects each other. As a team we constantly look to improve upon our practices and processes, with a strong emphasis on introspection, open feedback and continuous improvement.
What you'll do:
Work with the Data Engineering software team to develop high quality infrastructure for the data pipelines, services and APIs of the harrison.ai data platform built on AWS. You will be using a range of services and applications such as: Kinesis & Firehose, Athena, Glue EC2, ECS, Lambda Functions, SQS & S3 and workload schedulers such as Hashicorp Nomad and Slurm,
Work with the harrison.ai Applied AI teams to ensure efficient availability of a variety of data and label sources for model training and development,
Work with the Data Engineering Infrastructure team to manage, support and improve the physical ML Training Cluster,
Effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences,
Keep across latest trends in infrastructure, dev-ops and data engineering while always looking for opportunities to push the boundaries of performance, accessibility and maintenance; and
Work within the highly regulated environment of medical device development and sensitive data storage.
About you:
Experience designing solutions in public clouds such as AWS and deploying and managing on-premises infrastructure.
Experience designing and maintaining infrastructure for large datasets including technologies such as AWS S3, Athena, RedShift, Presto.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code technologies such as Terraform and Ansible.
Experience with microservice architecture and design, API's, CI/CD and containerisation.
Have worked in previous cloud / Solutions Architect or Dev-Ops roles.
Relevant tertiary qualifications or comparable experience.
Nice to haves:
Experience developing and deploying cloud / on-prem infrastructure.
Experience in programming in scripting languages such as Python or Bash.
AWS Solutions Architect certification or similar
What we’re about
We're problem solvers, redefining what’s possible in healthcare through AI Technology. Our mission is to raise the standard of healthcare for millions of patients every day.
Yes, we’re a technology company and yes, we’re leveraging the latest AI technologies, but people are at the heart of everything we do.
Since 2019, harrison.ai and its ventures have scaled rapidly to 250 employees worldwide with Series funding of almost $160 million. Our AI software has helped to create more lives through IVF, as well as enabling faster, more accurate diagnosis of medical images via our joint venture annalise.ai. Soon, we’ll be helping with early cancer detection in pathology though our newest joint venture, Franklin.ai.
And we’re just getting started.
A role with harrison.ai means you’ll be a part of our unique joint venture model – giving you access and opportunity to do impactful work across a range of healthcare domains.
Help us shape the future of AI in healthcare. And most importantly, help us make a real difference in people’s lives.
What's next?
If you’re inspired by what we're up to, please apply now and we'll be in touch soon.
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity’s not a buzzword here, it’s in our DNA. Diverse perspectives shape our culture and make our work better. That’s why we’re committed to building inclusive teams that represent a variety of backgrounds and skills. If you need any reasonable adjustments, accessibility assistance or would like to note which pronouns you use at any stage of our hiring process, just contact us at accommodations: people@harrison.ai. We look forward to hearing from you. As part of the Data, Engineering and IT team, you’ll be a solution integrator who helps build effective technology environments for our stakeholders.
 join us?
 Do work that matters. We’re pioneering AI technologies that help raise the standard of healthcare for millions of people every day.
 Well-funded and global, backed by world-class investors including Blackbird Ventures, Skip Capital and Horizon Ventures. Raised Australia’s largest Series B ($129m) in 2021.
